Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Si eres un ingeniero al que le apasiona crear productos innovadores que obtengan decenas de millones de vistas de páginas al día, Indeed te está buscando.Indeed ofrece a los desarrolladores inteligentes como tú, un complejo ecosistema de desarrollo con ciclos de lanzamiento cortos.Busca cada semana el lanzamiento de varios productos que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de crecimiento de millones de empresas y candidatos en el mundo.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.The Jobseeker Profile Platform team is the source of truth for all data on every job seeker on Indeed. Our mission is to help job seekers to effectively represent themselves to employers. Our vision is to provide centralized storage and distributed processing capacity with a pluggable framework for all Indeed client teams that use job seeker data.As part of our team, you will play a key role in designing/document and leading the development of features that are robustly monitored and alarmed in production for the next generation of services that will be used by millions of job seekers every day.We are building a distributed data storage solution for job seeker data. This system will be high throughput, low latency, and must be incredibly reliable as it is a key piece of the Indeed ecosystem. It will provide internal client teams self-service abilities such as read, process, and update for individual job seekers data or groups of job seeker data.Who You AreResponsabilidades:Como ingeniero de software del equipo de crecimiento de SMB, estarás a cargo de desarrollar software que sirva de guía a las empresas para publicar ofertas de empleo de alta calidad que puedan conseguir un buen desempeño en los resultados de las búsquedas de Indeed.Desarrollarás IU y API que guíen a las empresas y les señalen los problemas de sus ofertas de empleo que podrían estar evitando que sean cubiertas.Formarás parte de un equipo de colaboración de ingenieros, diseñadores de experiencias de usuarios y gerentes de producto sumamente talentosos. Con frecuencia indagamos en la información disponible en Indeed para analizar, fundamentar y desarrollar soluciones para los problemas adecuados.Si te gusta revisar la información, analizarla y estudiarla de distintas formas para poder aportar conocimiento interesante, este es tu lugar ideal.Requisitos:Maestría en Ciencias de la informática, Ingeniería computacional, Ingeniería eléctrica, Matemáticas o alguna otra carrera afín del área técnica computacional, con más de 5 años de experiencia en programación con al menos un año en alguno de los siguientes lenguajes: Java, JavaScript o Python.Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo de aplicaciones de pila completa con React y Redux.Experiencia en GraphQL deseable.Más de 3 años de experiencia como líder de ingenieros júnior.experiencia significativa en sistemas de alto rendimiento a gran escala.This team is seeking an experienced Java engineer that is familiar with the standard Java technologies and has experience working at scale. We are a deliberate team that drives development based on careful planning and a data-driven approach to new feature request.We are looking for someone who:Feels a sense of ownership in whatever they work on.Has Identified, implemented and delivered service for a specific product opportunity.Embraces continual improvement, and love to learn and develop new skillsThinks about why something needs to be built, not just what needs to be builtHas strong opinions on technical direction without a strong egoRequirements:3+ years of software development experience with programming languages and technologies such as Java.Proficient verbal and written communication in English required2+ years of experience with either NoSQL or SQL technologies.Deep understanding of the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including coding standards, code review, source control, build, test, deploy, and operations.Professional experience working with high-performance systems, large scale systems.Experience with web technologies and full stack development.Experience building solutions for high traffic web sites is a plus.Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field (Master’s is a plus).Ability to work efficiently on a remote/distributed team.Nice to have:Lead and mentored other engineers on the team.Experience with large scale distributed systems.Experience with multiple OO languages.Experience with Mongo, Kafka, AWSExperience with test-driven development.Experience with agile methodology.Who we areSomos una organización de ingeniería de rápido crecimiento y gran capacidad que está construyendo la página web de búsqueda de empleo más conocida del mundo. Con centros de ingeniería en Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokio, Singapur, Hyderabad, Dublín, Aberdeen y Vancouver, estamos mejorando la vida de las personas en todo el mundo con cada búsqueda de empleo.We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Como la página de búsqueda de empleo número 1 del mundo*, nuestra misión es “We help all people get jobs”. Nos esforzamos por conseguir un lugar de trabajo inclusivo y accesible en el que todo el mundo se sienta cómodo, y queremos ampliar nuestro equipo con personas que compartan nuestro entusiasmo por la innovación y por ofrecer la mejor experiencia posible a los/as candidatos/as.(*comScore total de visitas, septiembre de 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Job Title: Software Development Engineer in Test II
Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Un ingeniero de desarrollo de software en prueba (SDET) en Indeed es un desarrollador con la responsabilidad principal de construir la infraestructura y el soporte de herramientas para permitir que SWE escriba la automatización de prueba. Es un rol único y desafiante y brinda una inmensa oportunidad para diseñar y desarrollar marcos de trabajo de gran alcance y patrones de diseño para permitir la entrega de código de alta velocidad.Al ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.A Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Indeed is a developer with the primary responsibility of building the infrastructure and tooling support to enable SWEs to write test automation. It is a very unique and challenging role and provides immense opportunity to design and develop wide-reaching frameworks and design patterns to enable high velocity code deliveryBeing the part of the SMB team you’ll be writing code that automatically verifies the quality of the product and build out testing apis/services/tools that enable others to do so as well. Drive the strategy for testability of the product with understanding of customer usage models in real-world environmentsSDETs at Indeed are highly skilled who are able to debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement/improve tools and frameworks needed to streamline our testing process. Being a member of the product teams will work directly with other product teams and cross functional roles to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated solutions to deliver quality features with efficiency.Who You AreCalificaciones requeridas:BS o MS en Ciencias de la Computación (o equivalente)Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 5 años de experiencia como Desarrollador o SDETGran capacidad para escribir código efectivo (Java, Spring, Servicios web, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Servicios web, XML, AJAX, Microservicios, SOA, REST, JSON).Comunicación efectiva entre funciones para identificar las necesidades de herramientas, las brechas de automatización y reducir el trabajo duro en el proceso de desarrollo.Sólida experiencia con el desarrollo ágil que incorpora integración continua y entrega continua, utilizando tecnologías como GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDepure código, resuelva problemas complejos relacionados con la eficiencia y el rendimiento de nuestro software con el monitoreo de producción adecuadoDiseñar e implementar nuevas herramientas, marcos de prueba automatizados escalables que funcionen en todas las tecnologías.Fuerte experiencia en la construcción de herramientas de desarrollo y monitoreo como parte esencial del sistema de producción.Tutoría con revisiones detalladas del código fuente junto con orientación técnica para la arquitectura y el diseño en generalFuertes habilidades organizativas, priorización y entregables/resultadosCapaz de lidiar bien con problemas ambiguos/indefinidos; capacidad de pensar en abstracto.Calificaciones preferidas:Conocimientos de programación funcional.Docker, experiencia KubernetesFuerte comprensión de los fundamentos de la informática, diseño de algoritmos y estructuras de datos.Experiencia en Análisis Orientado a Objetos, Diseño (OOAD) y desarrollo de software utilizando Metodología UML, buen conocimiento de patrones de diseño J2EE y patrones de diseño Core JavaArticular de manera efectiva cualquier desafío técnico y problema indefinidoProporcionar soluciones innovadoras relacionadas con nuevas herramientas y marcos.Entrega de activos de prueba altamente personalizados con una combinación de herramientas y técnicas para brindar una excelente experiencia de usuarioEsforzarse por la escalabilidad, confiabilidad, consistencia y rendimiento del producto en producciónAl ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Required Qualifications:BS or MS in Computer Science (or equivalent)Proficient verbal and written communication in English required5+ years of experience as Developer or SDETStrong ability to write effective code ( Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Web Services, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON.)Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the development process.Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDebug code, solve complex problems related to efficiency and performance of our software with appropriate production monitoringDesign and Implement new tools, scalable automated test frameworks working across technologiesStrong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of production systemMentoring with detailed source code reviews along with technical guidance to overall architecture and designStrong organizational skills, prioritization and deliverables/resultsAble to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of functional programmingDocker, Kubernetes experienceStrong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design and data structuresExperience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of J2EE design patterns and Core Java design patternsEffectively articulate any technical challenges and undefined problemsProvide innovative solutions related to new tooling and frameworksDelivering highly customized test assets with mix of tools and techniques to provide a great user experienceStriving for Product scalability, reliability, consistency and performance in ProductionWho we areWe are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. KAVAK es el e-commerce N°1 para la compra y venta de vehículos en América Latina, proyectada como una de las empresas más grandes de la región.Hemos sido seleccionados como parte del Ranking #SúperEmpresas para trabajar 2021, así como "Emprendimiento del año 2018" por la Revista Expansión, también por el ranking #LinkedInTopStartup 2019 y 2020 como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en México y nos convertimos en la primera startup en alcanzar el estatus de unicornio (valorado en $ 1 billón de dólares) en MéxicoNuestra misión es transformar el mercado de compra y venta de segunda mano brindando la mejor experiencia, transparencia y seguridad a nuestros clientes.Como contexto, KAVAK opera en México desde hace 5 años y ha ido creciendo exponencialmente. Actualmente somos más de 5,000 kavakos en el equipo, incluyendo operaciones en Brasil y Argentina. Como parte de este crecimiento acelerado queremos garantizar que nos rodeemos del mejor talento para fortalecer nuestros equipos y así seguir construyendo la tecnología, procesos y productos que nos permitan transformar el mercado automotriz.¿Estás motivado para ser parte de esta misión y ayudarnos a construir el hub más disruptivo de Tech?EquipoNuestro equipo es la prioridad #1. Crecemos juntos y somos responsables por nuestro desarrollo. Nos encanta aprender de la retroalimentación, tomar riesgos y formarnos constantemente. Trabajamos de forma inteligente y hacemos que las cosas sucedan: ¡Work Smart & Make Shit Happen!¿Qué vas a hacer?Encontrar nuevas técnicas y tecnologías, multiplicando la eficiencia a través de herramientas y bibliotecas.Desarrollo de componentes y bibliotecas reusables.Traducir diseños y maquetas a código de alta calidad.Diseñar e implementar micro servicios escalables.Optimizar aplicaciones para maximizar su rendimiento.Diseñar e integrar APIs robustos REST/GraphQL que serán consumidas por millones de usuarios.Mantener y mejorar servicios web existentes.Trabajarás en productos con expansión internacional.¿Qué estamos buscando?Tener una mentalidad de team-player para colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios.Experiencia mayor a 2 años en desarrollo backend.Conocimientos avanzados en lenguaje Javascript/Typescript.Experiencia en desarrollo de servicios usando NodeJS.Experiencia trabajando con base de datos relacionales y NoSQL.Experiencia trabajando con bibliotecas ORM/ODM.Capacidad para escribir código claro, documentado y mantenible.Conocimiento del framework Serverless.Conocimiento y uso de metodologías ágiles como SCRUM.Conocimiento general de arquitectura y diseño de productos basados en la web.Pasión y compromiso por trabajar en un entorno de empresas emergentes.Estar familiarizado con productos de AWS (Cloudfront, Api Gateway, EC2, Lambdas, Fargate, S3, Cognito)Estudios deseables: Ingeniero en informática, computación, sistemas o afines.Si te apasiona la disrupción junto con una excelente ejecución, si te encantan los desafíos y tomar decisiones basadas en datos y estás orientado a la misión, KAVAK es el lugar para ti.Al aplicar a cualquiera de nuestras vacantes aceptas los Términos & Condiciones y la Política de Privacidad, que encuentras al final de esta página.#LI-AB

Are you a junior software engineer who writes squeaky clean code? Do you want to launch your career as a software engineer by working on fixing complicated software defects, rather than working on trivial changes to issues senior team members have already solved?This role is a ticket to working with the world's finest developers. At Trilogy, great code is the foundation of everything we do. Our company is run entirely by technical experts, and everyone on the leadership team is an expert coder. You will not report to business analysts or project managers in this role, but rather passionate software engineers like you.If you were great at writing and cleaning code in school and want to gain real-world software development experience by solving complex problems across codebases from 100+ software products, apply now!What you will be doingWriting code to fix defects, using many technologies but especially Java, JavaScript, C++, and C#.Writing automated tests to make sure the code works properly.What you won’t be doingRunning manual tests.Writing documentation.Writing specs.Software Engineer key responsibilitiesDebug code to identify what is wrong.Implement high-quality fixes that address the core issue.Create automated tests (unit tests and functional tests) to verify that the code works properly.Basic RequirementsAt least 1.5 years developing production software in Java, C#, JavaScript, or C++ (Yes, this can include internships).A degree in Computer Science or the commercial equivalent.The desire to spend at least one year with a laser focus learning to write high-quality code.Nice-to-have RequirementsExperience in a shared-services or centralized environment.Cloud development experience, especially AWS.About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced!Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Here’s some advice: If you’re in the early stages of your career, don’t join a company that is hesitant to update its technology from the 90s and adapt to new trends. Five years from now, your skill set will be dead in the water and your resume will be a non-starter.In the telecommunications industry, Totogi is the main adversary to such companies. Totogi is disrupting this multibillion-dollar industry by introducing the world’s most advanced customer management system, which allows our enterprise customers to scale at an unprecedented pace. We’re looking for telecommunications technicians to help us deliver this service to our customers.Unlike in most companies, you won’t just sit around all day pulling tickets and wondering whether you’re doing them correctly. Instead, we’re actively invested in your growth and development, providing dedicated coaches who will help you build your skill set and launch your career.If you have technical telecommunications experience and want to hitch your career to a rocket, join Totogi’s technical delivery team!What you will be doingActivating New Customers’ Services: Platform configuration for standard engagements or coding for customized engagementsContinual Learning: Totogi’s constant innovation gives you the opportunity to learn new technologies and platforms on a regular basisWhat you won’t be doingFixing outages or providing technical support for existing customersInterfacing directly with customersData Engineer key responsibilitiesBasic RequirementsExperience working with mobile network architectures (3G/4G)Telecommunications domain knowledge (ideally including SS7 stack, Sigtran, Diameter, SIP, SMPP protocols)Knowledge of MySQLAbout TotogiTotogi is focused on building telco software for the public cloud and is completely redefining how carriers engage with their subscribers to drive customer love! We are a product-driven telco software company made up of some of the best minds from the telecoms industry and the brightest engineering talent across the globe. Change the game with us.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced!Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Job Description: Our companyWe go beyond technical expertise when it comes to quality assurance. With over 10 years of experience we’ll ensure priorities to quality, expert project management, communication and superior delivery capabilities. We offer comprehensive QA services that combine the best resources with our proven methodologies to increase engineering quality, reduce cost and drive improvement of engineering efficiency.We are a fast-growing IT company in TJ. We are interested in the personal and professional growth of our employees, as well as their stability, therefore, our jobs are long term and we all work together to have a good working environment.Job descriptionThe qualified engineer will remotely work together with the teams around the world with different timezone and our US client software development team for their software testing, mainly for the manual testing / black-box testing, or some levels of automation execution. We work on different projects that are assigned to employees depending on their skills.Some of the activities to be performed are:· Supervise the software engineering processes and methods used in a project to ensure proper software quality.· Analyze software requirements, and develop effective strategies and plans necessary to ensure the quality of the final product.· Prepare the related test data and configuration environment according to the above plans.· Summarize the checkpoints and develop the test cases.· Execute the test with the specified devices and test environment.· Identify errors/bugs/faults/defects in a software, and perform preliminary triage.· Verify fixes without damaging other functions.· Prepare the report for each of the above actions.· Collaborate with different team members to ensure smooth development and higher ROI through improved product quality.Requirements (skills/experiences) for the role:· Communication skill· Fluent in English· Strong QA experience* (preferred but not required)· Self Study· Flexibility· Proactive ability to provide value-add to the product teams· Detail oriented, patient and stable· Commitment on productivity.· Potential to lead a large team for the QA processing work (preferred but not required)· Computer/software background (preferred but not required)Job Types: Full-time, New-Grad, PermanentSalary: $16,000.00 - $18,000.00 per monthAbility to commute/relocate:22106, Tijuana, B.C.: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Language:English fluently (Required)

Job Title: Software Development Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.2+ years of non-internship professional software development experienceExperience in object-oriented design and programming experience in at least one modern language, such as Java, Kotlin, C++ or C#Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Designing, implementing and launching high-quality software systems to solve complex problems with big impactWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software and automation workflowsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the companyPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solve some of our hardest engineering problemsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical fieldExperience designing and developing distributed systems with emphasis on scalability, performance and reliabilityExperience developing software systems that have been successfully delivered to customersExperience in communicating with users, technical teams and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs and product strategyExperience with the full software development lifecycle and knowledge of professional software engineering practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing and operationsDemonstrated ability to mentor junior software engineers in all aspects of their engineering skillset

Fullstack Engineer -2200066XApplicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: EnglishPreferred QualificationsDescriptionWith tremendous market success in our Cloud Applications, especially in ERP Cloud, Higher Ed institutions have expressed unprecedented interest in embarking a cloud adoption journey with Oracle. Student Information Systems, a critical functional area to complete in our SaaS footprint for Higher Ed, is one top investment priority for Oracle. With over 800+ institutions using Campus Solutions today, our charter is to strike the balance of accelerating the delivery of Student Cloud while continue to deliver value for existing Campus Solutions customers.We leverage an agile development methodology (scrum) to facilitate the development of our products. Our development practices include empowered scrum teams, continuous build and integration, weekly sprint reviews, and a heavy emphasis on testing early and often.You should be able to work independently, mentor others and be a highly contributing member of an agile team. She/he has excellent organizational, planning and time management skills, with a successful track record of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.The position is located at Guadalajara. We are looking for a hands-on senior engineer with a passion for developing our Student Cloud solution.RequirementsFront End oriented full stack developer with exposure to all layers of application and development.Excellent product development skills - designing, coding, and debugging skills in JavaScript and Java.Knowledge of RDBMS concepts.Experience of 2-10 yrs. in product development.Experience in Web services, REST etc.Thorough understanding of OO principles.The ideal candidate also has:Experience of 4-10 yrs. in product development.Solid Experience developing web UI’s using JavaScript libraries and/or frameworks (jQuery, Angular, ReactJS, etc).Experience with Agile Development (SCRUM).Experience with database design/modeling.Experience with cloud platforms, cloud technologies/deployments.Experience with enterprise software applications.Experience with Oracle Fusion Tech Stack (JDeveloper, OJET, ADF).Experience in higher education product/domain.Excellent analysis and prioritization skills.ResponsibilitiesCandidate will be responsible for:UI development using HTML, JavaScript, JQuery, AJAX etc.Ensuring high quality code is delivered, including delivering unit tests and automation.Development of Java-based REST services or servlets using Oracle ADF.Participating in code reviews.Assessing and estimating work loads.Self managing development time.Working closely with Product Architects, Product Managers, Quality Assurance, and other development teams.Communicating effectively with an international team, both written and verbally.Detailed Description and Job RequirementsAnalyze, design develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for commercial or end user applications. Writes code, completes programming and performs testing and debugging of applications.As a member of the software engineering division, you will perform high-level design based on provided external specifications. Specify, design and implement minor changes to existing software architecture. Build highly complex enhancements and resolve complex bugs. Build and execute unit tests and unit plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering as necessary to discuss minor changes to product functionality and to ensure quality and consistency across specific products.Duties and tasks are varied and complex needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.Job: Product DevelopmentLocation: MX-MX,Mexico-Guadalajara/ZapopanOther Locations: MX-MX,Mexico-Monterrey, MX-MX,Mexico-Santa FeJob Type: Regular Employee HireOrganization: Oracle

Company DescriptionIf you like challenges and willingness to overcome obstacles, we are looking for you!Bosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch, our operating areas are in four business sectors; mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology and energy and building technology.Discover in Bosch the ideal place for you.Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an Embedded Software Test Engineer (Entry Level) who is willing to work on a project where each team member contributes to the SW Development and Testing success of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) features. Technical curiosity paired with a passion for engineering is a must for this role, we are looking for someone who applies strategic problem solving and enables the team to understand even the most complex technical challenges down to the last bit. Eagerness to own Software testing activities, high-quality oriented processes and innovation initiatives.ObjectiveEmbedded SW Testing Activities for Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) SW Projects.ResponsibilitiesEmbedded Software Test: test execution, automation and documentation for Driver Assistance products.Requirement/implementation/feature testing.Test management, configuration management and documentation.Follow quality process for software development testing according to ISO26262 and ASPICEQualificationsBasic Experience in automation and execution of test specifications/scriptsBasic Experience in usage of Test and Measurement Equipment’sBasic CAN protocolKnowledge of Configuration management toolsBasic Scripting and automation techniques are an advantageVehicle networking is an advantageVery good problem solving skillsVery good communication skills.Proactivity and commitment.Additional InformationDo you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe.Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 17,000 associates.We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Welcome to Bosch!Vacancy applies to the referral program.

Job DescriptionPlatform Application Engineer - Memory Technologies will assists in providing technical support for one or many products and or product family.Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:Participating in new product development representing the customers technical needs creating competitive analysis from a technical perspective.Developing and presenting technical product training materials.Working with the sales team to help resolve customers technical questions.Participating in customers visits and presentations.Creating and maintaining data sheets and application notes.Acting as technical experts/consultants/analysts and program managers.Responding to customer requests or events as they occur.Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgement.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Defining driving resolution across multiple teams and representing technical issues while maintaining centralized communication across multiple geographies.Influencing and customer orientation skills.Verbal and written communication skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Electronics Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).4+ years of experience in either of the following:High Speed I/O (Input Output) Communication protocols (PCIe, DDR (Double Data Rate), etc.)Debugging (including experience working with and analyzing output from test equipment such as the Lauterbach, oscilloscopes logic analyzers and protocol analyzers).Advanced English level.Preferred Qualifications:Broad understanding of Intel processor-based platforms.History with microprocessor architecture chipset architecture system architecture board design, pre silicon, validation, post silicon, validation, and/or firmware BIOS.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionResponsible for creation of Test specifications / Develop / execute manual / automated test lists to validate product features in Lab/Car environment.Specific duties:Responsible for creation of Test specifications based on SW requirements.Develop & execute manual/automated test lists to validate product features in Lab/Car environment.Debugging and troubleshooting software.Development scripts to automate tests.Responsible for Documentation of tests and issue trackingClose interaction with Global TeamQualificationsSkills, Knowledge and Experience Levels:Bachelor degree in Automotive Engineering, Electronics, Mechatronics, Computer Engineering, or similar.Automate tests.Experience with CAN and Diagnosis standards is a big plus.Verification and Validation.Testing.Nice to have:Overview on tools like DOOR’s, CANalyzer, CANoe, CAN stressExperience in developing according to ASPICE or CMMI preferred.Experience with CAN and Diagnosis standards is a big plus.Experience with Agile methodologies.Familiarity with automotive coding rules.Experience with source control management tools (i.e. Subversion, GIT, MKS).Additional InformationBosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 13,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Be a Part of the Technology RevolutionThere has never been a more exciting time to be part of an automotive technology company like Visteon. No industry offers more fast-paced change and opportunity than today’s automotive industry. We are in the midst of a mobility revolution that will completely change the way we interact with our vehicles, reduce the number of car accidents and fatalities, and make the world a cleaner place. Visteon is at the epicenter of this mobility revolution. Two major trends in the automotive industry – the shift to electric vehicles and vehicles with autonomous safety technologies – have created unique opportunities for Visteon. We are the only automotive provider solely focused exclusively on cockpit electronics – the fastest-growing segment in the industry.Company CultureWorking at Visteon is a journey in which our employees can develop their strengths and advance their careers while making a difference globally. Join us and help change the world and how we interact with our vehicles. Visteon is where the best technical talent creates the future.About VisteonVisteon is the only global automotive technology company solely focused on designing, engineering, and manufacturing innovative cockpit electronics and connected car solutions – the fastest-growing segment in the industry. Our technologies create a more enjoyable, safe, and connected driving experience.Headquartered in Van Buren Township, Michigan, United States, Visteon employs about 11,000 diverse people at more than 40 facilities in 18 countries. Visteon had sales of approximately $3 billion in 2019. Learn more at www.Visteon.comEmbedded Software Engineer - GUIKey Job ResponsibilitiesExperience with automotive embedded software development, including agile development processes, continuous integration environments.Must have C++ programming experience.Experience in any rapid design and development of user interfaces (UIs) for the automotive industry or other embedded applications.Experience in designing GUI with visual tools for creating high-fidelity branded UIs.Develop embedded software for application software components for vehicle features for Battery Management Systems (BMS).Review and analyze system requirements and develop SRS.Create, document and execute unit test procedures.Create and Execute unit/component/functional tests.Knowledge of modern automotive hardware and software architectures.Experience in working in highly distributed teams and with multiple suppliers.Strong skills in system analysis and debugging.Analyze, resolve and track defects to closure.DEGREE PREFERRED: Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree either in CS, EE, EC Engineering.DESIRED COMPETENCIES/EXPERIENCE:5 years of experience in embedded electronics SW development.Experience with C, C++ programming in 8, 16, and 32-bit embedded environments.Experience in implementing Design Patterns is must have.Experience in CAN \ CANoe or relevant communication protocol is a must have.Clear understanding of Agile SW processes and related software methodologies.Experience developing software with a defined software development process (e.g. ASPICE, CMMI).Good experience with configuration and change management tools.Experience with static code analysis tools QAC, Coverity.Ability to work in a global environment across different time zones.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Visteon is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce!

#ComputerScienceDegree #MechatronicsDegree #ElectronicDegreeAs ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineer you’ll help to develop Long and Short-Range Radar sensors, Camera Vision systems, LiDAR and other related advanced vehicle sensing components to enable driving functions and other automated driving features to make Autonomous Mobility happen.ADAS is currently developing functions such as Full-Speed Range Adaptive Cruise Controls, Lane Departure Warning, Blind Spot Detection, Forward Object Detection and Collision Mitigation Systems.A Testing Engineer is required to test the product or system to ensure it functions properly and meets its requirements. Test Engineers rigorously examine products, using creativity and technical skill to fix bugs and devise testing systems. You’ll design, implement and execute the necessary tests to verify the embedded software that enables the driving functions and features.The ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineers aren't just manual testers, if a test/process can be automated the ADAS Test engineer is responsible for the automation. You’ll write scripts to automate testing and tools, so testing is done on a continuous basis.Responsibilities:Design, develop and execute Software test specifications (test cases, procedures, scenarios and test plans) based on the customer requirements for ADAS products.Planning and tracking of tests (esp. test goals, test objects, test efforts, resources and schedules).Contribute to the design of new test environments and develop test automation tools.Automate tests using test frameworks.Work with development teams to fulfil architecture & design requirements

TasksContinental Engineering Services (CES) is seeking for an AUTOSAR Software Engineer. As an AUTOSAR software developer for automotive applications you will be integral part of a global and diverse team for the next generation of vehicles. Our engineer will be responsible for software decisions, analyze requirements, configure BSW (Basic Software), integrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules, assist customer in resolving configuration errors, design software architecture, maintenance of different AUTOSAR components and many other specific applications for projects within the Chassis & Safety division such as:Advanced Electronic Brake Systems: our engineers work with Continental’s advances brake unit to maintain, and develop solutions that are benchmark in the industry such as Antilock braking, traction and stability control, regenerative braking to enhance electric and hybrid vehicles cruising range, supporting ADAS functions to brake autonomously the vehicle in emergency situations, etc.Automated Driver Assistance Systems: with the help of our advanced environment sensors, lidars, cameras and radars our software engineer contribute to provide solutions for driver assistance and automated driving functions such as blind spot detection, driver monitoring, emergency break assist, intelligent headlight assist, surround views, etc.Active Damping Control Systems: CES engineers requires to work with state-of-the-art technologies with AUTOSAR architecture to solve the conflicts that exist between optimal riding comfort and agile handling by creating software to adjust damping force on every wheel depending load and driving conditions.Airbag Controllers and other safety solutions: our engineer also focus in occupant protections such airbag controller, adapting platform to customer needs and government regulations, the design of software with impressive quality is required in these products to make sure our software saves lives when accident occur.Our AUTOSAR Software engineers share common goals to drive and contribute to the automotive industry with the goal to protect all people inside and outside the vehicle, to innovate in mobility solutions, and ultimately, achieve Continental’s Vision Zero: zero fatalities, zero injuries, zero accidents.Core Responsibilities:AUTOSAR Software development tasksGather and analyze OEMs Software RequirementsPerform software testing to detect functional, logic or implementation errorsConfigure BSW (Basic Software) according with OEMs requirementsIntegrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules with different AutoCore tools (e.g. EB Tressos, Davinci, etc.)Analyze customer bug reports and provide solutionsWork with diverse teamsEstimate work package efforts. Evaluate the impact of engineering modifications in the software.Coach/support team membersAdditional Responsibilities:Flexibility to work in variety of different automotive projectsSoftware Project Technical Lead tasksSupport technical discussions with customerSupport/Test the developed modules in the vehicleSupport requirements engineering and elicitation processesPerform unit testing and software debuggingAssistance with other tasks as needed and determined by ManagementDocumentation of detail software development plan, test plans, test design, analysis, computer modeling, prototype/production test scripts and specification releasesDefine strategies to continuously improve processes and tools.QualificationsRequired Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in e.g. Electronics, Computer Science, Mechatronics or equivalent3-8 years of experience in AUTOSAR Software Development activitiesGood knowledge in embedded software development environments and tools including IDE, editors, compilers, linkers, emulators, debuggers, analysis, and monitoring toolsGood knowledge of 32-bit microcontrollers (e.g. NXP, Infineon, Renesas, etc.)Proficient programming experience in C languageProficient with CAN and related toolsExperience with processes and configuration management tools (git, IMS, others)Good understanding of real-time system architecture/design, HW related SW development using microcontrollers, HW boards, PCBsExcellent listening and communications skills – written and verbalStrong problem-solving skillsAvailability to travel to USA, Germany and China is desirable (short periods)Preferred Qualifications:Strong experience working with embedded software platformsExperience with scripting languages e.g. Python, PerlExperience using Vector toolsAbout usContinental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2020, Continental generated sales of €37.7 billion and currently employs more than 192,000 people in 58 countries and markets. On October 8, 2021, the company celebrated its 150th anniversary. The Autonomous Mobility and Safety business area develops, produces and integrates active and passive safety technologies and controls vehicle dynamics. The product portfolio ranges from electronic and hydraulic brake and chassis control systems to sensors, advanced driver assistance systems, airbag electronics and sensors, electronic air suspension systems and cleaning systems for windscreens and headlights. Autonomous Mobility and Safety has a high level of systems expertise in the interconnectivity of individual components. These make driving safer and easier and pave the way for autonomous mobility.KeyfactsJob-ID219393BRFunctionEngineeringNice to knowContinentals Spezialisten aus unterschiedlichen Disziplinen treiben den Trend des Automatisierten Fahrens mit aller Innovationskraft voran.App. w. professional exp.

Tasks#ComputerScienceDegree #MechatronicsDegree #ElectronicDegreeAs ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineer you’ll help to develop Long and Short-Range Radar sensors, Camera Vision systems, LiDAR and other related advanced vehicle sensing components to enable driving functions and other automated driving features to make Autonomous Mobility happen.ADAS is currently developing functions such as Full-Speed Range Adaptive Cruise Controls, Lane Departure Warning, Blind Spot Detection, Forward Object Detection and Collision Mitigation Systems.A Testing Engineer is required to test the product or system to ensure it functions properly and meets its requirements. Test Engineers rigorously examine products, using creativity and technical skill to fix bugs and devise testing systems. You’ll design, implement and execute the necessary tests to verify the embedded software that enables the driving functions and features.The ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineers aren't just manual testers, if a test/process can be automated the ADAS Test engineer is responsible for the automation. You’ll write scripts to automate testing and tools, so testing is done on a continuous basis.Responsibilities:Design, develop and execute Software test specifications (test cases, procedures, scenarios and test plans) based on the customer requirements for ADAS products.Planning and tracking of tests (esp. test goals, test objects, test efforts, resources and schedules).Contribute to the design of new test environments and develop test automation tools.Automate tests using test frameworks.Work with development teams to fulfil architecture & design requirementsQualificationsIn addition to a Bachelor’s of Science degree in Computer Science, Mechatronics, Electronics or similar; it is required the following knowledge and skills:Understanding of the software development life cycle.Understanding of embedded systems.Basic to intermediate C, C++ or Python language programming knowledge.Debugging Skills (log file analysis, oscilloscope, …)TroubleshootingThe Testing Engineer also needs to be tactful and diplomatic to maintain a good working relationship with the software developers. Other skills and competencies needed are:Critical thinker and problem-solving skillsDecision-making abilityAttention to detailsAbility to work in a team as well as an individualFluent EnglishGood communication and presentation skills.Technical writing; be able to convey information clearly and accurately.CreativityWilling to travel for training and Go-&-See (internationally and/or domestically).BenefitsMitarbeiter werben MitarbeiterLebensversicherungFlexible ArbeitszeitenGesundheitsvorsorgeKantineReisekostenzulageKarriereberatung und TrainingsangebotGehaltsbonusAbout usContinental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Job DescriptionThis position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.This position aligns to that transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Transition is expected to close in late 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.The System Validation Engineer will be responsible for, but not limited to:Integrating and debugging software across the stack for a specific product, platform, feature, or technology throughout the product lifecycle, including pre-silicon development, power on, and/or post-silicon development.Debugging software across multiple layers of the software stack including firmware, drivers, and operating systems.Developing a software debug plan and associated methodologies.Analyzing issues, managing sightings from various validation streams, determining root cause, and driving or developing improvements. Driving project stress and stability and supports power, performance, and key task forces.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or STEM related field. Documentation related to bachelor's degree completion will be required4+ years of experience in either one of the following areas:Debugging hardware or software issues on Storage, Server, Platform or similar environments.Development and/or debug in Linux or Windows environments.Validation disciplines experience, system/platform level debug, or root cause isolation methodologies.Preferred Qualifications:2+ years of experience in either of the following areas:Low level code development/Debug for OS Drivers, FW, or Kernel.PCIe or NVMe protocol and debug (including debug tools and protocol analyzers).NAND memory validation.Experience with industry specifications such as PCIe NVME, OPAL, eSSC.PC Platform, BIOS, Drivers, or IO technologies.Continuous integration and agile methodologies.Inside this Business GroupEmployees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel.

Job DescriptionThe Memory and I/O Technologies Team (MIO) is excited to announce an opportunity to join our growing team within Intel's Datacenter and AI Group.MIO works to define and validate DRAM memory and I/O technologies for Intel, and we have exciting opportunities to help improve the next generations of DRAM main memory.The qualified candidate would collaborate with engineering teams in Intel and in the DRAM industry to validate DRAM memory in Intel's server platforms. Our team members are passionate about growth, innovation, and collaboration and we are looking for individuals who want to learn and grow so we can best support our customers with the highest quality possible. If you are looking for a growth environment, you could be a great fit for our team. On any given day in our development labs, you would test DRAM memory on Intel's platforms using the latest in memory test equipment, collect data across platforms and memory technologies, assess results and collaborate with engineering teams to drive improvements. It will be necessary to continuously keep up to date on emerging DRAM test improvements and apply new learnings to improve internal test processes.As a memory validation engineer in MIO your responsibilities would include but not limited to:Create memory validation test plans. Use platform-level hardware and software tools to ensure performance to memory specifications.Responsible for execution of DDR memory stress tests in system and debug of failures.Interface with Architecture, Design, and Validation teams to review and address debug results.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry-relevant job experience, internship experiences and or school work/classes/research.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field (Documentation related to bachelor's degree completion will be required).2 years of experience in one or more of the following areas:Python ORPerforming debug or testing of computer systems ORLogic analyzer, oscilloscope, bit error rate tester, memory testers, or other electronics test equipment.Preferred Qualifications:Experience in some of the following areas: C/C++ coding, database, platform validation, or DDR or LPDDR memory testingInside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Job Title: System Software Engineer - C / C++ / Rust / Kernel - Linux container technology
Job Description: We are hiring a systems-level C programmer to focus performance critical, and security-critical, low level system libraries critical to Linux container capabilities. We are also interested in Rust for system-level programming in Ubuntu and more widely in Canonical.The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.What you will doDesign, implement and document features in low level system container libraries (LXC and LXCFS)Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system testsCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel, 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external eventsWho you areYou are curious, flexible, articulate and accountableYou value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivatedYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have experience with system programming in C on LinuxYou have knowledge or interest in Linux kernel features like namespaces, cgroups, networking or storageYou have experience with two or more of cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community.Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.#LI-Remote #Stack

An embedded software engineer will be responsible for analyzing requirements, designing, developing, integrating and verifying AUTOSAR Basic SW Platform functionalities in a realtime embedded environment, for various electronic control units. Technical interface to local project for AUTOSAR Basic SW Platform topics with interaction with Project leads and SW Architects. Responsible for delivering a working and tested AUTOSAR Basic SW Platform on the project Hardware sample

Be part of the Vehicle Dynamics (VED) Software group at Continental Queretaro as a Basic SW developer and participate to the creation of our MK1xx and MKCx products: the Brake systems used in conventional, electric and autonomous cars of today and tomorrow.Our ECU is the main Chassis controller and provides functions to control the vehicle dynamics as the car trajectory (ABS, ACC, AYC, HSA, IPB, TCS...) for global car manufacturers in America (USA, Mexico, Brazil).In VED Software, you will have the opportunity to practice the benchmark tools of our Autonomous Mobility & Safety Division and the state-of-the-art methods for Software development environment using AUTOSAR, GIT, Matlab Simulink, Vector tools...You will be joining an international team and be guided by experienced engineers into the different phases of SW creation: Design, Implementation, Testing in SIL and HIL environment.Your main tasks:Development and analysis of software for safety-relevant braking systems from concept to production maturityContribution to system definition and deriving the resulting software requirements with regard to signal conditioning, fault monitoring and control of our productsCollect the requirements addressed at Customer level to Software engineering level and analyze them considering the Software architecture and Software development standards.Prepare the Software detailed design specification to meet the functional and non-functional requirements.Design the test procedure and the code logic to ensure that the design specification is fulfilled along with the Software integration tests related to the concerned Software component.Develop Software components and Software components tests for debugging and release testing.Execution of tests in simulation and hardware benches, coordination of the overall verification process and evaluation of test results.Document all work results according to the process in place (derived from Automotive SPICE).Solve and coordinate implementation of complex workpackages that involve multiple engineers or mid-sized projects in different locations.Develop and improve on existing testing methods, tools and procedures.

Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Si eres un ingeniero al que le apasiona crear productos innovadores que obtengan decenas de millones de vistas de páginas al día, Indeed te está buscando.Indeed ofrece a los desarrolladores inteligentes como tú, un complejo ecosistema de desarrollo con ciclos de lanzamiento cortos.Busca cada semana el lanzamiento de varios productos que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de crecimiento de millones de empresas y candidatos en el mundo.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.The Jobseeker Profile Platform team is the source of truth for all data on every job seeker on Indeed. Are you a customer support engineer who is obsessed with delivering a great experience, but you’ve already mastered your current products and are wondering what’s next? Or are you a software engineer looking for a way to get introduced to an immense set of product architectures, domains, and tech stacks? Sure, you could join any new company and learn their handful of products, but we think we have something better.We are the Customer Support team at Trilogy. We support over 100 unique enterprise software products - everything from mobile app development platforms to database load-balancers. We not only have the opportunity to learn, use, and support these products, we also become deep technical experts who can solve problems no one has seen before. There’s a lot to learn, so we have weekly “learning tickets” to ensure the whole team is up to speed.This role is the highest-level customer support engineer we have - our tickets cannot be elevated above you. The problems are complex. The solutions might be configuration, database-level, or even code-level. Trilogy takes pride in its customer support quality and makes sure customers are impressed at every interaction. It’s an immense responsibility, but one that can put you on the fast track to career advancement.What you will be doingImpressing customers by solving complex or new problemsGrowing your product knowledge, in breadth and depthDigging deep to discover the root causes and solutions of issues - exploring source code, databases, logs, and tracesWhat you won’t be doingAnswering the same questions over and over againProviding trivial or basic troubleshootingWriting knowledge base articlesTechnical Support Engineer key responsibilitiesResolving elevated customer ticketsExpanding product and technology expertise by working on “learning tickets”Basic Requirements2+ years of software development2+ years of experience with customer-facing technical supportAvailability for 8-hour shiftsAbout TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced!Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Here’s some advice: If you’re in the early stages of your career, don’t join a company that is hesitant to update its technology from the 90s and adapt to new trends. Five years from now, your skill set will be dead in the water and your resume will be a non-starter.In the telecommunications industry, Totogi is the main adversary to such companies. Totogi is disrupting this multibillion-dollar industry by introducing the world’s most advanced customer management system, which allows our enterprise customers to scale at an unprecedented pace. We’re looking for telecommunications technicians to help us deliver this service to our customers.Unlike in most companies, you won’t just sit around all day pulling tickets and wondering whether you’re doing them correctly. Instead, we’re actively invested in your growth and development, providing dedicated coaches who will help you build your skill set and launch your career.If you have technical telecommunications experience and want to hitch your career to a rocket, join Totogi’s technical delivery team!What you will be doingActivating New Customers’ Services: Platform configuration for standard engagements or coding for customized engagementsContinual Learning: Totogi’s constant innovation gives you the opportunity to learn new technologies and platforms on a regular basisWhat you won’t be doingFixing outages or providing technical support for existing customersInterfacing directly with customersData Engineer key responsibilitiesBasic RequirementsExperience working with mobile network architectures (3G/4G)Telecommunications domain knowledge (ideally including SS7 stack, Sigtran, Diameter, SIP, SMPP protocols)Knowledge of MySQLAbout TotogiTotogi is focused on building telco software for the public cloud and is completely redefining how carriers engage with their subscribers to drive customer love! We are a product-driven telco software company made up of some of the best minds from the telecoms industry and the brightest engineering talent across the globe. Change the game with us.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. Are you a junior software engineer who writes squeaky clean code? Do you want to launch your career as a software engineer by working on fixing complicated software defects, rather than working on trivial changes to issues senior team members have already solved?This role is a ticket to working with the world's finest developers. At Trilogy, great code is the foundation of everything we do. Our company is run entirely by technical experts, and everyone on the leadership team is an expert coder. You will not report to business analysts or project managers in this role, but rather passionate software engineers like you.If you were great at writing and cleaning code in school and want to gain real-world software development experience by solving complex problems across codebases from 100+ software products, apply now!What you will be doingWriting code to fix defects, using many technologies but especially Java, JavaScript, C++, and C#.Writing automated tests to make sure the code works properly.What you won’t be doingRunning manual tests.Writing documentation.Writing specs.Software Developer key responsibilitiesDebug code to identify what is wrong.Implement high-quality fixes that address the core issue.Create automated tests (unit tests and functional tests) to verify that the code works properly.Basic RequirementsAt least 1.5 years developing production software in Java, C#, JavaScript, or C++ (Yes, this can include internships).A degree in Computer Science or the commercial equivalent.The desire to spend at least one year with a laser focus learning to write high-quality code.Nice-to-have RequirementsExperience in a shared-services or centralized environment.Cloud development experience, especially AWS.About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced!Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Are you the best performer on the team who picks up new technologies twice as fast as everyone else?
