Job Title: System Software Engineer - C / C++ / Rust / Kernel - Linux container technology
Job Description: We are hiring a systems-level C programmer to focus performance critical, and security-critical, low level system libraries critical to Linux container capabilities. We are also interested in Rust for system-level programming in Ubuntu and more widely in Canonical.The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.What you will doDesign, implement and document features in low level system container libraries (LXC and LXCFS)Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system testsCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel, 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external eventsWho you areYou are curious, flexible, articulate and accountableYou value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivatedYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have experience with system programming in C on LinuxYou have knowledge or interest in Linux kernel features like namespaces, cgroups, networking or storageYou have experience with two or more of cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community.Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.#LI-Remote #Stack

Job Title: Software Development Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.2+ years of non-internship professional software development experienceExperience in object-oriented design and programming experience in at least one modern language, such as Java, Kotlin, C++ or C#Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Designing, implementing and launching high-quality software systems to solve complex problems with big impactWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software and automation workflowsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the companyPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solve some of our hardest engineering problemsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical fieldExperience designing and developing distributed systems with emphasis on scalability, performance and reliabilityExperience developing software systems that have been successfully delivered to customersExperience in communicating with users, technical teams and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs and product strategyExperience with the full software development lifecycle and knowledge of professional software engineering practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing and operationsDemonstrated ability to mentor junior software engineers in all aspects of their engineering skillset

Job Title: Software Engineer - Entry User Interfaces Flight Management Systems
Job Description: Job Description SummaryIn this role you will be responsible for executing, designing and updating test procedures for Navigation and Guidance systems and/or sub-components,in a global Software Engineering organization in across- functional and multicultural environment.Job DescriptionRoles and ResponsibilitiesSupport Design and implementation of Embedded Software and Software Requirements verification in a cross-function environment.Consistently develop and document code and test procedures , interpret results and use best practices with guidance.Effectively communicate/provide presentations in project communication rhythm, such as weekly status meetings, SCRUM meetings, progress reports and retrospectives.Self-aware of assignments on time delivery.Support execution of efficiency or productivity opportunities.Consistent understanding of the overall product functionality and technical basis of operation.Understand key elements of digital electronics, systems engineering, software methodologies and avionics.Required QualificationsSkilled in more than one of the stages of the Software Development Life Cycle is needed for the position.Skilled in Programming Languages and Object Oriented Programming.Solid Knowledge of Embedded Software Development using C or Ada programming languages.Able to understand and apply engineering requirements.Understand Software Validation and Verification principles.Strong interpersonal skills.Executes tasks with supervision.Legal Right to Work in Mexico.This role requires basic experience in the Engineering/Technology & Embedded SW Development. Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's degree on Computer Systems Engineering, Mechatronics or Electronics.Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college on Computer Systems Engineering, Mechatronics or Electronics.Desired CharacteristicsPrevious experience on SW Development for automotive or aerospace industries.Self Learning and Curiosity.Familiarized with DO-178C.Knowledge of SW Project Management methodology(Agile, Waterfall).Additional InformationRelocation Assistance Provided: No

Job Title: Senior Software Dev Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Senior Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Defining the technology strategy and architecture for a greenfield initiativeWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software, cloud services platforms and automation workflowsDesigning and developing simple software solutions to complex problemsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the company to define our engineering strategy and push projects forwardCoaching and mentoring other engineers to develop their software engineering skillsetPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solving some of our hardest engineering problemsDevelopment experience with AWS services such as AWS CloudFormation, EC2, API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDBDesign and development experience with horizontally scaling systemsExcellent track record of shipping software as a software engineer or technical leadA proven ability to learn new domains and demonstrate leadershipExcellent written and verbal communication skills addressing technical and non-technical audiencesMeets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this roleMeets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Job DescriptionPlatform Application Engineer - Memory Technologies will assists in providing technical support for one or many products and or product family.Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:Participating in new product development representing the customers technical needs creating competitive analysis from a technical perspective.Developing and presenting technical product training materials.Working with the sales team to help resolve customers technical questions.Participating in customers visits and presentations.Creating and maintaining data sheets and application notes.Acting as technical experts/consultants/analysts and program managers.Responding to customer requests or events as they occur.Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgement.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Defining driving resolution across multiple teams and representing technical issues while maintaining centralized communication across multiple geographies.Influencing and customer orientation skills.Verbal and written communication skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Electronics Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).4+ years of experience in either of the following:High Speed I/O (Input Output) Communication protocols (PCIe, DDR (Double Data Rate), etc.)Debugging (including experience working with and analyzing output from test equipment such as the Lauterbach, oscilloscopes logic analyzers and protocol analyzers).Advanced English level.Preferred Qualifications:Broad understanding of Intel processor-based platforms.History with microprocessor architecture chipset architecture system architecture board design, pre silicon, validation, post silicon, validation, and/or firmware BIOS.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Job Title: Embedded and Linux Software Systems Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionAre you passionate about software development? Would you like to have an opportunity to develop your software design skills with hands on projects, product evaluation, code reviews and training courses?In this position, you will be joining the Customer Experience Group as a software applications Engineer specializing in systems featuring the entire software stack from processor boot loader to device drivers to host application software.You will be part of passionate and highly talented team of applications engineers working on cutting edge next generation technologies.A successful candidate is a talented aspiring software designer who is ready to take the challenge of working hands-on with systems that feature FPGAs, memory, host PCIe (Peripheral Component Interconnect Express), networking (for example: Ethernet MAC (Media Access Controller), etc.), and custom IP.Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:Providing feedback on Intel Programmable Solutions Group's (PSG) software stack offerings with Intel Open FPGA Stack and insights on how to make it easy to understand and to use.Developing technical assets such as user guides, application notes, design examples, demos, and training that will enable users to successfully design with our software.Responding to customer technical questions, debug, reproduce customer issues, and drive issue resolution.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Willingness to create customer ready material (including strong technical writing and communication skills).Driving an issue to resolution by working with a cross-functional group of stakeholders.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, and/or internship experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related STEM fields (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Advanced English level.1+ year of experience with software development using C/C++ for systems featuring software and hardware (e.g. IP cores), tools and debugPreferred Qualifications:Experience with bootloader software for embedded processors (e.g. U-boot, UEFI) and BIOS.Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals (I2C, UART, SPI, CAN etc.)Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals high performance peripherals such as PCIe with Virtualization, DMAExperience with system level debug for issues featuring both processors and FPGA.Experience with host software stacks for infrastructure processing e.g. OvS, DPDK (Data Plane Development Kit), SPDK (Storage Performance Development Kit), Linux based virtualization, and orchestration.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need.

The ADAS Algorithm Development Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, maintainance and optimization of the algorithms used for the Perception segment, working with Radar technologies (and potentially others like Camera in the future) in order to process its outputs to describe the enviroment and its characteristics according to customer requirements (signal processing, object tracking and classification, etc.). She/he will actively work with internal and external engineering teams to bring high-quality products into production.A tipical day involves analyzing issues in our simulation tools, implementing fixes and optimizations in C, and developing new code for our software solution (at application level of Autosar)Main Responsibilities:Perform requirements analysis and translate them into optimal implementationsDevelop embedded sensor algorithms to meet product requirements.Analyze issues, find root causes and fix bugs in a creative way to optimize the performance of our algorithmsUtilize advanced data analysis techniques to provide insight and inspire future development to improve our productPerform quality tasks in our implementations such as code reviews, unit tests and complying with highest code standards

Fullstack Engineer -2200066XApplicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: EnglishPreferred QualificationsDescriptionWith tremendous market success in our Cloud Applications, especially in ERP Cloud, Higher Ed institutions have expressed unprecedented interest in embarking a cloud adoption journey with Oracle. Student Information Systems, a critical functional area to complete in our SaaS footprint for Higher Ed, is one top investment priority for Oracle. With over 800+ institutions using Campus Solutions today, our charter is to strike the balance of accelerating the delivery of Student Cloud while continue to deliver value for existing Campus Solutions customers.We leverage an agile development methodology (scrum) to facilitate the development of our products. Our development practices include empowered scrum teams, continuous build and integration, weekly sprint reviews, and a heavy emphasis on testing early and often.You should be able to work independently, mentor others and be a highly contributing member of an agile team. She/he has excellent organizational, planning and time management skills, with a successful track record of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.The position is located at Guadalajara. We are looking for a hands-on senior engineer with a passion for developing our Student Cloud solution.RequirementsFront End oriented full stack developer with exposure to all layers of application and development.Excellent product development skills - designing, coding, and debugging skills in JavaScript and Java.Knowledge of RDBMS concepts.Experience of 2-10 yrs. in product development.Experience in Web services, REST etc.Thorough understanding of OO principles.The ideal candidate also has:Experience of 4-10 yrs. in product development.Solid Experience developing web UI’s using JavaScript libraries and/or frameworks (jQuery, Angular, ReactJS, etc).Experience with Agile Development (SCRUM).Experience with database design/modeling.Experience with cloud platforms, cloud technologies/deployments.Experience with enterprise software applications.Experience with Oracle Fusion Tech Stack (JDeveloper, OJET, ADF).Experience in higher education product/domain.Excellent analysis and prioritization skills.ResponsibilitiesCandidate will be responsible for:UI development using HTML, JavaScript, JQuery, AJAX etc.Ensuring high quality code is delivered, including delivering unit tests and automation.Development of Java-based REST services or servlets using Oracle ADF.Participating in code reviews.Assessing and estimating work loads.Self managing development time.Working closely with Product Architects, Product Managers, Quality Assurance, and other development teams.Communicating effectively with an international team, both written and verbally.Detailed Description and Job RequirementsAnalyze, design develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for commercial or end user applications. Writes code, completes programming and performs testing and debugging of applications.As a member of the software engineering division, you will perform high-level design based on provided external specifications. Specify, design and implement minor changes to existing software architecture. Build highly complex enhancements and resolve complex bugs. Build and execute unit tests and unit plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering as necessary to discuss minor changes to product functionality and to ensure quality and consistency across specific products.Duties and tasks are varied and complex needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.Job: Product DevelopmentLocation: MX-MX,Mexico-Guadalajara/ZapopanOther Locations: MX-MX,Mexico-Monterrey, MX-MX,Mexico-Santa FeJob Type: Regular Employee HireOrganization: Oracle

Job Title: High Level Design Software Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionHave you worked on High Level Design (HLD) C++ applications or implemented HLD acceleration systems? Do you love collaborating with internal teams and helping customers with their end products? Is it exciting to work in a diverse team that spans multiple domains and vertical markets? Do you want to make valuable contributions to the team that helps identify market trends, then help influence next generation products and solutions?As a business unit within Intel, we will continue to apply Moore's Law to drive the future of field-programmable gate array (FPGA) technology. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To take advantage of the many opportunities in the future for FPGA's, PSG is looking for an outstanding High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer to join our Customer Experience Group (CEG) team specializing in HLD development using DPC++, oneAPI, FPGA Design, Flows, and Debug.As a High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer in CEG, you will be responsible to support Intel FPGA solutions proactively to enable customers to quickly get their solutions to market. Additionally, you will interface directly with cross functional teams to contribute to the next generation product definition, identify market trends and direction, and quickly resolve complex technical issues to allow customers to meet the market demands.Your specific role includes, but is not limited to:Providing guidance from a customer and systems perspective to cross functional teams to create optimal solutions.Creating demos to showcase the capabilities of Intel PSG solutions.Handling customer escalations to provide solutions to meet customer requirements and working directly with development teams to build improved solutions in the future.Providing product readiness feedback as an early user to cross functional teams and managing efforts to improve the product.Developing reference designs or subcomponents to align with key market strategies, which allows customers to evaluate the technology while offering a starting point for their project.Driving the strategy of new technology training for both internal and external audiences.Authoring documentation and other applicable materials to explain products and solutions.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Attention to detail.Analytical and problem-solving skills.Be self-motivated.Work effectively in a team environment.Communication and interpersonal skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Intermediate to advanced English.3+ months of experience in either of the following:Area within C++, computational, algorithmic, and/or area related to CPU/GPU/FPGA/etc.High Level Design Tools, Vitis, HLS (High Level Synthesis), oneAPI, Mathworks, DSPBuilder, Quartus, Vivado, or related.Preferred QualificationsExperience in an area related to C++.Experience working on customer engagements, applications development.Experience with code optimization using parallelism, pipelining, memory management, concurrency, and multi-threading.Experience with Embedded Systems.Experience with oneAPI, OpenCL, HLS, Quartus, and other FPGA centric design flows and tools.Experience in HDL (Hardware Description Language), verification, and general computational logic design/verification concepts.Experience with Git and development tools.Experience in with computational algorithms theory.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Tasks#ComputerScienceDegree #MechatronicsDegree #ElectronicDegreeAs ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineer you’ll help to develop Long and Short-Range Radar sensors, Camera Vision systems, LiDAR and other related advanced vehicle sensing components to enable driving functions and other automated driving features to make Autonomous Mobility happen.ADAS is currently developing functions such as Full-Speed Range Adaptive Cruise Controls, Lane Departure Warning, Blind Spot Detection, Forward Object Detection and Collision Mitigation Systems.A Testing Engineer is required to test the product or system to ensure it functions properly and meets its requirements. Test Engineers rigorously examine products, using creativity and technical skill to fix bugs and devise testing systems. You’ll design, implement and execute the necessary tests to verify the embedded software that enables the driving functions and features.The ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineers aren't just manual testers, if a test/process can be automated the ADAS Test engineer is responsible for the automation. You’ll write scripts to automate testing and tools, so testing is done on a continuous basis.Responsibilities:Design, develop and execute Software test specifications (test cases, procedures, scenarios and test plans) based on the customer requirements for ADAS products.Planning and tracking of tests (esp. test goals, test objects, test efforts, resources and schedules).Contribute to the design of new test environments and develop test automation tools.Automate tests using test frameworks.Work with development teams to fulfil architecture & design requirementsQualificationsIn addition to a Bachelor’s of Science degree in Computer Science, Mechatronics, Electronics or similar; it is required the following knowledge and skills:Understanding of the software development life cycle.Understanding of embedded systems.Basic to intermediate C, C++ or Python language programming knowledge.Debugging Skills (log file analysis, oscilloscope, …)TroubleshootingThe Testing Engineer also needs to be tactful and diplomatic to maintain a good working relationship with the software developers. Other skills and competencies needed are:Critical thinker and problem-solving skillsDecision-making abilityAttention to detailsAbility to work in a team as well as an individualFluent EnglishGood communication and presentation skills.Technical writing; be able to convey information clearly and accurately.CreativityWilling to travel for training and Go-&-See (internationally and/or domestically).BenefitsMitarbeiter werben MitarbeiterLebensversicherungFlexible ArbeitszeitenGesundheitsvorsorgeKantineReisekostenzulageKarriereberatung und TrainingsangebotGehaltsbonusAbout usContinental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Job DescriptionThis position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.This position aligns to that transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Transition is expected to close in late 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.The System Validation Engineer will be responsible for, but not limited to:Integrating and debugging software across the stack for a specific product, platform, feature, or technology throughout the product lifecycle, including pre-silicon development, power on, and/or post-silicon development.Debugging software across multiple layers of the software stack including firmware, drivers, and operating systems.Developing a software debug plan and associated methodologies.Analyzing issues, managing sightings from various validation streams, determining root cause, and driving or developing improvements. Driving project stress and stability and supports power, performance, and key task forces.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or STEM related field. Documentation related to bachelor's degree completion will be required4+ years of experience in either one of the following areas:Debugging hardware or software issues on Storage, Server, Platform or similar environments.Development and/or debug in Linux or Windows environments.Validation disciplines experience, system/platform level debug, or root cause isolation methodologies.Preferred Qualifications:2+ years of experience in either of the following areas:Low level code development/Debug for OS Drivers, FW, or Kernel.PCIe or NVMe protocol and debug (including debug tools and protocol analyzers).NAND memory validation.Experience with industry specifications such as PCIe NVME, OPAL, eSSC.PC Platform, BIOS, Drivers, or IO technologies.Continuous integration and agile methodologies.Inside this Business GroupEmployees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel.

Define and develop software tests for our existing Embedded Linux platform, based on customer software requirements, using guidelines and methodologies specific to the automotive industry. Be able to work independently on assigned components and with support from technical coordinator/ experienced colleagues. Be responsible and contribute in software design for medium to high complexity modules/components and document according to established processes and methods. Responsible for implementing medium to high complex modules/ components according to established software specifications & design.Define SW (unit and functional) tests, work closely with SW architects, developers and requirements engineers to design and update test cases and alike documentation timely. Improve SW testing process and support others when there are blocking points. Share lessons learned, experience and tips & tricks across all team; prepare presentations and/or workshops of significant topics to the team.

Job DescriptionIntel Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is leading the way to transform the Datacenter with a portfolio of FPGA accelerated platforms and software frameworks for end applications such as VRAN and Cloud Infrastructure Processing.In this position, you will be joining the Customer Experience Group as a Linux Software Systems Applications Engineer specializing in systems featuring Intel processors and FPGA devices.A successful candidate is a Linux software developer, who has hands-on experience with Linux stack and driver architecture and tool flows.Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:Reviewing product requirements and designing a best-in-class customer journey by identifying user collateral assets such as user guides, application notes and design examples, use cases, user personas and customer touchpoints (such as the web, git repository, forums etc.).Reviewing software architectural specifications and requirements and performing product evaluations and provide feedback on ease of use.Defining and developing unit tests and performing checkout to ensure the readiness of feature releases.Developing technical assets such as user guides, application notes, design examples, demos, and customer training that will enable users to successfully design with our products.Responding to customer technical questions, debugging, reproducing customer issues, driving issue resolution with the engineering organization as well as drive Close-Loop Corrective Action (CLCA).QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).3+ years of applications engineering or system design experience2+ years of experience with Linux Architecture, kernel, drivers, user space applications, and tools.2+ years of experience with device and kernel driver development with Linux.2+ years of experience with installation and troubleshooting of Operating Systems such as Windows, Linux Distributions (e.g. CentOS, RHEL, Ubuntu OS).2+ years of experience with boot software (UEFI or Uboot), PXE Boot, BIOS.2+ years of experience with debugging system level issues over PCIe protocol.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with Orchestration frameworks, containers, and virtualization.Experience with networking software such as Intel Data plane development kit (DPDK), Open Virtual Switch (OvS), Intel Storage Plane Development Kit (SPDK) etc.Experience with Board Management Controller frameworks (Redfish, OpenBMC etc.).Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

Company DescriptionBosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch (1861-1942) and for more than 130 years has been distinguished by a unique corporate culture based on solid values that drive us to improve every day. Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an Embedded Software Test Engineer who is willing to work on a project where each team member contributes to the SW Development success of Active Safety (AS) systems. Technical curiosity paired with a passion for engineering is a must for this role, we are looking for someone who applies strategic problem solving and enables the team to understand even the most complex technical challenges down to the last bit. Eagerness to own SW/SYS testing topics as per the V Model Software Development Life Cycle is necessary.Key responsibilities:Requirement analysis.Knowhow on test design techniques.Test specification / test case development.Test automation.Test execution.Defect management.Hardware in Loop (HIL) debugging.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Electronics & Communications, Electronics, Electrical or Computer engineering.2-5 years of relevant experience.Able to develop test scenario to test the requirement.Experience in SW testing and system testing.Basic knowledge on process (SDLC / V-model).Experience in CANoe / CANalyzer.Programing skills, Python / CAPL / PERL.Experience in Hardware in Loop (HIL) ETAS / DSPACE test environment.Experience in diagnosis modules / UDS protocol.Bring up new test concept & methodology.Team player with good communication skills.Proficient in English (CEFR B2-C1).Willing to travel to US and Southern Asia.Preferred qualifications:Master’s degree in Electronics & Communications/Electronics/Electrical/Computer engineering.Knowledge about ESP system and algorithm + vehicle dynamics.Knowledge about Jenkins environment.Understanding the system/functional requirements.Knowledge on SW configuration management. (Ex: Clear Quest, ALM-RTC).Experience in agile process: Continuous integration and continuous testing.Additional InformationBosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 13,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life across the globe. Welcome to Bosch!

Are you an experienced software engineer with deep experience in building and shipping amazing products? Do you have high standards when it comes to code quality and user experiences? Are you the best developer on your team? Are you ready to work alongside the best engineers in the world for name-brand, industry-leading companies?Bluelight Consulting is seeking a React developer to join its growing team.As an engineer at Bluelight Consulting you will help our incredible clients achieve their technical goals in one of two ways: 1) Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client’s team and work alongside their existing engineers on a daily basis. 2) Design & Build: You will work on a Bluelight Consulting development team to build and ship greenfield applications for our clients.What We Are Looking For3+ years of professional software development experience. 5+ years preferred but not required.3+ years of professional experience working with React.Meaningful experience working on large, complex systems.A four-year college degree is required.Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon, both regarding estimates and the general process.Ability to identify with Bluelight's clients' goals and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them.Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed.Ability to create and maintain continuous integration and delivery of applications.A positive mindset and can-do attitude.Forensic attention to detail.You're passionate about software development... it's not just your career, it's your hobby. You're constantly striving to learn new things and improve. You follow industry news, regularly tinker with new technologies, and read books and blogs to keep your skills current.Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.What You'll Be DoingWork as part of a small team, which will include other developers, a project manager, a QA professional, and a designer.Complete two-week sprints, participate in sprint retrospectives, and daily standups.Assist with building estimates.Interface with clients via Slack, Zoom, and email.Track your time throughout the day using Toggl.Work with modern tools including Jira, Slack, GitHub, Google Docs, etc.Be part of a community of developers that share knowledge and help each other as problems arise.Follow Bluelight's detailed development process.Company BenefitsCompetitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases.Generous paid-time-off policyTechnology / Office stipendHealth CoverageFlexible working hoursWork remotelyContinuing education, training, conferencesCompany-sponsored coursework, exams, and certificationsBeing a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply. #LI-Remote

Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Hadoop and Spark, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis and Mongo and Scylla, all the way to structured SQL engines.This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about high quality and high reliability open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu.Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, automation, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open source community dynamics, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.What you'll doCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamWrite high quality, idiomatic Python code to create new featuresDebug issues and interact with upstream communities, in the openWork with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fieldsDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external eventsWho you areYou love technology and working with brilliant peopleYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operationsYou have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud and experience with private cloud solutions like OpenStackYou are experienced with Kubernetes and believe it can be used for serious persistent data servicesYou are an accomplished Python programmer that enjoys challenging projects in mission-critical environmentsYou have experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, Cassandra, InfluxDB, SQLite, Spark, ElasticsearchYou are familiar with DevOps concepts and technologiesExperience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technology.Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Si eres un ingeniero al que le apasiona crear productos innovadores que obtengan decenas de millones de vistas de páginas al día, Indeed te está buscando.Indeed ofrece a los desarrolladores inteligentes como tú, un complejo ecosistema de desarrollo con ciclos de lanzamiento cortos.Busca cada semana el lanzamiento de varios productos que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de crecimiento de millones de empresas y candidatos en el mundo.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.The Jobseeker Profile Platform team is the source of truth for all data on every job seeker on Indeed. Our mission is to help job seekers to effectively represent themselves to employers. Our vision is to provide centralized storage and distributed processing capacity with a pluggable framework for all Indeed client teams that use job seeker data.As part of our team, you will play a key role in designing/document and leading the development of features that are robustly monitored and alarmed in production for the next generation of services that will be used by millions of job seekers every day.We are building a distributed data storage solution for job seeker data. This system will be high throughput, low latency, and must be incredibly reliable as it is a key piece of the Indeed ecosystem. It will provide internal client teams self-service abilities such as read, process, and update for individual job seekers data or groups of job seeker data.Who You AreResponsabilidades:Como ingeniero de software del equipo de crecimiento de SMB, estarás a cargo de desarrollar software que sirva de guía a las empresas para publicar ofertas de empleo de alta calidad que puedan conseguir un buen desempeño en los resultados de las búsquedas de Indeed.Desarrollarás IU y API que guíen a las empresas y les señalen los problemas de sus ofertas de empleo que podrían estar evitando que sean cubiertas.Formarás parte de un equipo de colaboración de ingenieros, diseñadores de experiencias de usuarios y gerentes de producto sumamente talentosos. Con frecuencia indagamos en la información disponible en Indeed para analizar, fundamentar y desarrollar soluciones para los problemas adecuados.Si te gusta revisar la información, analizarla y estudiarla de distintas formas para poder aportar conocimiento interesante, este es tu lugar ideal.Requisitos:Maestría en Ciencias de la informática, Ingeniería computacional, Ingeniería eléctrica, Matemáticas o alguna otra carrera afín del área técnica computacional, con más de 5 años de experiencia en programación con al menos un año en alguno de los siguientes lenguajes: Java, JavaScript o Python.Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo de aplicaciones de pila completa con React y Redux.Experiencia en GraphQL deseable.Más de 3 años de experiencia como líder de ingenieros júnior.experiencia significativa en sistemas de alto rendimiento a gran escala.This team is seeking an experienced Java engineer that is familiar with the standard Java technologies and has experience working at scale. We are a deliberate team that drives development based on careful planning and a data-driven approach to new feature request.We are looking for someone who:Feels a sense of ownership in whatever they work on.Has Identified, implemented and delivered service for a specific product opportunity.Embraces continual improvement, and love to learn and develop new skillsThinks about why something needs to be built, not just what needs to be builtHas strong opinions on technical direction without a strong egoRequirements:3+ years of software development experience with programming languages and technologies such as Java.Proficient verbal and written communication in English required2+ years of experience with either NoSQL or SQL technologies.Deep understanding of the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including coding standards, code review, source control, build, test, deploy, and operations.Professional experience working with high-performance systems, large scale systems.Experience with web technologies and full stack development.Experience building solutions for high traffic web sites is a plus.Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field (Master’s is a plus).Ability to work efficiently on a remote/distributed team.Nice to have:Lead and mentored other engineers on the team.Experience with large scale distributed systems.Experience with multiple OO languages.Experience with Mongo, Kafka, AWSExperience with test-driven development.Experience with agile methodology.Who we areSomos una organización de ingeniería de rápido crecimiento y gran capacidad que está construyendo la página web de búsqueda de empleo más conocida del mundo. Con centros de ingeniería en Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokio, Singapur, Hyderabad, Dublín, Aberdeen y Vancouver, estamos mejorando la vida de las personas en todo el mundo con cada búsqueda de empleo.We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Como la página de búsqueda de empleo número 1 del mundo*, nuestra misión es “We help all people get jobs”. Nos esforzamos por conseguir un lugar de trabajo inclusivo y accesible en el que todo el mundo se sienta cómodo, y queremos ampliar nuestro equipo con personas que compartan nuestro entusiasmo por la innovación y por ofrecer la mejor experiencia posible a los/as candidatos/as.(*comScore total de visitas, septiembre de 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.El rango salarial base representa el límite inferior y superior del rango salarial de Indeed para este puesto. Job Title: Software Development Engineer in Test II
Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Un ingeniero de desarrollo de software en prueba (SDET) en Indeed es un desarrollador con la responsabilidad principal de construir la infraestructura y el soporte de herramientas para permitir que SWE escriba la automatización de prueba. Es un rol único y desafiante y brinda una inmensa oportunidad para diseñar y desarrollar marcos de trabajo de gran alcance y patrones de diseño para permitir la entrega de código de alta velocidad.Al ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.A Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Indeed is a developer with the primary responsibility of building the infrastructure and tooling support to enable SWEs to write test automation. It is a very unique and challenging role and provides immense opportunity to design and develop wide-reaching frameworks and design patterns to enable high velocity code deliveryBeing the part of the SMB team you’ll be writing code that automatically verifies the quality of the product and build out testing apis/services/tools that enable others to do so as well. Drive the strategy for testability of the product with understanding of customer usage models in real-world environmentsSDETs at Indeed are highly skilled who are able to debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement/improve tools and frameworks needed to streamline our testing process. Being a member of the product teams will work directly with other product teams and cross functional roles to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated solutions to deliver quality features with efficiency.Who You AreCalificaciones requeridas:BS o MS en Ciencias de la Computación (o equivalente)Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 5 años de experiencia como Desarrollador o SDETGran capacidad para escribir código efectivo (Java, Spring, Servicios web, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Servicios web, XML, AJAX, Microservicios, SOA, REST, JSON).Comunicación efectiva entre funciones para identificar las necesidades de herramientas, las brechas de automatización y reducir el trabajo duro en el proceso de desarrollo.Sólida experiencia con el desarrollo ágil que incorpora integración continua y entrega continua, utilizando tecnologías como GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDepure código, resuelva problemas complejos relacionados con la eficiencia y el rendimiento de nuestro software con el monitoreo de producción adecuadoDiseñar e implementar nuevas herramientas, marcos de prueba automatizados escalables que funcionen en todas las tecnologías.Fuerte experiencia en la construcción de herramientas de desarrollo y monitoreo como parte esencial del sistema de producción.Tutoría con revisiones detalladas del código fuente junto con orientación técnica para la arquitectura y el diseño en generalFuertes habilidades organizativas, priorización y entregables/resultadosCapaz de lidiar bien con problemas ambiguos/indefinidos; capacidad de pensar en abstracto.Calificaciones preferidas:Conocimientos de programación funcional.Docker, experiencia KubernetesFuerte comprensión de los fundamentos de la informática, diseño de algoritmos y estructuras de datos.Experiencia en Análisis Orientado a Objetos, Diseño (OOAD) y desarrollo de software utilizando Metodología UML, buen conocimiento de patrones de diseño J2EE y patrones de diseño Core JavaArticular de manera efectiva cualquier desafío técnico y problema indefinidoProporcionar soluciones innovadoras relacionadas con nuevas herramientas y marcos.Entrega de activos de prueba altamente personalizados con una combinación de herramientas y técnicas para brindar una excelente experiencia de usuarioEsforzarse por la escalabilidad, confiabilidad, consistencia y rendimiento del producto en producciónAl ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Required Qualifications:BS or MS in Computer Science (or equivalent)Proficient verbal and written communication in English required5+ years of experience as Developer or SDETStrong ability to write effective code ( Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Web Services, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON.)Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the development process.Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDebug code, solve complex problems related to efficiency and performance of our software with appropriate production monitoringDesign and Implement new tools, scalable automated test frameworks working across technologiesStrong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of production systemMentoring with detailed source code reviews along with technical guidance to overall architecture and designStrong organizational skills, prioritization and deliverables/resultsAble to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of functional programmingDocker, Kubernetes experienceStrong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design and data structuresExperience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of J2EE design patterns and Core Java design patternsEffectively articulate any technical challenges and undefined problemsProvide innovative solutions related to new tooling and frameworksDelivering highly customized test assets with mix of tools and techniques to provide a great user experienceStriving for Product scalability, reliability, consistency and performance in ProductionWho we areWe are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.Salary Range TransparencyMexico City 600,000 - 900,000 MXN per yearEqual Opportunities and Accommodations StatementIndeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.Fair Chance HiringWe value diverse experiences, including those who have had prior contact with the criminal legal system. We are committed to providing individuals with criminal records, including formerly incarcerated individuals, a fair chance at employment.Our Policies and BenefitsView Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobsLearn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/Where legally permitted, Indeed requires all individuals attending or working out of Indeed offices or visiting Indeed clients to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For positions that can only be performed at an Indeed office, candidates must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and present acceptable proof of vaccination by the date of hire as a condition of employment. For positions that require some in-office work or in-person client meetings, exceptions to these in-office or in-person job requirements may be made at the discretion of the business through June 2022, at which point full vaccination will be required. Indeed will consider requests for reasonable accommodation as required under applicable law. To qualify as being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 there should have been a two week period after receiving the second dose (or any government recommended booster shot) in a 2-dose COVID-19 vaccine series, or a two week period after receiving a single-dose (or any government recommended booster shot) in a single dose COVID-19 vaccine.Reference ID: 35345

Job Description: Job Description FormatOur culture is driven by putting our Engineers first with Work-life balance and an environment that sparks the imagination.Our aim is to push the needle of innovation while enabling Technical staff to impact code or products at the architecture level.REWARDSMedical Insurance10 Vacation days15 days of Christmas bonusLearning and Development programs100% RemoteFlexible Work ScheduleREQUIREMENTSBS Degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience5 years of professional experienceExperience building scalable systemsGrowth mindset, embracing continual learningRESPONSIBILITIESDesign, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve softwareBuild experiments to improve metrics such as signup rate, activation rate, etc.Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverablesParticipate as an active member of our Engineering team to help us evolve practices, approaches, and standardsOther duties as needed.PREFERRED SKILLSTest-Driven Development experienceHas built large scale SaaS products and applicationsProficiency in TypeScriptExperience with CSS/HTML/DOM manipulationExperience with Scala or JavaExperience with A/B testingJob Type: Full-timePay: $80,000.00 - $90,000.00 per monthCOVID-19 considerations:All the requirements by LawExperience:React.js: 5 years (Required)Javascript: 5 years (Required)Language:Ingles (Required)

Salary Estimate: Sueldo provisto por el empleador:540 k$ - 840 k$
Job Description: About UsWe are a Technology company focused on developing advanced AI software solutions for the e-commerce and advertising industries. Our founders have previously succeeded in Europe launching multiple startups in these industries, and now launching in Mexico to target the LATAM market with a new offering. Our main focus is on developing e-commerce intelligence through data science and driving AI solutions that maximise performance across multiple performance-driven channels.About YouYou love writing software! There are plenty of good product and technical challenges to work on. We’re looking for motivated developers who like solving hard problems and shipping good software.Only candidates with +4 years of overall software development experience are eligible for this role.You should have experience with:+4 years coding in Python and/or Go+4 AWS and/or GCP servers+4 SQL and/or NoSQL databasesETLs using Airflow/Prefect or similarTest Driven DevelopmentVersion control software (Git).We would love it if you also had experience with:PostgresKubernetes/DockerRabbitMQ/SQS/CeleryCachés (Redis, MemCached)CI/CD Pipelines (Jenkins, GoCD, Concourse, etc.)Terraform or similarE-commerce AdvertisingGoogle Ads API / Amazon APIPair ProgrammingWorking RemotelyWorking asynchronouslyYou understand product developmentYou understand product development and its relationship to the business. You’re comfortable balancing delivery speed and functionality. You’re good at prioritization, willing to defer complexity, and happy in an agile process.You care about your usersYou want to understand your users and their problems so you can build products that make their lives a little easier.What You’ll DoHere’s a rough idea of how you’ll spend your time in a given week:Solo & Pair Programming: 75-85%Reviewing Pull Requests: 5-10% (less if you pair)Meetings (IPM and Retro): 2.5%Mentoring/Leadership: 5-25% (depending on how much you want to code)PairingWe encourage pairing, but that doesn’t mean you have to pair all of the time. Sometimes, it’s just not possible due to time zone differences.Code ReviewWe want teammates to review one another’s code. We find that pull requests against small, clear user stories coupled with thorough, well-written test cases make for easy reviews. We want to keep review time low and minimize the amount of work in progress.MeetingsWe keep meetings to a minimum, because work rarely gets done in meetings.Deep WorkWe encourage deep work. Sign out of Slack and focus without interruption for at least 4 hours every day if you can. We have escalation procedures to deal with emergencies which means the majority of the dev team is never “on call”.Mentoring and LeadershipIf you like mentoring other developers, or working with the leadership team to set priorities and fix process, there’s plenty of room for that. If you don’t, there’s plenty of code to write too.CultureWe’re building a culture of nice, smart, and hard-working people. We value everyone's background and experience when shaping the company. We are ambassadors of a “no blame and full support” culture that learns from mistakes, takes risks and invests on experiments that incentivise self-development and growth.Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo, Por tiempo indeterminadoSalario: $45,000.00 - $70,000.00 al mesBeneficios:Aumentos salarialesDías de maternidad superiores a los de la leyDías de paternidad superiores a los de la leyDías por enfermedadHorarios flexiblesPrograma de referidosTrabajar desde casaVacaciones superiores a las de leyVales de despensaHorario:Turno de 8 horasPregunta(s) de postulación:Cuantos años de experiencia tienes trabajando con equipos 100% remotos?Experiencia:Python: 4 años (Deseable)PostgreSQL: 4 años (Deseable)AWS: 2 años (Deseable)programando profecionalmente: 4 años (Deseable)

The scrum team will own the development life cycle of their products from estimation, design, development, testing, and support of all the products they create.We are looking for demonstrated strength in software development, clean code, pair programming, and meticulous thinking/documentation of work.Experience and nice to have (1 or more)C# or Java or Python experienceASP.NET framework experienceFrontend or backend experienceAgile and scrum hands-on experienceLearning agilityOwnership of your workCollaboration/relationship buildingRESTful microservices experienceExperience working with cloud based architectures like AWS are nice to haveGit or Github experience-We offer the following benefits:100% payroll scheme20 days - Christmas bonus10 days of vacation per year5 personal days8% (cap) saving fund11% (cap) of food couponsMajor Medical InsuranceLife InsuranceGym membershipEducation reimbursement--ITJuana does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $30,000.00 - $40,000.00 per monthExperience:software development: 1 year (Required)Language:english intermediate or advance (Required)

Are you a customer support engineer who is obsessed with delivering a great experience, but you’ve already mastered your current products and are wondering what’s next? Or are you a software engineer looking for a way to get introduced to an immense set of product architectures, domains, and tech stacks? Sure, you could join any new company and learn their handful of products, but we think we have something better.We are the Customer Support team at Trilogy. We support over 100 unique enterprise software products - everything from mobile app development platforms to database load-balancers. We not only have the opportunity to learn, use, and support these products, we also become deep technical experts who can solve problems no one has seen before. There’s a lot to learn, so we have weekly “learning tickets” to ensure the whole team is up to speed.This role is the highest-level customer support engineer we have - our tickets cannot be elevated above you. The problems are complex. The solutions might be configuration, database-level, or even code-level. Trilogy takes pride in its customer support quality and makes sure customers are impressed at every interaction. It’s an immense responsibility, but one that can put you on the fast track to career advancement.What you will be doingImpressing customers by solving complex or new problemsGrowing your product knowledge, in breadth and depthDigging deep to discover the root causes and solutions of issues - exploring source code, databases, logs, and tracesWhat you won’t be doingAnswering the same questions over and over againProviding trivial or basic troubleshootingWriting knowledge base articlesApplication Support Engineer key responsibilitiesResolving elevated customer ticketsExpanding product and technology expertise by working on “learning tickets”Basic Requirements2+ years of software development2+ years of experience with customer-facing technical supportAvailability for 8-hour shiftsAbout TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced!Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Here’s some advice: If you’re in the early stages of your career, don’t join a company that is hesitant to update its technology from the 90s and adapt to new trends. Five years from now, your skill set will be dead in the water and your resume will be a non-starter.In the telecommunications industry, Totogi is the main adversary to such companies. Totogi is disrupting this multibillion-dollar industry by introducing the world’s most advanced customer management system, which allows our enterprise customers to scale at an unprecedented pace. We’re looking for telecommunications technicians to help us deliver this service to our customers.Unlike in most companies, you won’t just sit around all day pulling tickets and wondering whether you’re doing them correctly. Instead, we’re actively invested in your growth and development, providing dedicated coaches who will help you build your skill set and launch your career.If you have technical telecommunications experience and want to hitch your career to a rocket, join Totogi’s technical delivery team!What you will be doingActivating New Customers’ Services: Platform configuration for standard engagements or coding for customized engagementsContinual Learning: Totogi’s constant innovation gives you the opportunity to learn new technologies and platforms on a regular basisWhat you won’t be doingFixing outages or providing technical support for existing customersInterfacing directly with customersData Engineer key responsibilitiesBasic RequirementsExperience working with mobile network architectures (3G/4G)Telecommunications domain knowledge (ideally including SS7 stack, Sigtran, Diameter, SIP, SMPP protocols)Knowledge of MySQLAbout TotogiTotogi is focused on building telco software for the public cloud and is completely redefining how carriers engage with their subscribers to drive customer love! We are a product-driven telco software company made up of some of the best minds from the telecoms industry and the brightest engineering talent across the globe. Change the game with us.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more.
