Are you a junior software engineer who writes squeaky clean code? Do you want to launch your career as a software engineer by working on fixing complicated software defects, rather than working on trivial changes to issues senior team members have already solved?This role is a ticket to working with the world's finest developers. At Trilogy, great code is the foundation of everything we do. Our company is run entirely by technical experts, and everyone on the leadership team is an expert coder. You will not report to business analysts or project managers in this role, but rather passionate software engineers like you.If you were great at writing and cleaning code in school and want to gain real-world software development experience by solving complex problems across codebases from 100+ software products, apply now!What you will be doingWriting code to fix defects, using many technologies but especially Java, JavaScript, C++, and C#.Writing automated tests to make sure the code works properly.What you won’t be doingRunning manual tests.Writing documentation.Writing specs.Software Engineer key responsibilitiesDebug code to identify what is wrong.Implement high-quality fixes that address the core issue.Create automated tests (unit tests and functional tests) to verify that the code works properly.Basic RequirementsAt least 1.5 years developing production software in Java, C#, JavaScript, or C++ (Yes, this can include internships).A degree in Computer Science or the commercial equivalent.The desire to spend at least one year with a laser focus learning to write high-quality code.Nice-to-have RequirementsExperience in a shared-services or centralized environment.Cloud development experience, especially AWS.About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. Job Title: System Software Engineer - C / C++ / Rust / Kernel - Linux container technology
Job Description: We are hiring a systems-level C programmer to focus performance critical, and security-critical, low level system libraries critical to Linux container capabilities. We are also interested in Rust for system-level programming in Ubuntu and more widely in Canonical.The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.What you will doDesign, implement and document features in low level system container libraries (LXC and LXCFS)Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system testsCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel, 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external eventsWho you areYou are curious, flexible, articulate and accountableYou value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivatedYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have experience with system programming in C on LinuxYou have knowledge or interest in Linux kernel features like namespaces, cgroups, networking or storageYou have experience with two or more of cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community.Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.#LI-Remote #Stack

Job Title: Software Development Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.2+ years of non-internship professional software development experienceExperience in object-oriented design and programming experience in at least one modern language, such as Java, Kotlin, C++ or C#Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Designing, implementing and launching high-quality software systems to solve complex problems with big impactWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software and automation workflowsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the companyPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solve some of our hardest engineering problemsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical fieldExperience designing and developing distributed systems with emphasis on scalability, performance and reliabilityExperience developing software systems that have been successfully delivered to customersExperience in communicating with users, technical teams and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs and product strategyExperience with the full software development lifecycle and knowledge of professional software engineering practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing and operationsDemonstrated ability to mentor junior software engineers in all aspects of their engineering skillset

Job Title: Software Engineer - Entry User Interfaces Flight Management Systems
Job Description: Job Description SummaryIn this role you will be responsible for executing, designing and updating test procedures for Navigation and Guidance systems and/or sub-components,in a global Software Engineering organization in across- functional and multicultural environment.Job DescriptionRoles and ResponsibilitiesSupport Design and implementation of Embedded Software and Software Requirements verification in a cross-function environment.Consistently develop and document code and test procedures , interpret results and use best practices with guidance.Effectively communicate/provide presentations in project communication rhythm, such as weekly status meetings, SCRUM meetings, progress reports and retrospectives.Self-aware of assignments on time delivery.Support execution of efficiency or productivity opportunities.Consistent understanding of the overall product functionality and technical basis of operation.Understand key elements of digital electronics, systems engineering, software methodologies and avionics.Required QualificationsSkilled in more than one of the stages of the Software Development Life Cycle is needed for the position.Skilled in Programming Languages and Object Oriented Programming.Solid Knowledge of Embedded Software Development using C or Ada programming languages.Able to understand and apply engineering requirements.Understand Software Validation and Verification principles.Strong interpersonal skills.Executes tasks with supervision.Legal Right to Work in Mexico.This role requires basic experience in the Engineering/Technology & Embedded SW Development. Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's degree on Computer Systems Engineering, Mechatronics or Electronics.Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college on Computer Systems Engineering, Mechatronics or Electronics.Desired CharacteristicsPrevious experience on SW Development for automotive or aerospace industries.Self Learning and Curiosity.Familiarized with DO-178C.Knowledge of SW Project Management methodology(Agile, Waterfall).Additional InformationRelocation Assistance Provided: No

Job Title: Senior Software Dev Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Senior Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Defining the technology strategy and architecture for a greenfield initiativeWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software, cloud services platforms and automation workflowsDesigning and developing simple software solutions to complex problemsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the company to define our engineering strategy and push projects forwardCoaching and mentoring other engineers to develop their software engineering skillsetPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solving some of our hardest engineering problemsDevelopment experience with AWS services such as AWS CloudFormation, EC2, API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDBDesign and development experience with horizontally scaling systemsExcellent track record of shipping software as a software engineer or technical leadA proven ability to learn new domains and demonstrate leadershipExcellent written and verbal communication skills addressing technical and non-technical audiencesMeets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this roleMeets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

The ADAS Algorithm Development Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, maintainance and optimization of the algorithms used for the Perception segment, working with Radar technologies (and potentially others like Camera in the future) in order to process its outputs to describe the enviroment and its characteristics according to customer requirements (signal processing, object tracking and classification, etc.). She/he will actively work with internal and external engineering teams to bring high-quality products into production.A tipical day involves analyzing issues in our simulation tools, implementing fixes and optimizations in C, and developing new code for our software solution (at application level of Autosar)Main Responsibilities:Perform requirements analysis and translate them into optimal implementationsDevelop embedded sensor algorithms to meet product requirements.Analyze issues, find root causes and fix bugs in a creative way to optimize the performance of our algorithmsUtilize advanced data analysis techniques to provide insight and inspire future development to improve our productPerform quality tasks in our implementations such as code reviews, unit tests and complying with highest code standards

Job Title: Embedded and Linux Software Systems Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionAre you passionate about software development? Would you like to have an opportunity to develop your software design skills with hands on projects, product evaluation, code reviews and training courses?In this position, you will be joining the Customer Experience Group as a software applications Engineer specializing in systems featuring the entire software stack from processor boot loader to device drivers to host application software.You will be part of passionate and highly talented team of applications engineers working on cutting edge next generation technologies.A successful candidate is a talented aspiring software designer who is ready to take the challenge of working hands-on with systems that feature FPGAs, memory, host PCIe (Peripheral Component Interconnect Express), networking (for example: Ethernet MAC (Media Access Controller), etc.), and custom IP.Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:Providing feedback on Intel Programmable Solutions Group's (PSG) software stack offerings with Intel Open FPGA Stack and insights on how to make it easy to understand and to use.Developing technical assets such as user guides, application notes, design examples, demos, and training that will enable users to successfully design with our software.Responding to customer technical questions, debug, reproduce customer issues, and drive issue resolution.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Willingness to create customer ready material (including strong technical writing and communication skills).Driving an issue to resolution by working with a cross-functional group of stakeholders.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, and/or internship experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related STEM fields (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Advanced English level.1+ year of experience with software development using C/C++ for systems featuring software and hardware (e.g. IP cores), tools and debugPreferred Qualifications:Experience with bootloader software for embedded processors (e.g. U-boot, UEFI) and BIOS.Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals (I2C, UART, SPI, CAN etc.)Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals high performance peripherals such as PCIe with Virtualization, DMAExperience with system level debug for issues featuring both processors and FPGA.Experience with host software stacks for infrastructure processing e.g. OvS, DPDK (Data Plane Development Kit), SPDK (Storage Performance Development Kit), Linux based virtualization, and orchestration.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need.

Job Title: High Level Design Software Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionHave you worked on High Level Design (HLD) C++ applications or implemented HLD acceleration systems? Do you love collaborating with internal teams and helping customers with their end products? Is it exciting to work in a diverse team that spans multiple domains and vertical markets? Do you want to make valuable contributions to the team that helps identify market trends, then help influence next generation products and solutions?As a business unit within Intel, we will continue to apply Moore's Law to drive the future of field-programmable gate array (FPGA) technology. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To take advantage of the many opportunities in the future for FPGA's, PSG is looking for an outstanding High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer to join our Customer Experience Group (CEG) team specializing in HLD development using DPC++, oneAPI, FPGA Design, Flows, and Debug.As a High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer in CEG, you will be responsible to support Intel FPGA solutions proactively to enable customers to quickly get their solutions to market. Additionally, you will interface directly with cross functional teams to contribute to the next generation product definition, identify market trends and direction, and quickly resolve complex technical issues to allow customers to meet the market demands.Your specific role includes, but is not limited to:Providing guidance from a customer and systems perspective to cross functional teams to create optimal solutions.Creating demos to showcase the capabilities of Intel PSG solutions.Handling customer escalations to provide solutions to meet customer requirements and working directly with development teams to build improved solutions in the future.Providing product readiness feedback as an early user to cross functional teams and managing efforts to improve the product.Developing reference designs or subcomponents to align with key market strategies, which allows customers to evaluate the technology while offering a starting point for their project.Driving the strategy of new technology training for both internal and external audiences.Authoring documentation and other applicable materials to explain products and solutions.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Attention to detail.Analytical and problem-solving skills.Be self-motivated.Work effectively in a team environment.Communication and interpersonal skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Intermediate to advanced English.3+ months of experience in either of the following:Area within C++, computational, algorithmic, and/or area related to CPU/GPU/FPGA/etc.High Level Design Tools, Vitis, HLS (High Level Synthesis), oneAPI, Mathworks, DSPBuilder, Quartus, Vivado, or related.Preferred QualificationsExperience in an area related to C++.Experience working on customer engagements, applications development.Experience with code optimization using parallelism, pipelining, memory management, concurrency, and multi-threading.Experience with Embedded Systems.Experience with oneAPI, OpenCL, HLS, Quartus, and other FPGA centric design flows and tools.Experience in HDL (Hardware Description Language), verification, and general computational logic design/verification concepts.Experience with Git and development tools.Experience in with computational algorithms theory.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Job Description: International IT company is looking for a Senior QA EngineerResponsibilities:Manual testing of mobile and Web applicationsCreation and maintenance of testing artifacts: checklists, test cases, etcActive participation in the development processProvide clear and accurate reporting on testing progress and resultsSearch, record, and track software bugsAnalysis of potential risks related to product qualityRequirements:4+ years of experience as a QA engineerProven experience in web and mobile applications testing (both UI and server-side)Solid knowledge of testing methodologies and approachesExperience in dev tools usage (web inspector, firebug, etc)Good knowledge of UNIX systems and command-line tools (curl etc)Willingness to work in an Agile environmentUpper-intermediate EnglishWe offer:Salary between $45000 - $50000Grow professionally with subsidized certifications, courses, and conferencesRemote workFlexible scheduleBonuses for important life eventsTipo de puesto: Tiempo completo, Por tiempo indeterminadoSalario: $45,000.00 - $50,000.00 al mesHorario:Horario flexibleLunes a viernesTurno de 8 horasExperiencia:QA engineer: 3 años (Obligatorio)Web and mobile applications testing: 1 año (Obligatorio)Testing methodologies: 1 año (Obligatorio)Dev tools: 1 año (Obligatorio)UNIX: 1 año (Obligatorio)Idioma:English - Intermediate level (Obligatorio)

Job DescriptionIntel Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) is leading the way to transform the Datacenter with a portfolio of FPGA accelerated platforms and software frameworks for end applications such as VRAN and Cloud Infrastructure Processing.In this position, you will be joining the Customer Experience Group as a Linux Software Systems Applications Engineer specializing in systems featuring Intel processors and FPGA devices.A successful candidate is a Linux software developer, who has hands-on experience with Linux stack and driver architecture and tool flows.Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:Reviewing product requirements and designing a best-in-class customer journey by identifying user collateral assets such as user guides, application notes and design examples, use cases, user personas and customer touchpoints (such as the web, git repository, forums etc.).Reviewing software architectural specifications and requirements and performing product evaluations and provide feedback on ease of use.Defining and developing unit tests and performing checkout to ensure the readiness of feature releases.Developing technical assets such as user guides, application notes, design examples, demos, and customer training that will enable users to successfully design with our products.Responding to customer technical questions, debugging, reproducing customer issues, driving issue resolution with the engineering organization as well as drive Close-Loop Corrective Action (CLCA).QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).3+ years of applications engineering or system design experience2+ years of experience with Linux Architecture, kernel, drivers, user space applications, and tools.2+ years of experience with device and kernel driver development with Linux.2+ years of experience with installation and troubleshooting of Operating Systems such as Windows, Linux Distributions (e.g. CentOS, RHEL, Ubuntu OS).2+ years of experience with boot software (UEFI or Uboot), PXE Boot, BIOS.2+ years of experience with debugging system level issues over PCIe protocol.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with Orchestration frameworks, containers, and virtualization.Experience with networking software such as Intel Data plane development kit (DPDK), Open Virtual Switch (OvS), Intel Storage Plane Development Kit (SPDK) etc.Experience with Board Management Controller frameworks (Redfish, OpenBMC etc.).Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

Define and develop software tests for our existing Embedded Linux platform, based on customer software requirements, using guidelines and methodologies specific to the automotive industry. Be able to work independently on assigned components and with support from technical coordinator/ experienced colleagues. Be responsible and contribute in software design for medium to high complexity modules/components and document according to established processes and methods. Responsible for implementing medium to high complex modules/ components according to established software specifications & design.Define SW (unit and functional) tests, work closely with SW architects, developers and requirements engineers to design and update test cases and alike documentation timely. Improve SW testing process and support others when there are blocking points. Share lessons learned, experience and tips & tricks across all team; prepare presentations and/or workshops of significant topics to the team.

Job DescriptionThis position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.This position aligns to that transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Transition is expected to close in late 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.The System Validation Engineer will be responsible for, but not limited to:Integrating and debugging software across the stack for a specific product, platform, feature, or technology throughout the product lifecycle, including pre-silicon development, power on, and/or post-silicon development.Debugging software across multiple layers of the software stack including firmware, drivers, and operating systems.Developing a software debug plan and associated methodologies.Analyzing issues, managing sightings from various validation streams, determining root cause, and driving or developing improvements. Driving project stress and stability and supports power, performance, and key task forces.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or STEM related field. Documentation related to bachelor's degree completion will be required4+ years of experience in either one of the following areas:Debugging hardware or software issues on Storage, Server, Platform or similar environments.Development and/or debug in Linux or Windows environments.Validation disciplines experience, system/platform level debug, or root cause isolation methodologies.Preferred Qualifications:2+ years of experience in either of the following areas:Low level code development/Debug for OS Drivers, FW, or Kernel.PCIe or NVMe protocol and debug (including debug tools and protocol analyzers).NAND memory validation.Experience with industry specifications such as PCIe NVME, OPAL, eSSC.PC Platform, BIOS, Drivers, or IO technologies.Continuous integration and agile methodologies.Inside this Business GroupEmployees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel.

Job Title: Software Dev Engineer in Test, Concept to Launch
Job Description: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field3+ years of professional experience as a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDE-T), Software Development Engineer (SDE), or related occupationExperience in test framework design and developmentProficiency in a modern, object-oriented programming language, e.g. Java, Kotlin, C++, C#, etc.Experience with scripting languages, e.g. Python, Perl, Ruby, JavaScript, etc.Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and develop a robust suite of test software that enables comprehensive quality at scale. Your test solutions will be applied extensively across a diverse range of domains that span the entire product lifecycle, from supply chain and manufacturing, to device capabilities and the customer shopping experience on launch day. If you're customer-obsessed and are passionate about shipping quality at scale, let's talk!As a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDE-T) on the team, you will be responsible for:Designing and developing test frameworks, test case automation and test tools to drive comprehensive product and launch readiness validations for Amazon's entire device portfolioCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, QA, product, customers and business stakeholders, to deep-dive customer use cases, expected system behaviors, and risks and mitigationsUsing data from testing, deployment and production environments to measure quality and drive actionable improvements to our productsEstablish engineering quality and testing best practices across the organization and the broader SDE-T communityExperience leading the design and development of automation test strategies for complex systems and deployment topologiesExperience in communicating with users, technical teams, and senior leadership to collect requirements and describe software product features and technical designsExperience with the full software development lifecycle and knowledge of professional software engineering practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing and operationsStrong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and distributed systemsStrong understanding of system and application performance characteristics

Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Hadoop and Spark, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis and Mongo and Scylla, all the way to structured SQL engines.This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about high quality and high reliability open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu.Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, automation, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open source community dynamics, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.What you'll doCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamWrite high quality, idiomatic Python code to create new featuresDebug issues and interact with upstream communities, in the openWork with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fieldsDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external eventsWho you areYou love technology and working with brilliant peopleYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operationsYou have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud and experience with private cloud solutions like OpenStackYou are experienced with Kubernetes and believe it can be used for serious persistent data servicesYou are an accomplished Python programmer that enjoys challenging projects in mission-critical environmentsYou have experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, Cassandra, InfluxDB, SQLite, Spark, ElasticsearchYou are familiar with DevOps concepts and technologiesExperience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technology.Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

Be a Part of the Technology RevolutionThere has never been a more exciting time to be part of an automotive technology company like Visteon. No industry offers more fast-paced change and opportunity than today’s automotive industry. We are in the midst of a mobility revolution that will completely change the way we interact with our vehicles, reduce the number of car accidents and fatalities, and make the world a cleaner place. Visteon is at the epicenter of this mobility revolution. Two major trends in the automotive industry – the shift to electric vehicles and vehicles with autonomous safety technologies – have created unique opportunities for Visteon. We are the only automotive provider solely focused exclusively on cockpit electronics – the fastest-growing segment in the industry.Company CultureWorking at Visteon is a journey in which our employees can develop their strengths and advance their careers while making a difference globally. Join us and help change the world and how we interact with our vehicles. Visteon is where the best technical talent creates the future.About VisteonVisteon is the only global automotive technology company solely focused on designing, engineering, and manufacturing innovative cockpit electronics and connected car solutions – the fastest-growing segment in the industry. Our technologies create a more enjoyable, safe, and connected driving experience.Headquartered in Van Buren Township, Michigan, United States, Visteon employs about 11,000 diverse people at more than 40 facilities in 18 countries. Visteon had sales of approximately $3 billion in 2019. Learn more at www.Visteon.comSystem Validation EngineerProjects/Technology responsibilities:Organizes execution of test tasks for product features assigned to him/her in accordance with project timeline and prioritiesDeploys Test Strategy and Test Architecture, System Configuration strategy, Change and defect management strategy for the tests under his/her responsibilities.Follows Test PlanContributes to review of the key performance indicators (KPIs) for the program and controls his/her performance.Responsible for the efficient execution of his/her tasks.Responsible for proper execution of requirements review test design, test review and test execution process within product features assigned.Supports Functional Safety and Cyber security process, being responsible for the test implementation and test execution of the requirements under functional validation scope.Responsible for proper defect logging and defect verification according to rules defined in the program.Supports Functional Safety, Legal and Cyber security process, being responsible for the test implementation and test execution of the requirements under functional validation scopeContributes to preparation of Test Reports, Coverage reports and Metrics for the product features assigned.Prepares test environment – hardware setup and software simulations (in the scope of test automation tools team)Visteon is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce!

Company DescriptionBosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch (1861-1942) and for more than 130 years has been distinguished by a unique corporate culture based on solid values that drive us to improve every day. Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an Embedded Software Test Engineer who is willing to work on a project where each team member contributes to the SW Development success of Active Safety (AS) systems. Technical curiosity paired with a passion for engineering is a must for this role, we are looking for someone who applies strategic problem solving and enables the team to understand even the most complex technical challenges down to the last bit. Eagerness to own SW/SYS testing topics as per the V Model Software Development Life Cycle is necessary.Key responsibilities:Requirement analysis.Knowhow on test design techniques.Test specification / test case development.Test automation.Test execution.Defect management.Hardware in Loop (HIL) debugging.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Electronics & Communications, Electronics, Electrical or Computer engineering.2-5 years of relevant experience.Able to develop test scenario to test the requirement.Experience in SW testing and system testing.Basic knowledge on process (SDLC / V-model).Experience in CANoe / CANalyzer.Programing skills, Python / CAPL / PERL.Experience in Hardware in Loop (HIL) ETAS / DSPACE test environment.Experience in diagnosis modules / UDS protocol.Bring up new test concept & methodology.Team player with good communication skills.Proficient in English (CEFR B2-C1).Willing to travel to US and Southern Asia.Preferred qualifications:Master’s degree in Electronics & Communications/Electronics/Electrical/Computer engineering.Knowledge about ESP system and algorithm + vehicle dynamics.Knowledge about Jenkins environment.Understanding the system/functional requirements.Knowledge on SW configuration management. (Ex: Clear Quest, ALM-RTC).Experience in agile process: Continuous integration and continuous testing.Additional InformationBosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 13,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life across the globe. Welcome to Bosch!

Are you an experienced software engineer with deep experience in building and shipping amazing products? Do you have high standards when it comes to code quality and user experiences? Are you the best developer on your team? Are you ready to work alongside the best engineers in the world for name-brand, industry-leading companies?Bluelight Consulting is seeking a React developer to join its growing team.As an engineer at Bluelight Consulting you will help our incredible clients achieve their technical goals in one of two ways: 1) Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client’s team and work alongside their existing engineers on a daily basis. 2) Design & Build: You will work on a Bluelight Consulting development team to build and ship greenfield applications for our clients.What We Are Looking For3+ years of professional software development experience. 5+ years preferred but not required.3+ years of professional experience working with React.Meaningful experience working on large, complex systems.A four-year college degree is required.Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon, both regarding estimates and the general process.Ability to identify with Bluelight's clients' goals and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them.Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed.Ability to create and maintain continuous integration and delivery of applications.A positive mindset and can-do attitude.Forensic attention to detail.You're passionate about software development... it's not just your career, it's your hobby. You're constantly striving to learn new things and improve. You follow industry news, regularly tinker with new technologies, and read books and blogs to keep your skills current.Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.What You'll Be DoingWork as part of a small team, which will include other developers, a project manager, a QA professional, and a designer.Complete two-week sprints, participate in sprint retrospectives, and daily standups.Assist with building estimates.Interface with clients via Slack, Zoom, and email.Track your time throughout the day using Toggl.Work with modern tools including Jira, Slack, GitHub, Google Docs, etc.Be part of a community of developers that share knowledge and help each other as problems arise.Follow Bluelight's detailed development process.Company BenefitsCompetitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases.Generous paid-time-off policyTechnology / Office stipendHealth CoverageFlexible working hoursWork remotelyContinuing education, training, conferencesCompany-sponsored coursework, exams, and certificationsBeing a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply. #LI-Remote

#Engineering #Testing # Software #Electronics #Computing #MechatronicThe ADAS (Advanced Driving Assistance Systems) Algorithm Test Engineer will be responsible for performing requirements analysis, creating test cases and automate the tests cases as much as possible, in order to efficiently validate the Algorithms developed for ADAS systems and provide useful statistics and information for the development of these algorithms.In ADAS Business Unit, we are developing cutting edge technologies to drive the future of mobility in the world, you will be part of a team that validates these new technologies. With your collaboration you will help Continental to save millions of lives around the world.Main responsibilities:Analyze requirements and design test cases which thoroughly validate these requirements.Responsible to write test scripts (in python) to automate tests and processes as much as possible.Adapt existing test scripts to changes in requirements.Execute manual and automated tests.Provide statistical information and functional status to developers, to improve the algorithms.Report and follow up to defects found in the Algorithms.Support software developer in root cause analysis when needed.

Salary Estimate: Sueldo provisto por el empleador:600 k$ - 900 k$
Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Si eres un ingeniero al que le apasiona crear productos innovadores que obtengan decenas de millones de vistas de páginas al día, Indeed te está buscando.Indeed ofrece a los desarrolladores inteligentes como tú, un complejo ecosistema de desarrollo con ciclos de lanzamiento cortos.Busca cada semana el lanzamiento de varios productos que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de crecimiento de millones de empresas y candidatos en el mundo.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.The Jobseeker Profile Platform team is the source of truth for all data on every job seeker on Indeed. Our mission is to help job seekers to effectively represent themselves to employers. Our vision is to provide centralized storage and distributed processing capacity with a pluggable framework for all Indeed client teams that use job seeker data.As part of our team, you will play a key role in designing/document and leading the development of features that are robustly monitored and alarmed in production for the next generation of services that will be used by millions of job seekers every day.We are building a distributed data storage solution for job seeker data. This system will be high throughput, low latency, and must be incredibly reliable as it is a key piece of the Indeed ecosystem. It will provide internal client teams self-service abilities such as read, process, and update for individual job seekers data or groups of job seeker data.Who You AreResponsabilidades:Como ingeniero de software del equipo de crecimiento de SMB, estarás a cargo de desarrollar software que sirva de guía a las empresas para publicar ofertas de empleo de alta calidad que puedan conseguir un buen desempeño en los resultados de las búsquedas de Indeed.Desarrollarás IU y API que guíen a las empresas y les señalen los problemas de sus ofertas de empleo que podrían estar evitando que sean cubiertas.Formarás parte de un equipo de colaboración de ingenieros, diseñadores de experiencias de usuarios y gerentes de producto sumamente talentosos. Con frecuencia indagamos en la información disponible en Indeed para analizar, fundamentar y desarrollar soluciones para los problemas adecuados.Si te gusta revisar la información, analizarla y estudiarla de distintas formas para poder aportar conocimiento interesante, este es tu lugar ideal.Requisitos:Maestría en Ciencias de la informática, Ingeniería computacional, Ingeniería eléctrica, Matemáticas o alguna otra carrera afín del área técnica computacional, con más de 5 años de experiencia en programación con al menos un año en alguno de los siguientes lenguajes: Java, JavaScript o Python.Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo de aplicaciones de pila completa con React y Redux.Experiencia en GraphQL deseable.Más de 3 años de experiencia como líder de ingenieros júnior.experiencia significativa en sistemas de alto rendimiento a gran escala.This team is seeking an experienced Java engineer that is familiar with the standard Java technologies and has experience working at scale. We are a deliberate team that drives development based on careful planning and a data-driven approach to new feature request.We are looking for someone who:Feels a sense of ownership in whatever they work on.Has Identified, implemented and delivered service for a specific product opportunity.Embraces continual improvement, and love to learn and develop new skillsThinks about why something needs to be built, not just what needs to be builtHas strong opinions on technical direction without a strong egoRequirements:3+ years of software development experience with programming languages and technologies such as Java.Proficient verbal and written communication in English required2+ years of experience with either NoSQL or SQL technologies.Deep understanding of the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including coding standards, code review, source control, build, test, deploy, and operations.Professional experience working with high-performance systems, large scale systems.Experience with web technologies and full stack development.Experience building solutions for high traffic web sites is a plus.Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field (Master’s is a plus).Ability to work efficiently on a remote/distributed team.Nice to have:Lead and mentored other engineers on the team.Experience with large scale distributed systems.Experience with multiple OO languages.Experience with Mongo, Kafka, AWSExperience with test-driven development.Experience with agile methodology.Who we areSomos una organización de ingeniería de rápido crecimiento y gran capacidad que está construyendo la página web de búsqueda de empleo más conocida del mundo. Con centros de ingeniería en Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokio, Singapur, Hyderabad, Dublín, Aberdeen y Vancouver, estamos mejorando la vida de las personas en todo el mundo con cada búsqueda de empleo.We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Como la página de búsqueda de empleo número 1 del mundo*, nuestra misión es “We help all people get jobs”. Nos esforzamos por conseguir un lugar de trabajo inclusivo y accesible en el que todo el mundo se sienta cómodo, y queremos ampliar nuestro equipo con personas que compartan nuestro entusiasmo por la innovación y por ofrecer la mejor experiencia posible a los/as candidatos/as.(*comScore total de visitas, septiembre de 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.El rango salarial base representa el límite inferior y superior del rango salarial de Indeed para este puesto. Los salarios reales variarán dependiendo de factores como, por ejemplo, la ubicación, la experiencia y el desempeño. El rango indicado es solo un componente del paquete de compensación total de Indeed para los empleados. Otras recompensas pueden incluir bonificaciones trimestrales, unidades de acciones restringidas (RSU), una política abierta de días libres remunerados y muchos beneficios específicos de cada región.Salary Range TransparencyMexico City 600,000 - 900,000 MXN per yearEqual Opportunities and Accommodations StatementIndeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.Indeed está seriamente comprometido con la construcción de un lugar de trabajo y una comunidad global donde la inclusión no solo se valora, sino que se prioriza. Estamos orgullosos de ser una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y que busca crear un entorno acogedor y diverso. Todos los candidatos calificados serán considerados para el empleo sin tener en cuenta raza, color, religión, género, identidad o expresión de género, estado familiar, estado civil, orientación sexual, origen nacional, genética, neurodiversidad, discapacidad, edad o condición de veterano ni ningún otro motivo que no se base en el mérito o esté legalmente protegido.Indeed se compromete a proporcionar adaptaciones razonables a las personas calificadas con discapacidades en el proceso de postulación. Para solicitar una adaptación, ponte en contacto con Talent Attraction Help (ayuda de atracción de talento) al teléfono 1-855-567-7767 o poremail a TAhelp@indeed.com al menos una semana antes de tu entrevista.Our Policies and BenefitsView Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobsLearn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/Ver las políticas de privacidad y accesibilidad de los candidatos de Indeed - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobsConoce nuestros beneficios, programas y beneficios internacionales para empleados - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/Reference ID: 35947

Job Title: Software Development Engineer in Test II
Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Un ingeniero de desarrollo de software en prueba (SDET) en Indeed es un desarrollador con la responsabilidad principal de construir la infraestructura y el soporte de herramientas para permitir que SWE escriba la automatización de prueba. Es un rol único y desafiante y brinda una inmensa oportunidad para diseñar y desarrollar marcos de trabajo de gran alcance y patrones de diseño para permitir la entrega de código de alta velocidad.Al ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.A Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Indeed is a developer with the primary responsibility of building the infrastructure and tooling support to enable SWEs to write test automation. It is a very unique and challenging role and provides immense opportunity to design and develop wide-reaching frameworks and design patterns to enable high velocity code deliveryBeing the part of the SMB team you’ll be writing code that automatically verifies the quality of the product and build out testing apis/services/tools that enable others to do so as well. Drive the strategy for testability of the product with understanding of customer usage models in real-world environmentsSDETs at Indeed are highly skilled who are able to debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement/improve tools and frameworks needed to streamline our testing process. Being a member of the product teams will work directly with other product teams and cross functional roles to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated solutions to deliver quality features with efficiency.Who You AreCalificaciones requeridas:BS o MS en Ciencias de la Computación (o equivalente)Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 5 años de experiencia como Desarrollador o SDETGran capacidad para escribir código efectivo (Java, Spring, Servicios web, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Servicios web, XML, AJAX, Microservicios, SOA, REST, JSON).Comunicación efectiva entre funciones para identificar las necesidades de herramientas, las brechas de automatización y reducir el trabajo duro en el proceso de desarrollo.Sólida experiencia con el desarrollo ágil que incorpora integración continua y entrega continua, utilizando tecnologías como GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDepure código, resuelva problemas complejos relacionados con la eficiencia y el rendimiento de nuestro software con el monitoreo de producción adecuadoDiseñar e implementar nuevas herramientas, marcos de prueba automatizados escalables que funcionen en todas las tecnologías.Fuerte experiencia en la construcción de herramientas de desarrollo y monitoreo como parte esencial del sistema de producción.Tutoría con revisiones detalladas del código fuente junto con orientación técnica para la arquitectura y el diseño en generalFuertes habilidades organizativas, priorización y entregables/resultadosCapaz de lidiar bien con problemas ambiguos/indefinidos; capacidad de pensar en abstracto.Calificaciones preferidas:Conocimientos de programación funcional.Docker, experiencia KubernetesFuerte comprensión de los fundamentos de la informática, diseño de algoritmos y estructuras de datos.Experiencia en Análisis Orientado a Objetos, Diseño (OOAD) y desarrollo de software utilizando Metodología UML, buen conocimiento de patrones de diseño J2EE y patrones de diseño Core JavaArticular de manera efectiva cualquier desafío técnico y problema indefinidoProporcionar soluciones innovadoras relacionadas con nuevas herramientas y marcos.Entrega de activos de prueba altamente personalizados con una combinación de herramientas y técnicas para brindar una excelente experiencia de usuarioEsforzarse por la escalabilidad, confiabilidad, consistencia y rendimiento del producto en producciónAl ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Required Qualifications:BS or MS in Computer Science (or equivalent)Proficient verbal and written communication in English required5+ years of experience as Developer or SDETStrong ability to write effective code ( Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Web Services, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON.)Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the development process.Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDebug code, solve complex problems related to efficiency and performance of our software with appropriate production monitoringDesign and Implement new tools, scalable automated test frameworks working across technologiesStrong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of production systemMentoring with detailed source code reviews along with technical guidance to overall architecture and designStrong organizational skills, prioritization and deliverables/resultsAble to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of functional programmingDocker, Kubernetes experienceStrong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design and data structuresExperience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of J2EE design patterns and Core Java design patternsEffectively articulate any technical challenges and undefined problemsProvide innovative solutions related to new tooling and frameworksDelivering highly customized test assets with mix of tools and techniques to provide a great user experienceStriving for Product scalability, reliability, consistency and performance in ProductionWho we areWe are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.Salary Range TransparencyMexico City 600,000 - 900,000 MXN per yearEqual Opportunities and Accommodations StatementIndeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.Fair Chance HiringWe value diverse experiences, including those who have had prior contact with the criminal legal system. We are committed to providing individuals with criminal records, including formerly incarcerated individuals, a fair chance at employment.Our Policies and BenefitsView Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobsLearn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/Where legally permitted, Indeed requires all individuals attending or working out of Indeed offices or visiting Indeed clients to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For positions that require some in-office work or in-person client meetings, exceptions to these in-office or in-person job requirements may be made at the discretion of the business through June 2022, at which point full vaccination will be required. Are you a customer support engineer who is obsessed with delivering a great experience, but you’ve already mastered your current products and are wondering what’s next? Or are you a software engineer looking for a way to get introduced to an immense set of product architectures, domains, and tech stacks? Sure, you could join any new company and learn their handful of products, but we think we have something better.We are the Customer Support team at Trilogy. We support over 100 unique enterprise software products - everything from mobile app development platforms to database load-balancers. We not only have the opportunity to learn, use, and support these products, we also become deep technical experts who can solve problems no one has seen before. There’s a lot to learn, so we have weekly “learning tickets” to ensure the whole team is up to speed.This role is the highest-level customer support engineer we have - our tickets cannot be elevated above you. The problems are complex. The solutions might be configuration, database-level, or even code-level. Trilogy takes pride in its customer support quality and makes sure customers are impressed at every interaction. It’s an immense responsibility, but one that can put you on the fast track to career advancement.What you will be doingImpressing customers by solving complex or new problemsGrowing your product knowledge, in breadth and depthDigging deep to discover the root causes and solutions of issues - exploring source code, databases, logs, and tracesWhat you won’t be doingAnswering the same questions over and over againProviding trivial or basic troubleshootingWriting knowledge base articlesApplication Support Engineer key responsibilitiesResolving elevated customer ticketsExpanding product and technology expertise by working on “learning tickets”Basic Requirements2+ years of software development2+ years of experience with customer-facing technical supportAvailability for 8-hour shiftsAbout TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced!Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Salary Estimate: Sueldo provisto por el empleador:318 k$
Job Description: Around here, technology is second nature. Big ideas and new innovations aren’t just part of our history, we bring them to life every day in ways that keep millions connected to their favorite apps, entertainment, news, friends and family, and well… daily life. That’s where you come in, making sure our customers can tackle everything from viral video uploads to social chats, and find out on their commute to work who’s moving to the next round in their favorite reality show. All with a seamless experience.We’re only scratching the surface when we’re talking troubleshooting uploading pet pics and swiping right. You’ll find yourself working with our technology teams and engineers to improve the experience for everyone. Think updating knowledge bases for global support teams, flagging technical issues and testing software updates, or making sure your teammates know the latest smartwatch requires a few tweaks to work best with our network.Who makes a great fit for the role? There are a few must-haves:Advanced English Fluency to engage with U.S. customers and read, write, and understand technical documentation.Curiosity about technology. If you’ve ever clicked 20 links deep in a wiki article and come out an engineering expert, let’s chat.Communication skills to effectively work with everyone from budding social stars to CEOs urgently needing their email to work.Knowledge and ability to navigate Windows, iOS, Android and cloud services (iCloud, Google Drive, OneDrive).Qualified applicants will have a mix of experience or education in Level 1 or 2 technical or help desk support, computer sciences, customer services or other relevant knowledge. Our center operates 7am to 9:15pm CST seven days a week, requiring flexibility in scheduling. In return, we offer the option to work from home the majority of your work shift (3-4 days a week) and the flexibility to help you work around life’s obligations.In order to be considered for remote work accommodations you must have a suitable space to work and a minimum 20 Mbps internet connection.There’s more than a paycheck in it for the right candidate. Our compensation package includes:Base Salary: MXN $26,466Grocery voucher MXN $2,680Restaurant voucher MXN $1,761Medical InsuranceSaving Fund50% discount on five lines of AT&T Wireless service.Vacation days, plus three personal days, life insurance, onsite medical and more.Paid starting from your first day of training, including benefits.Daycare discounts with participating child-care centers.Work from Home Support AllowanceReady to step into a future with AT&T? Apply today!Job Type: Full-timePay: From $26,466.00 per month

We’re looking for telecommunications technicians to help us deliver this service to our customers.Unlike in most companies, you won’t just sit around all day pulling tickets and wondering whether you’re doing them correctly.
