DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

The ADAS Embedded Software team requires an experienced SW engineer with vast experience analyzing requirements, developing and debugging code by many means, understanding hardware architecture, hardware communication protocols, complex software development topics. Our software engineers actively work in teams to create and update software components of Driving Assistance products that are being developed or already are in production or commercial use.Our engineers are part of a multidisciplinary and global community responsible for the design, integration and maintenance of Continental products using the AutoSAR framework with presence in several software components such as diagnostics, error handling, communications, cybersecurity, memory management, power management in electromagnetic radars and/or vehicle control systems.Additional responsibilitiesDevelop embedded sensor software to meet product requirementsPlanning and organizing test commitments and activities for specific projectsMaintain correspondence with multiple engineering teams, both national and foreign.Develop sustainable software and support other teams in charge of its verificationMaintain a thorough understand of customer and product requirementsBe part of the technical development of other engineers by training them or helping them to understand the technical needs of our productsBreakdown technical topics and requirements to provide guidance to younger engineers on how to perform their work effectivelyFollow the Continental development life cycle process, including development and QA activities

Job Title: High Level Design Software Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionHave you worked on High Level Design (HLD) C++ applications or implemented HLD acceleration systems? Do you love collaborating with internal teams and helping customers with their end products? Is it exciting to work in a diverse team that spans multiple domains and vertical markets? Do you want to make valuable contributions to the team that helps identify market trends, then help influence next generation products and solutions?As a business unit within Intel, we will continue to apply Moore's Law to drive the future of field-programmable gate array (FPGA) technology. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To take advantage of the many opportunities in the future for FPGA's, PSG is looking for an outstanding High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer to join our Customer Experience Group (CEG) team specializing in HLD development using DPC++, oneAPI, FPGA Design, Flows, and Debug.As a High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer in CEG, you will be responsible to support Intel FPGA solutions proactively to enable customers to quickly get their solutions to market. Additionally, you will interface directly with cross functional teams to contribute to the next generation product definition, identify market trends and direction, and quickly resolve complex technical issues to allow customers to meet the market demands.Your specific role includes, but is not limited to:Providing guidance from a customer and systems perspective to cross functional teams to create optimal solutions.Creating demos to showcase the capabilities of Intel PSG solutions.Handling customer escalations to provide solutions to meet customer requirements and working directly with development teams to build improved solutions in the future.Providing product readiness feedback as an early user to cross functional teams and managing efforts to improve the product.Developing reference designs or subcomponents to align with key market strategies, which allows customers to evaluate the technology while offering a starting point for their project.Driving the strategy of new technology training for both internal and external audiences.Authoring documentation and other applicable materials to explain products and solutions.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Attention to detail.Analytical and problem-solving skills.Be self-motivated.Work effectively in a team environment.Communication and interpersonal skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Intermediate to advanced English.3+ months of experience in either of the following:Area within C++, computational, algorithmic, and/or area related to CPU/GPU/FPGA/etc.High Level Design Tools, Vitis, HLS (High Level Synthesis), oneAPI, Mathworks, DSPBuilder, Quartus, Vivado, or related.Preferred QualificationsExperience in an area related to C++.Experience working on customer engagements, applications development.Experience with code optimization using parallelism, pipelining, memory management, concurrency, and multi-threading.Experience with Embedded Systems.Experience with oneAPI, OpenCL, HLS, Quartus, and other FPGA centric design flows and tools.Experience in HDL (Hardware Description Language), verification, and general computational logic design/verification concepts.Experience with Git and development tools.Experience in with computational algorithms theory.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Continental Engineering Services (CES) is seeking for an AUTOSAR Software Engineer. As an AUTOSAR software developer for automotive applications you will be integral part of a global and diverse team for the next generation of vehicles. Our engineer will be responsible for software decisions, analyze requirements, configure BSW (Basic Software), integrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules, assist customer in resolving configuration errors, design software architecture, maintenance of different AUTOSAR components and many other specific applications for projects within the Chassis & Safety division such as:Advanced Electronic Brake Systems: our engineers work with Continental’s advances brake unit to maintain, and develop solutions that are benchmark in the industry such as Antilock braking, traction and stability control, regenerative braking to enhance electric and hybrid vehicles cruising range, supporting ADAS functions to brake autonomously the vehicle in emergency situations, etc.Automated Driver Assistance Systems: with the help of our advanced environment sensors, lidars, cameras and radars our software engineer contribute to provide solutions for driver assistance and automated driving functions such as blind spot detection, driver monitoring, emergency break assist, intelligent headlight assist, surround views, etc.Active Damping Control Systems: CES engineers requires to work with state-of-the-art technologies with AUTOSAR architecture to solve the conflicts that exist between optimal riding comfort and agile handling by creating software to adjust damping force on every wheel depending load and driving conditions.Airbag Controllers and other safety solutions: our engineer also focus in occupant protections such airbag controller, adapting platform to customer needs and government regulations, the design of software with impressive quality is required in these products to make sure our software saves lives when accident occur.Our AUTOSAR Software engineers share common goals to drive and contribute to the automotive industry with the goal to protect all people inside and outside the vehicle, to innovate in mobility solutions, and ultimately, achieve Continental’s Vision Zero: zero fatalities, zero injuries, zero accidents.Core Responsibilities:AUTOSAR Software development tasksGather and analyze OEMs Software RequirementsPerform software testing to detect functional, logic or implementation errorsConfigure BSW (Basic Software) according with OEMs requirementsIntegrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules with different AutoCore tools (e.g. EB Tressos, Davinci, etc.)Analyze customer bug reports and provide solutionsWork with diverse teamsEstimate work package efforts. Evaluate the impact of engineering modifications in the software.Coach/support team membersAdditional Responsibilities:Flexibility to work in variety of different automotive projectsSoftware Project Technical Lead tasksSupport technical discussions with customerSupport/Test the developed modules in the vehicleSupport requirements engineering and elicitation processesPerform unit testing and software debuggingAssistance with other tasks as needed and determined by ManagementDocumentation of detail software development plan, test plans, test design, analysis, computer modeling, prototype/production test scripts and specification releasesDefine strategies to continuously improve processes and tools.

Job DescriptionLeads the creation, implementation, and optimization of software tools in support of various domains including design, manufacturing, validation, silicon production, systems integration, software application products, or ecosystem enabling. Utilizes modern software development methodologies, programming languages, domain knowledge, and secure coding practices to design, develop, debug, and/or validate algorithms, software tools, and systems that enable our internal/external engineering partners to design/manufacture intel silicon, integrate Intel silicon and/or software into impactful products. Examples of tools/systems include debuggers, analyzers, SDKs, IDEs, PDKs, performance monitors, software tools and libraries, flows, and/or methodologies for design, manufacturing, validation, and test.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's OR Master's, in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering, with 3+ years of active experience in large-scale software development. ("Cedula Profesional" may be required).The 3+ years of experience can be a mix of the following:3+ years of actively developing in C, C++ , Python or similar languages.2+ years of Computer Architecture knowledge of computer systems including multicore CPUs or GPUs, memory subsystem, interconnects, IO devices.2+ years of experience with modern computer operating systems (Linux, Chrome or Windows).3+ years of working in software development teams using team collaboration tools for repository storage, testing, issues and project tracking.Preferred QualificationsPh. D. in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering or relevant engineering field.Inside this Business GroupEnable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Division Chassis & Safety, Advanced Engineering.The Software Tester Engineer will be responsible for the development, analysis and integration of Software embeded solutions related to Passive Safety Systems, enhanced by vehicle surrounding sensors and their coordination interaction. The scope of work will span much of Continental's safety systems portfolio, up to and including Automated Driving Systems.Core responsibilities:Working on defining/analyzing customer and user requirements for testing, designing innovative solutions, and seeing the product through to customer release.You will be developing software test cases and using established design guidelines and testing guidelines.You will be expected to use a variety of tools that support requirements capture, design documentation, management of code, builds and tests.Will also be expected to align according with estimates for simple tasks based on team experience and manage their own time in accordance with defined project tasks.Developing both unit test strategies and tests for individual components, and developing integration test strategies and tests for collections of components delivering high-level functionality.Critical thinking in managing tasks, architecture, design, and coding will be the measure of a successful candidate.Software Test Project Managing, i.e. being the main interface to the overall Software Test Manager, being responsible for the successful conduct of the SW task assigned in terms of time, efforts and quality might be needed.Maintaining Continuous Integration global environment supporting NA region.

Job DescriptionIntel DEG ( Design Engineering Group) / iVE (Intel Validation Engineering Group) is looking for an experienced Software Developer to join our engineering team and help us develop tools used in a new project utilizing AI/ML (Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning) to improve hardware validation.Software Developer responsibilities include writing and testing code, debugging programs and integrating low-level applications. Specifically, single and multi-threaded programming and packages for file management3+ months of experience with Git version controlExposure to C/C++ and object-oriented OOP programmingWork experience following a Software Development LifeCycleAdvanced English Level (spoken and written)Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of NoSQL databasesKnowledge of HTML REST APIInside this Business GroupThe everyday contributions of the Intel Validation Engineering (iVE) team are essential to retaining/regaining Intel's product leadership. Intro:Continental is the trusted name for OEM connectivity in commercial vehicles. The world’s toughest machines need field-proven hardware that is up to the challenge. Vibration, shock, dirt and grime don’t stop our cellular devices from keeping customers – and their assets – connected and up-to-date. The heavy-duty vehicles of tomorrow can get the job done today with our cost-effective off-the-shelf and custom networking devices. Go beyond the road and beyond Automotive quality anywhere in the world with the security and affordability of Continental’s Telematics devices for heavy-duty trucks and buses.Job Description :Help expand Continental's array of telematics products by verifying that all new firmware and software are of the highest quality. Using your QA experience and engineering skillset, you will create and execute the test cases required to ensure that new products and features meet customer expectations.Research and create firmware test cases for new products and firmware updates.Execute test cases and cycles with excellent attention to detail detecting all unexpected device behavior during software validation process.Create bug tickets with required documentation, following the agile process when unexpected behavior is seen.Work with hardware engineers and firmware developers to clarify relevant product requirements.Support automating the firmware validation process.

Company DescriptionBosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch (1861-1942) and for more than 130 years has been distinguished by a unique corporate culture based on solid values that drive us to improve every day. Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionResponsible for creation of Test specifications / Develop / execute manual / automated test lists to validate product features in Lab/Car environment.Specific duties:Responsible for creation of Test specifications based on SW requirements.Develop & execute manual/automated test lists to validate product features in Lab/Car environment.Debugging and troubleshooting software.Development scripts to automate tests.Responsible for Documentation of tests and issue trackingClose interaction with Global TeamQualificationsSkills, Knowledge and Experience Levels:Bachelor degree in Automotive Engineering, Electronics, Mechatronics, Computer Engineering, or similar.Automate tests.Experience with CAN and Diagnosis standards is a big plus.Verification and Validation.Testing.Nice to have:Overview on tools like DOOR’s, CANalyzer, CANoe, CAN stressExperience in developing according to ASPICE or CMMI preferred.Experience with CAN and Diagnosis standards is a big plus.Experience with Agile methodologies.Familiarity with automotive coding rules.Experience with source control management tools (i.e. Subversion, GIT, MKS).Additional InformationBosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 13,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch!

The Facilitator Release Train Engineer as a part of the agile release train management team drives and foster the Agile methodology and team interaction for a product specific purpose.She/He is ensuring qualitative development by facilitating agreed upon methods conformance and facilitate a continuous improvement of the whole trainResponsibilitiesCoaching and alignment of the Product Manager, Customers and Business Owners to understand agility as well as the development of an agile mindset.Coaches the Product Managers and the associated teams to have a common basic understanding of process, principle and used methods (e.g. integration testing or requirements).Assists stakeholders with economic decision-making by guiding features and capabilities estimation.Brings the Agile Release Train into a self-sustaining state (self-organizing, self-managing teams, and collaborating teams).Facilitates agile ceremonies, e.g., the Product Increment planning event, Inspect and Adapt Workshop, and System Demo.Facilitates Product Increment Planning readiness.Supports proper team setup/organization and knowledge, skill and competency distribution.Develops Agile Teams, which may be distributed over multiple locations and roles like collaboration with architecture team.Identify, own and remove impediments of the agile release train to optimize the flow of value through the teams. Escalate and track impediments to Solution Train Engineers or line management in case an own clarification was not successful.Drives the Agile Release Train efforts in relentless improvement (e.g. via Inspect and Adapt workshops) and challenges the team actively to improve their efficiency, i.e. by increasing automation rate.Assists tracking the execution of features and capabilities by monitoring the overall performance of the ART in order to ensure a continuously improving development flow in assistance to the Product Management.Foster relentless improvement.Acts as interface and guide to the non-agile world to protect the Agile Teams and the Agile Release Train.Summarizes and publish Program Increment objectives for visibility and transparency.Ensure alignment between disciplines.Supports proper Release Train setup/organization.

Be part of the Vehicle Dynamics (VED) Software group at Continental and participate to the creation of our MK1xx and MKCx products: the Brake systems used in conventional, electric and autonomous cars of today and tomorrow.Our ECU is the main Chassis controller and provides functions to control the vehicle dynamics as the car trajectory (ABS, ACC, AYC, HSA, IPB, TCS...) for global car manufacturers in America (USA, Mexico, Brazil).In VED, you will have the opportunity to practice the benchmark tools of our Automotive development and the state-of-the-art methods for Software development environment using IBM Jazz, GIT tools...You will be joining an international team and be guided by experienced engineers into the different phases of SW Integration.You will be collaborating with the worldwide network of VED colleagues.Your main tasks (following ASPICE SWE.5):Be the first contact for SW integration topics: provide information and coordinate activities among the SW project team for internal stakeholders.Plan and perform the SW integration and integration test strategy according to SW milestones.Monitor SW health with the help of the SW Factory.Ensure the changes planned are included, properly validated and meet the quality standards.Evaluate the impact of engineering modifications in the software.Perform basic software testing to detect functional, logic or implementation errors.Create the SW work products by following the defined process (SW executable, calibrations, EEprom and documentation).Detect and communicate any risk that might impact the SW logic or project schedule.Develop and improve on existing SW engineering methods, tools and procedures.

#ComputerScienceDegree #MechatronicsDegree #ElectronicDegreeAs ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineer you’ll help to develop Long and Short-Range Radar sensors, Camera Vision systems, LiDAR and other related advanced vehicle sensing components to enable driving functions and other automated driving features to make Autonomous Mobility happen.ADAS is currently developing functions such as Full-Speed Range Adaptive Cruise Controls, Lane Departure Warning, Blind Spot Detection, Forward Object Detection and Collision Mitigation Systems.A Testing Engineer is required to test the product or system to ensure it functions properly and meets its requirements. Test Engineers rigorously examine products, using creativity and technical skill to fix bugs and devise testing systems. You’ll design, implement and execute the necessary tests to verify the embedded software that enables the driving functions and features.The ADAS Embedded Software Test Engineers aren't just manual testers, if a test/process can be automated the ADAS Test engineer is responsible for the automation. You’ll write scripts to automate testing and tools, so testing is done on a continuous basis.Responsibilities:Design, develop and execute Software test specifications (test cases, procedures, scenarios and test plans) based on the customer requirements for ADAS products.Planning and tracking of tests (esp. test goals, test objects, test efforts, resources and schedules).Contribute to the design of new test environments and develop test automation tools.Automate tests using test frameworks.Work with development teams to fulfil architecture & design requirements

#Engineering #Testing # Software #Electronics #Computing #MechatronicThe ADAS (Advanced Driving Assistance Systems) Algorithm Test Engineer will be responsible for performing requirements analysis, creating test cases and automate the tests cases as much as possible, in order to efficiently validate the Algorithms developed for ADAS systems and provide useful statistics and information for the development of these algorithms.In ADAS Business Unit, we are developing cutting edge technologies to drive the future of mobility in the world, you will be part of a team that validates these new technologies. With your collaboration you will help Continental to save millions of lives around the world.Main responsibilities:Analyze requirements and design test cases which thoroughly validate these requirements.Responsible to write test scripts (in python) to automate tests and processes as much as possible.Adapt existing test scripts to changes in requirements.Execute manual and automated tests.Provide statistical information and functional status to developers, to improve the algorithms.Report and follow up to defects found in the Algorithms.Support software developer in root cause analysis when needed.

Job Title: Software Development Engineer in Test II
Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Un ingeniero de desarrollo de software en prueba (SDET) en Indeed es un desarrollador con la responsabilidad principal de construir la infraestructura y el soporte de herramientas para permitir que SWE escriba la automatización de prueba. Es un rol único y desafiante y brinda una inmensa oportunidad para diseñar y desarrollar marcos de trabajo de gran alcance y patrones de diseño para permitir la entrega de código de alta velocidad.Al ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.A Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Indeed is a developer with the primary responsibility of building the infrastructure and tooling support to enable SWEs to write test automation. It is a very unique and challenging role and provides immense opportunity to design and develop wide-reaching frameworks and design patterns to enable high velocity code deliveryBeing the part of the SMB team you’ll be writing code that automatically verifies the quality of the product and build out testing apis/services/tools that enable others to do so as well. Drive the strategy for testability of the product with understanding of customer usage models in real-world environmentsSDETs at Indeed are highly skilled who are able to debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement/improve tools and frameworks needed to streamline our testing process. Being a member of the product teams will work directly with other product teams and cross functional roles to understand project features, review technical designs, and implement automated solutions to deliver quality features with efficiency.Who You AreCalificaciones requeridas:BS o MS en Ciencias de la Computación (o equivalente)Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 5 años de experiencia como Desarrollador o SDETGran capacidad para escribir código efectivo (Java, Spring, Servicios web, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Servicios web, XML, AJAX, Microservicios, SOA, REST, JSON).Comunicación efectiva entre funciones para identificar las necesidades de herramientas, las brechas de automatización y reducir el trabajo duro en el proceso de desarrollo.Sólida experiencia con el desarrollo ágil que incorpora integración continua y entrega continua, utilizando tecnologías como GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDepure código, resuelva problemas complejos relacionados con la eficiencia y el rendimiento de nuestro software con el monitoreo de producción adecuadoDiseñar e implementar nuevas herramientas, marcos de prueba automatizados escalables que funcionen en todas las tecnologías.Fuerte experiencia en la construcción de herramientas de desarrollo y monitoreo como parte esencial del sistema de producción.Tutoría con revisiones detalladas del código fuente junto con orientación técnica para la arquitectura y el diseño en generalFuertes habilidades organizativas, priorización y entregables/resultadosCapaz de lidiar bien con problemas ambiguos/indefinidos; capacidad de pensar en abstracto.Calificaciones preferidas:Conocimientos de programación funcional.Docker, experiencia KubernetesFuerte comprensión de los fundamentos de la informática, diseño de algoritmos y estructuras de datos.Experiencia en Análisis Orientado a Objetos, Diseño (OOAD) y desarrollo de software utilizando Metodología UML, buen conocimiento de patrones de diseño J2EE y patrones de diseño Core JavaArticular de manera efectiva cualquier desafío técnico y problema indefinidoProporcionar soluciones innovadoras relacionadas con nuevas herramientas y marcos.Entrega de activos de prueba altamente personalizados con una combinación de herramientas y técnicas para brindar una excelente experiencia de usuarioEsforzarse por la escalabilidad, confiabilidad, consistencia y rendimiento del producto en producciónAl ser parte del equipo de SMB, escribirá código que verifica automáticamente la calidad del producto y creará API/servicios/herramientas de prueba que permitan que otros también lo hagan. Impulse la estrategia para la capacidad de prueba del producto con la comprensión de los modelos de uso del cliente en entornos del mundo real.Los SDET de Indeed están altamente capacitados y pueden depurar código, automatizar tareas repetitivas e implementar/mejorar las herramientas y los marcos necesarios para agilizar nuestro proceso de prueba. Ser miembro de los equipos de productos trabajará directamente con otros equipos de productos y funciones cruzadas para comprender las características del proyecto, revisar los diseños técnicos e implementar soluciones automatizadas para ofrecer características de calidad con eficiencia.Required Qualifications:BS or MS in Computer Science (or equivalent)Proficient verbal and written communication in English required5+ years of experience as Developer or SDETStrong ability to write effective code ( Java, Spring, Web Services, HTML, JSP, Java Script, Servlets, Web Services, XML, AJAX, Microservices, SOA, REST, JSON.)Effective communication across functions to identify tooling needs, automation gaps, and reduce toil in the development process.Strong experience with Agile development incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Jenkins, Spinnaker, DatadogDebug code, solve complex problems related to efficiency and performance of our software with appropriate production monitoringDesign and Implement new tools, scalable automated test frameworks working across technologiesStrong experience in building development and monitoring tools as an essential part of production systemMentoring with detailed source code reviews along with technical guidance to overall architecture and designStrong organizational skills, prioritization and deliverables/resultsAble to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of functional programmingDocker, Kubernetes experienceStrong understanding of computer science fundamentals, algorithm design and data structuresExperience in Object Oriented Analysis, Design(OOAD) and development of software using UML Methodology, good knowledge of J2EE design patterns and Core Java design patternsEffectively articulate any technical challenges and undefined problemsProvide innovative solutions related to new tooling and frameworksDelivering highly customized test assets with mix of tools and techniques to provide a great user experienceStriving for Product scalability, reliability, consistency and performance in ProductionWho we areWe are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.Salary Range TransparencyMexico City 600,000 - 900,000 MXN per yearEqual Opportunities and Accommodations StatementIndeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.Fair Chance HiringWe value diverse experiences, including those who have had prior contact with the criminal legal system. We are committed to providing individuals with criminal records, including formerly incarcerated individuals, a fair chance at employment.Our Policies and BenefitsView Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobsLearn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/Where legally permitted, Indeed requires all individuals attending or working out of Indeed offices or visiting Indeed clients to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For positions that can only be performed at an Indeed office, candidates must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and present acceptable proof of vaccination by the date of hire as a condition of employment. For positions that require some in-office work or in-person client meetings, exceptions to these in-office or in-person job requirements may be made at the discretion of the business through June 2022, at which point full vaccination will be required. Indeed will consider requests for reasonable accommodation as required under applicable law. To qualify as being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 there should have been a two week period after receiving the second dose (or any government recommended booster shot) in a 2-dose COVID-19 vaccine series, or a two week period after receiving a single-dose (or any government recommended booster shot) in a single dose COVID-19 vaccine.Reference ID: 35345

Are you a customer support engineer who is obsessed with delivering a great experience, but you’ve already mastered your current products and are wondering what’s next? Or are you a software engineer looking for a way to get introduced to an immense set of product architectures, domains, and tech stacks? Sure, you could join any new company and learn their handful of products, but we think we have something better.We are the Customer Support team at Trilogy. We support over 100 unique enterprise software products - everything from mobile app development platforms to database load-balancers. We not only have the opportunity to learn, use, and support these products, we also become deep technical experts who can solve problems no one has seen before. There’s a lot to learn, so we have weekly “learning tickets” to ensure the whole team is up to speed.This role is the highest-level customer support engineer we have - our tickets cannot be elevated above you. The problems are complex. The solutions might be configuration, database-level, or even code-level. Trilogy takes pride in its customer support quality and makes sure customers are impressed at every interaction. It’s an immense responsibility, but one that can put you on the fast track to career advancement.What you will be doingImpressing customers by solving complex or new problemsGrowing your product knowledge, in breadth and depthDigging deep to discover the root causes and solutions of issues - exploring source code, databases, logs, and tracesWhat you won’t be doingAnswering the same questions over and over againProviding trivial or basic troubleshootingWriting knowledge base articlesApplication Support Engineer key responsibilitiesResolving elevated customer ticketsExpanding product and technology expertise by working on “learning tickets”Basic Requirements2+ years of software development2+ years of experience with customer-facing technical supportAvailability for 8-hour shiftsAbout TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced!Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Salary Estimate: Sueldo provisto por el empleador:318 k$
Job Description: Around here, technology is second nature. Big ideas and new innovations aren’t just part of our history, we bring them to life every day in ways that keep millions connected to their favorite apps, entertainment, news, friends and family, and well… daily life. That’s where you come in, making sure our customers can tackle everything from viral video uploads to social chats, and find out on their commute to work who’s moving to the next round in their favorite reality show. All with a seamless experience.We’re only scratching the surface when we’re talking troubleshooting uploading pet pics and swiping right. You’ll find yourself working with our technology teams and engineers to improve the experience for everyone. Think updating knowledge bases for global support teams, flagging technical issues and testing software updates, or making sure your teammates know the latest smartwatch requires a few tweaks to work best with our network.Who makes a great fit for the role? There are a few must-haves:Advanced English Fluency to engage with U.S. customers and read, write, and understand technical documentation.Curiosity about technology. If you’ve ever clicked 20 links deep in a wiki article and come out an engineering expert, let’s chat.Communication skills to effectively work with everyone from budding social stars to CEOs urgently needing their email to work.Knowledge and ability to navigate Windows, iOS, Android and cloud services (iCloud, Google Drive, OneDrive).Qualified applicants will have a mix of experience or education in Level 1 or 2 technical or help desk support, computer sciences, customer services or other relevant knowledge. Our center operates 7am to 9:15pm CST seven days a week, requiring flexibility in scheduling. In return, we offer the option to work from home the majority of your work shift (3-4 days a week) and the flexibility to help you work around life’s obligations.In order to be considered for remote work accommodations you must have a suitable space to work and a minimum 20 Mbps internet connection.There’s more than a paycheck in it for the right candidate. Our compensation package includes:Base Salary: MXN $26,466Grocery voucher MXN $2,680Restaurant voucher MXN $1,761Medical InsuranceSaving Fund50% discount on five lines of AT&T Wireless service.Vacation days, plus three personal days, life insurance, onsite medical and more.Paid starting from your first day of training, including benefits.Daycare discounts with participating child-care centers.Work from Home Support AllowanceReady to step into a future with AT&T? Apply today!Job Type: Full-timePay: From $26,466.00 per month

Here’s some advice: If you’re in the early stages of your career, don’t join a company that is hesitant to update its technology from the 90s and adapt to new trends. Five years from now, your skill set will be dead in the water and your resume will be a non-starter.In the telecommunications industry, Totogi is the main adversary to such companies. Totogi is disrupting this multibillion-dollar industry by introducing the world’s most advanced customer management system, which allows our enterprise customers to scale at an unprecedented pace. We’re looking for telecommunications technicians to help us deliver this service to our customers.Unlike in most companies, you won’t just sit around all day pulling tickets and wondering whether you’re doing them correctly. Instead, we’re actively invested in your growth and development, providing dedicated coaches who will help you build your skill set and launch your career.If you have technical telecommunications experience and want to hitch your career to a rocket, join Totogi’s technical delivery team!What you will be doingActivating New Customers’ Services: Platform configuration for standard engagements or coding for customized engagementsContinual Learning: Totogi’s constant innovation gives you the opportunity to learn new technologies and platforms on a regular basisWhat you won’t be doingFixing outages or providing technical support for existing customersInterfacing directly with customersData Engineer key responsibilitiesBasic RequirementsExperience working with mobile network architectures (3G/4G)Telecommunications domain knowledge (ideally including SS7 stack, Sigtran, Diameter, SIP, SMPP protocols)Knowledge of MySQLAbout TotogiTotogi is focused on building telco software for the public cloud and is completely redefining how carriers engage with their subscribers to drive customer love! We are a product-driven telco software company made up of some of the best minds from the telecoms industry and the brightest engineering talent across the globe. Change the game with us.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!What next?Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com.Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details.Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. Job Title: Software Development Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.2+ years of non-internship professional software development experienceExperience in object-oriented design and programming experience in at least one modern language, such as Java, Kotlin, C++ or C#Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Designing, implementing and launching high-quality software systems to solve complex problems with big impactWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software and automation workflowsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the companyPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solve some of our hardest engineering problemsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical fieldExperience designing and developing distributed systems with emphasis on scalability, performance and reliabilityExperience developing software systems that have been successfully delivered to customersExperience in communicating with users, technical teams and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs and product strategyExperience with the full software development lifecycle and knowledge of professional software engineering practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing and operationsDemonstrated ability to mentor junior software engineers in all aspects of their engineering skillset

Job Title: System Software Engineer - C / C++ / Rust / Kernel - Linux container technology
Job Description: We are hiring a systems-level C programmer to focus performance critical, and security-critical, low level system libraries critical to Linux container capabilities. We are also interested in Rust for system-level programming in Ubuntu and more widely in Canonical.The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.What you will doDesign, implement and document features in low level system container libraries (LXC and LXCFS)Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system testsCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWork from home with global travel, 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external eventsWho you areYou are curious, flexible, articulate and accountableYou value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivatedYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have experience with system programming in C on LinuxYou have knowledge or interest in Linux kernel features like namespaces, cgroups, networking or storageYou have experience with two or more of cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community.Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.#LI-Remote #Stack

Job DescriptionThis position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storagebusiness to SK hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.This is an exciting time to be at Intel - come join our Data Center NAND Division as a Firmware Validation Engineer and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world. As the global leader in the semiconductor industry, Intel possesses many industry-leading SSD technologies including the most capable Quadruple Level Cell (QLC) NAND Flash products. As a Firmware Validation Engineer, you will be part of a world-class team that will transition to lead the SSD business at SK hynix.This position aligns to that transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Transition is expected to close in late 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.Intel is currently seeking Firmware Validation professionals to join a growing team working on validating next generation Solid State Disk (SSD) solutions within our Non-volatile Memory Solutions Group.In this position you will join a fast paced team developing new validation software for Intel Solid State Drives (SSD). You will utilize and grow your experience in validating architecture, external interfaces, and product constraints, along with ability to validate architectures/features that meet these constraints while providing new value for the platform. You will design, develop, and verify validation software and tests in an embedded systems environment and review and maintain the validation ecosystem utilizing Python/Perl/C/C++. You will use and gain experience in storage interface standards such as SATA, SAS, PCIe, and NVMe. The team utilizes the Agile development methodologies, therefore, excellent communication skills and the ability to work closely with team members, both locally and across the organization, is required.As a validation engineer, regular responsibilities include but are not be limited to:Develop, review, document, and maintain source code in Python/C/C++Analyze and develop validation tests for internal and external (customer) specificationsDefine, develop and implement firmware validation test plans and test content with deep comprehension of firmware algorithms and customer specificationsIntegrate tests into an automated test environment, and collaborate with test execution teams to drive validation plans/strategyReview, track and document test results and failuresTriage failures, recommend and/or implement solutionsWork closely with internal teams such as ASIC and firmware development to drive resolution of firmware and system bugsIdentify opportunities for improvements, and drive improved validation methodologies within the teamWork with project stakeholders to turn product requirements into development and validation plansParticipate in and role model an Agile/Kanban development culture which emphasizes product quality, team accountability, and continuous improvementCoordinate priorities and activities with other engineering stakeholders to accomplish committed milestonesA successful candidate will demonstrate:The ability to listen, understand and respond professionally to partner questions and issues while building trustExcellent reporting and presentation skillsA history of self-starting and effective multitasking, with strong influencing and leadership skillsQualificationsCandidates must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Requirements listed below would be obtained through a combination of schoolwork/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.Minimum Requirements:The candidate must have a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, or a related engineering field.Documentation related to bachelor’s degree completion will be required.4+ years of experience in the following areas:Software or firmware development experience in an embedded systems validation environment with programming in Python/C/C++Experience in developing, reviewing, and implementing test plansKnowledge of software validation concepts and coverage analysis toolsDeveloping unit tests for code coverage and quality validationPreferred Requirements:Storage industry (SSDs or enterprise storage)Validation development techniques utilizing hardware and firmware toolsExposure to commercial product development/validation environmentStructured software development and practices, analytical problem solving, innovation and a mindset of continuous improvementEnterprise storage interface protocols (e.g., SATA, SAS, PCIe, and NVMe)SSD or enterprise storage device security protocols and techniques (e.g., Opal, ESSC, and AES)Software/firmware development processes including workflow and continuous integration validationDevOps process strategies, tools and execution, from code check-in through Continuous Integration and Continuous DeliveryProject planning, estimation, and risk managementCustomer requirements definition, clarification, and technical assessmentInside this Business GroupEmployees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel.

Job DescriptionPlatform Application Engineer - Memory Technologies will assists in providing technical support for one or many products and or product family.Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:Participating in new product development representing the customers technical needs creating competitive analysis from a technical perspective.Developing and presenting technical product training materials.Working with the sales team to help resolve customers technical questions.Participating in customers visits and presentations.Creating and maintaining data sheets and application notes.Acting as technical experts/consultants/analysts and program managers.Responding to customer requests or events as they occur.Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgement.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Defining driving resolution across multiple teams and representing technical issues while maintaining centralized communication across multiple geographies.Influencing and customer orientation skills.Verbal and written communication skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Electronics Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).4+ years of experience in either of the following:High Speed I/O (Input Output) Communication protocols (PCIe, DDR (Double Data Rate), etc.)Debugging (including experience working with and analyzing output from test equipment such as the Lauterbach, oscilloscopes logic analyzers and protocol analyzers).Advanced English level.Preferred Qualifications:Broad understanding of Intel processor-based platforms.History with microprocessor architecture chipset architecture system architecture board design, pre silicon, validation, post silicon, validation, and/or firmware BIOS.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Job Title: System Validation Engineer with CPU experience
Job Description: Job DescriptionBe part of the SoC Platform Validation team within Data Platforms Group.Looking for a Senior Validation Engineer.In this position, you will be working as a member of the DPEA Platform Validation Team responsible for ensuring the datacenter platforms meet our customer quality expectations. You will make recommendations to the business on release readiness.The role requires broad understanding of CPU and system level architecture. The job will demand interaction with Architecture, Design, and Silicon Validation teams to analyze requirements and improve product test content at system level. The focus of the validation in this role implies the verification and integration of server components across various customer HW/FW configurations. Additionally, validation will include simulation of customer environments with application workloads, use cases, platform level stress and system level performance.Key attributes and activities to be perform in this role:Lead debug of platform level issues involving CPU flows and drive them to resolution.Validation pathfinding activities involving CPU core interoperability.Capacity to produce domain coexistent and customer value add type of test cases.Be a voice and enforcer of the health and quality of the products.Drive key defects resolution, leading corresponding taskforces.Constantly improve testing coverage based on success criteria metrics and status.Planning, developing and executing Systems Engineering Best Practices.Participating in Product planning and release meetings providing input and decisions.Engaging with architecture and various cross-team validation organizations to define test plans.Be a role model for the organization and junior engineers.Behavioral traits:Advanced English communications skills.Proven logical solving problem skills,Strong teamwork skillsWilling to participate and create a good working environment.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum qualifications:Candidate will have a minimum of a B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar stream.3+ years of technical and debug knowledge at CPU and system level.3+ years of PC architecture and system level validation.2+ years of CPU hands on sys debug experience.2+ years of operating systems and FW understanding experience.Solid understanding of Intel architecture.Advanced English level.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

The ADAS Algorithm Development Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, maintainance and optimization of the algorithms used for the Perception segment, working with Radar technologies (and potentially others like Camera in the future) in order to process its outputs to describe the enviroment and its characteristics according to customer requirements (signal processing, object tracking and classification, etc.). She/he will actively work with internal and external engineering teams to bring high-quality products into production.A tipical day involves analyzing issues in our simulation tools, implementing fixes and optimizations in C, and developing new code for our software solution (at application level of Autosar)Main Responsibilities:Perform requirements analysis and translate them into optimal implementationsDevelop embedded sensor algorithms to meet product requirements.Analyze issues, find root causes and fix bugs in a creative way to optimize the performance of our algorithmsUtilize advanced data analysis techniques to provide insight and inspire future development to improve our productPerform quality tasks in our implementations such as code reviews, unit tests and complying with highest code standards

Company DescriptionIf you like challenges and willingness to overcome obstacles, we are looking for you!Bosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch, our operating areas are in four business sectors; mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology and energy and building technology.Discover in Bosch the ideal place for you.Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an Embedded Software Test Engineer (Entry Level) who is willing to work on a project where each team member contributes to the SW Development and Testing success of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) features. Technical curiosity paired with a passion for engineering is a must for this role, we are looking for someone who applies strategic problem solving and enables the team to understand even the most complex technical challenges down to the last bit. Eagerness to own Software testing activities, high-quality oriented processes and innovation initiatives.ObjectiveEmbedded SW Testing Activities for Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) SW Projects.ResponsibilitiesEmbedded Software Test: test execution, automation and documentation for Driver Assistance products.Requirement/implementation/feature testing.Test management, configuration management and documentation.Follow quality process for software development testing according to ISO26262 and ASPICEQualificationsBasic Experience in automation and execution of test specifications/scriptsBasic Experience in usage of Test and Measurement Equipment’sBasic CAN protocolKnowledge of Configuration management toolsBasic Scripting and automation techniques are an advantageVehicle networking is an advantageVery good problem solving skillsVery good communication skills.Proactivity and commitment.Additional InformationDo you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe.Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 17,000 associates.We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Welcome to Bosch!Vacancy applies to the referral program.

Job Title: Software Engineer - Entry User Interfaces Flight Management Systems
Job Description: Job Description SummaryIn this role you will be responsible for executing, designing and updating test procedures for Navigation and Guidance systems and/or sub-components,in a global Software Engineering organization in across- functional and multicultural environment.Job DescriptionRoles and ResponsibilitiesSupport Design and implementation of Embedded Software and Software Requirements verification in a cross-function environment.Consistently develop and document code and test procedures , interpret results and use best practices with guidance.Effectively communicate/provide presentations in project communication rhythm, such as weekly status meetings, SCRUM meetings, progress reports and retrospectives.Self-aware of assignments on time delivery.Support execution of efficiency or productivity opportunities.Consistent understanding of the overall product functionality and technical basis of operation.Understand key elements of digital electronics, systems engineering, software methodologies and avionics.Required QualificationsSkilled in more than one of the stages of the Software Development Life Cycle is needed for the position.Skilled in Programming Languages and Object Oriented Programming.Solid Knowledge of Embedded Software Development using C or Ada programming languages.Able to understand and apply engineering requirements.Understand Software Validation and Verification principles.Strong interpersonal skills.Executes tasks with supervision.Legal Right to Work in Mexico.This role requires basic experience in the Engineering/Technology & Embedded SW Development.
