Company DescriptionIf you like challenges and willingness to overcome obstacles, we are looking for you!Bosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch, our operating areas are in four business sectors; mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology and energy and building technology.Discover in Bosch the ideal place for you.Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an Embedded Software Test Engineer (Entry Level) who is willing to work on a project where each team member contributes to the SW Development and Testing success of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) features. Technical curiosity paired with a passion for engineering is a must for this role, we are looking for someone who applies strategic problem solving and enables the team to understand even the most complex technical challenges down to the last bit. Eagerness to own Software testing activities, high-quality oriented processes and innovation initiatives.ObjectiveEmbedded SW Testing Activities for Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) SW Projects.ResponsibilitiesEmbedded Software Test: test execution, automation and documentation for Driver Assistance products.Requirement/implementation/feature testing.Test management, configuration management and documentation.Follow quality process for software development testing according to ISO26262 and ASPICEQualificationsBasic Experience in automation and execution of test specifications/scriptsBasic Experience in usage of Test and Measurement Equipment’sBasic CAN protocolKnowledge of Configuration management toolsBasic Scripting and automation techniques are an advantageVehicle networking is an advantageVery good problem solving skillsVery good communication skills.Proactivity and commitment.Additional InformationDo you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe.Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 17,000 associates.We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Welcome to Bosch!Vacancy applies to the referral program.

Job DescriptionPlatform Application Engineer - Memory Technologies will assists in providing technical support for one or many products and or product family.Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:Participating in new product development representing the customers technical needs creating competitive analysis from a technical perspective.Developing and presenting technical product training materials.Working with the sales team to help resolve customers technical questions.Participating in customers visits and presentations.Creating and maintaining data sheets and application notes.Acting as technical experts/consultants/analysts and program managers.Responding to customer requests or events as they occur.Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgement.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Defining driving resolution across multiple teams and representing technical issues while maintaining centralized communication across multiple geographies.Influencing and customer orientation skills.Verbal and written communication skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Electronics Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).4+ years of experience in either of the following:High Speed I/O (Input Output) Communication protocols (PCIe, DDR (Double Data Rate), etc.)Debugging (including experience working with and analyzing output from test equipment such as the Lauterbach, oscilloscopes logic analyzers and protocol analyzers).Advanced English level.Preferred Qualifications:Broad understanding of Intel processor-based platforms.History with microprocessor architecture chipset architecture system architecture board design, pre silicon, validation, post silicon, validation, and/or firmware BIOS.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

The ADAS SW Senior Staff engineer will define the roadmap and quote feasibility and profitability for upcoming business opportunities for Lidar products and systems.ResponsibilitiesExecute quotation for upcoming business opportunities.Obtain, collect and summarize the stakeholder requests (RFQ Data) in Quote documentation and support disciplines to define quotation approach.Support the technical quotation kick-off meeting and present the result of the quote strategy.Perform Short RE engineering as an initial review for all stakeholder documents as well as collect stakeholder needs and constraints to reduce the risk of quotation.Decide System product variant as well as decide roadmap compliance and deviation for the product.Create Customer information concerning technical assumptions.Create Engineering cost estimation concept.Create Bill of Material.Provide realistic timing schedule sample planIdentify technologies with IPD (Intellectual Property Department)Handover of strategy to development team.Support architecture, integration or development activities for running projects when quotations deliverables are completed.

The ADAS Algorithm Development Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, maintainance and optimization of the algorithms used for the Perception segment, working with Radar technologies (and potentially others like Camera in the future) in order to process its outputs to describe the enviroment and its characteristics according to customer requirements (signal processing, object tracking and classification, etc.). She/he will actively work with internal and external engineering teams to bring high-quality products into production.A tipical day involves analyzing issues in our simulation tools, implementing fixes and optimizations in C, and developing new code for our software solution (at application level of Autosar)Main Responsibilities:Perform requirements analysis and translate them into optimal implementationsDevelop embedded sensor algorithms to meet product requirements.Analyze issues, find root causes and fix bugs in a creative way to optimize the performance of our algorithmsUtilize advanced data analysis techniques to provide insight and inspire future development to improve our productPerform quality tasks in our implementations such as code reviews, unit tests and complying with highest code standards

Job Title: System Validation Engineer with CPU experience
Job Description: Job DescriptionBe part of the SoC Platform Validation team within Data Platforms Group.Looking for a Senior Validation Engineer.In this position, you will be working as a member of the DPEA Platform Validation Team responsible for ensuring the datacenter platforms meet our customer quality expectations. You will make recommendations to the business on release readiness.The role requires broad understanding of CPU and system level architecture. The job will demand interaction with Architecture, Design, and Silicon Validation teams to analyze requirements and improve product test content at system level. The focus of the validation in this role implies the verification and integration of server components across various customer HW/FW configurations. Additionally, validation will include simulation of customer environments with application workloads, use cases, platform level stress and system level performance.Key attributes and activities to be perform in this role:Lead debug of platform level issues involving CPU flows and drive them to resolution.Validation pathfinding activities involving CPU core interoperability.Capacity to produce domain coexistent and customer value add type of test cases.Be a voice and enforcer of the health and quality of the products.Drive key defects resolution, leading corresponding taskforces.Constantly improve testing coverage based on success criteria metrics and status.Planning, developing and executing Systems Engineering Best Practices.Participating in Product planning and release meetings providing input and decisions.Engaging with architecture and various cross-team validation organizations to define test plans.Be a role model for the organization and junior engineers.Behavioral traits:Advanced English communications skills.Proven logical solving problem skills,Strong teamwork skillsWilling to participate and create a good working environment.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum qualifications:Candidate will have a minimum of a B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar stream.3+ years of technical and debug knowledge at CPU and system level.3+ years of PC architecture and system level validation.2+ years of CPU hands on sys debug experience.2+ years of operating systems and FW understanding experience.Solid understanding of Intel architecture.Advanced English level.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Job Title: Embedded and Linux Software Systems Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionAre you passionate about software development? Would you like to have an opportunity to develop your software design skills with hands on projects, product evaluation, code reviews and training courses?In this position, you will be joining the Customer Experience Group as a software applications Engineer specializing in systems featuring the entire software stack from processor boot loader to device drivers to host application software.You will be part of passionate and highly talented team of applications engineers working on cutting edge next generation technologies.A successful candidate is a talented aspiring software designer who is ready to take the challenge of working hands-on with systems that feature FPGAs, memory, host PCIe (Peripheral Component Interconnect Express), networking (for example: Ethernet MAC (Media Access Controller), etc.), and custom IP.Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:Providing feedback on Intel Programmable Solutions Group's (PSG) software stack offerings with Intel Open FPGA Stack and insights on how to make it easy to understand and to use.Developing technical assets such as user guides, application notes, design examples, demos, and training that will enable users to successfully design with our software.Responding to customer technical questions, debug, reproduce customer issues, and drive issue resolution.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Willingness to create customer ready material (including strong technical writing and communication skills).Driving an issue to resolution by working with a cross-functional group of stakeholders.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, and/or internship experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related STEM fields (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Advanced English level.1+ year of experience with software development using C/C++ for systems featuring software and hardware (e.g. IP cores), tools and debugPreferred Qualifications:Experience with bootloader software for embedded processors (e.g. U-boot, UEFI) and BIOS.Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals (I2C, UART, SPI, CAN etc.)Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals high performance peripherals such as PCIe with Virtualization, DMAExperience with system level debug for issues featuring both processors and FPGA.Experience with host software stacks for infrastructure processing e.g. OvS, DPDK (Data Plane Development Kit), SPDK (Storage Performance Development Kit), Linux based virtualization, and orchestration.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need.

Job DescriptionLeads the creation, implementation, and optimization of software tools in support of various domains including design, manufacturing, validation, silicon production, systems integration, software application products, or ecosystem enabling. Utilizes modern software development methodologies, programming languages, domain knowledge, and secure coding practices to design, develop, debug, and/or validate algorithms, software tools, and systems that enable our internal/external engineering partners to design/manufacture intel silicon, integrate Intel silicon and/or software into impactful products. Examples of tools/systems include debuggers, analyzers, SDKs, IDEs, PDKs, performance monitors, software tools and libraries, flows, and/or methodologies for design, manufacturing, validation, and test.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's OR Master's, in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering, with 3+ years of active experience in large-scale software development. ("Cedula Profesional" may be required).The 3+ years of experience can be a mix of the following:3+ years of actively developing in C, C++ , Python or similar languages.2+ years of Computer Architecture knowledge of computer systems including multicore CPUs or GPUs, memory subsystem, interconnects, IO devices.2+ years of experience with modern computer operating systems (Linux, Chrome or Windows).3+ years of working in software development teams using team collaboration tools for repository storage, testing, issues and project tracking.Preferred QualificationsPh. D. in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering or relevant engineering field.Inside this Business GroupEnable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software.Other LocationsMexico, Mexico CityWork Model for this RoleThis role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need.

Job Title: Senior Software Dev Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Senior Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Defining the technology strategy and architecture for a greenfield initiativeWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software, cloud services platforms and automation workflowsDesigning and developing simple software solutions to complex problemsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the company to define our engineering strategy and push projects forwardCoaching and mentoring other engineers to develop their software engineering skillsetPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solving some of our hardest engineering problemsDevelopment experience with AWS services such as AWS CloudFormation, EC2, API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDBDesign and development experience with horizontally scaling systemsExcellent track record of shipping software as a software engineer or technical leadA proven ability to learn new domains and demonstrate leadershipExcellent written and verbal communication skills addressing technical and non-technical audiencesMeets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this roleMeets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Job Title: High Level Design Platforms Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionHave you worked on High Level Design Platform (BSP) applications, designed, or implemented High Level Design (HLD) acceleration systems? Are you an experienced applications engineer who has an interest in both working with customers and ensuring they have a great experience with the technology?As a business unit within Intel, we will continue to apply Moore's Law to drive the future of field-programmable gate array (FPGA) technology. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To take advantage of the many opportunities in the future for FPGA's, PSG is looking for an outstanding High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer to join our Customer Experience Group (CEG) team specializing in HLD development using DPC++, oneAPI, FPGA Design, Flows, and Debug.As an Applications Engineer in CEG, you will be responsible to support Intel FPGA solutions proactively to enable customers to quickly get their solutions to market. Additionally, you will interface directly with cross functional teams to quickly resolve complex technical issues to allow customers to meet the market demands.Your specific role includes, but is not limited to:Providing guidance from a customer and systems perspective to cross functional teams to create optimal solutions.Creating demos to showcase the capabilities of Intel PSG solutions.Handling customer escalations to provide solutions to meet customer requirements and working directly with development teams to build improved solutions in the future.Providing product readiness feedback as an early user to cross functional teams and managing efforts to improve the product.Developing reference designs or subcomponents to align with key market strategies, which allows customers to evaluate the technology while offering a starting point for their project.Driving the strategy of new technology training for both internal and external audiences.Authoring documentation and other applicable materials to explain products and solutions.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Attention to detail.Analytical and problem-solving skills.Be self-motivated.Work effectively in a team environment.Communication and interpersonal skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Intermediate to advanced English.3+ months of experience in either of the following:Area within FPGA/ASIC (Application-Specific Integrated Circuit) design using HDL (Hardware Description Language).Area within Intel FPGA Design Entry Tools or related.Preferred QualificationsExperience in an area related to FPGA RTL (Register-Transfer Level) Design.Experience working on customer engagements, applications development.Experience with oneAPI, OpenCL, HLS (High Level Synthesis), Quartus, and other FPGA centric design flows and tools.Experience in complex FPGA systems using IP such as PCIe (Peripheral Component Interconnect Express), DDR (Double Data Rate), and Ethernet.Experience in HDL, verification, and general computational logic design/verification concepts.Experience with any of the following: Verilog/VHDL, Tcl (Tool command language), C/C++, Python.Experience with Modelsim, Git, and development tool.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

The Facilitator Release Train Engineer as a part of the agile release train management team drives and foster the Agile methodology and team interaction for a product specific purpose.She/He is ensuring qualitative development by facilitating agreed upon methods conformance and facilitate a continuous improvement of the whole trainResponsibilitiesCoaching and alignment of the Product Manager, Customers and Business Owners to understand agility as well as the development of an agile mindset.Coaches the Product Managers and the associated teams to have a common basic understanding of process, principle and used methods (e.g. integration testing or requirements).Assists stakeholders with economic decision-making by guiding features and capabilities estimation.Brings the Agile Release Train into a self-sustaining state (self-organizing, self-managing teams, and collaborating teams).Facilitates agile ceremonies, e.g., the Product Increment planning event, Inspect and Adapt Workshop, and System Demo.Facilitates Product Increment Planning readiness.Supports proper team setup/organization and knowledge, skill and competency distribution.Develops Agile Teams, which may be distributed over multiple locations and roles like collaboration with architecture team.Identify, own and remove impediments of the agile release train to optimize the flow of value through the teams. Escalate and track impediments to Solution Train Engineers or line management in case an own clarification was not successful.Drives the Agile Release Train efforts in relentless improvement (e.g. via Inspect and Adapt workshops) and challenges the team actively to improve their efficiency, i.e. by increasing automation rate.Assists tracking the execution of features and capabilities by monitoring the overall performance of the ART in order to ensure a continuously improving development flow in assistance to the Product Management.Foster relentless improvement.Acts as interface and guide to the non-agile world to protect the Agile Teams and the Agile Release Train.Summarizes and publish Program Increment objectives for visibility and transparency.Ensure alignment between disciplines.Supports proper Release Train setup/organization.

The ADAS Embedded Software team requires an experienced SW engineer with vast experience analyzing requirements, developing and debugging code by many means, understanding hardware architecture, hardware communication protocols, complex software development topics. Our software engineers actively work in teams to create and update software components of Driving Assistance products that are being developed or already are in production or commercial use.Our engineers are part of a multidisciplinary and global community responsible for the design, integration and maintenance of Continental products using the AutoSAR framework with presence in several software components such as diagnostics, error handling, communications, cybersecurity, memory management, power management in electromagnetic radars and/or vehicle control systems.Additional responsibilitiesDevelop embedded sensor software to meet product requirementsPlanning and organizing test commitments and activities for specific projectsMaintain correspondence with multiple engineering teams, both national and foreign.Develop sustainable software and support other teams in charge of its verificationMaintain a thorough understand of customer and product requirementsBe part of the technical development of other engineers by training them or helping them to understand the technical needs of our productsBreakdown technical topics and requirements to provide guidance to younger engineers on how to perform their work effectivelyFollow the Continental development life cycle process, including development and QA activities

Job DescriptionThe Software Engineer (Intel Contract Employee) leads the creation, implementation, and optimization of software tools in support of various domains including design, validation, silicon production, systems integration, software application products, or ecosystem enabling.The Software Engineer also utilizes modern software development methodologies, programming languages, domain knowledge, and secure coding practices to design, develop, debug, and/or validate algorithms, software tools, and systems that are used by our internal/external engineering partners, integrate Intel silicon and/or software into impactful products. Examples of tools/systems include debuggers, analyzers, software tools and libraries, flows, and/or methodologies for design, for front-end and back-end software solutions.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Self-learningTeamworkAttention to detailCommunication and presentation skillsQualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below could be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork, classes, research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.Minimum Qualifications:Intermediate to advanced English level.3+ years of experience with programming/scripting languages (example: Python, POO, C++, PHP, SQL/MySQL, MVC, Azure, etc.).3+ years of experience with operating systems like Linux or UNIX.Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related STEM field.Understanding of lab instrumentation necessary to carry out Analog Validation as well as its automation using software.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Continental Engineering Services (CES) is seeking for an AUTOSAR Software Engineer. As an AUTOSAR software developer for automotive applications you will be integral part of a global and diverse team for the next generation of vehicles. Our engineer will be responsible for software decisions, analyze requirements, configure BSW (Basic Software), integrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules, assist customer in resolving configuration errors, design software architecture, maintenance of different AUTOSAR components and many other specific applications for projects within the Chassis & Safety division such as:Advanced Electronic Brake Systems: our engineers work with Continental’s advances brake unit to maintain, and develop solutions that are benchmark in the industry such as Antilock braking, traction and stability control, regenerative braking to enhance electric and hybrid vehicles cruising range, supporting ADAS functions to brake autonomously the vehicle in emergency situations, etc.Automated Driver Assistance Systems: with the help of our advanced environment sensors, lidars, cameras and radars our software engineer contribute to provide solutions for driver assistance and automated driving functions such as blind spot detection, driver monitoring, emergency break assist, intelligent headlight assist, surround views, etc.Active Damping Control Systems: CES engineers requires to work with state-of-the-art technologies with AUTOSAR architecture to solve the conflicts that exist between optimal riding comfort and agile handling by creating software to adjust damping force on every wheel depending load and driving conditions.Airbag Controllers and other safety solutions: our engineer also focus in occupant protections such airbag controller, adapting platform to customer needs and government regulations, the design of software with impressive quality is required in these products to make sure our software saves lives when accident occur.Our AUTOSAR Software engineers share common goals to drive and contribute to the automotive industry with the goal to protect all people inside and outside the vehicle, to innovate in mobility solutions, and ultimately, achieve Continental’s Vision Zero: zero fatalities, zero injuries, zero accidents.Core Responsibilities:AUTOSAR Software development tasksGather and analyze OEMs Software RequirementsPerform software testing to detect functional, logic or implementation errorsConfigure BSW (Basic Software) according with OEMs requirementsIntegrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules with different AutoCore tools (e.g. EB Tressos, Davinci, etc.)Analyze customer bug reports and provide solutionsWork with diverse teamsEstimate work package efforts. Evaluate the impact of engineering modifications in the software.Coach/support team membersAdditional Responsibilities:Flexibility to work in variety of different automotive projectsSoftware Project Technical Lead tasksSupport technical discussions with customerSupport/Test the developed modules in the vehicleSupport requirements engineering and elicitation processesPerform unit testing and software debuggingAssistance with other tasks as needed and determined by ManagementDocumentation of detail software development plan, test plans, test design, analysis, computer modeling, prototype/production test scripts and specification releasesDefine strategies to continuously improve processes and tools.

Job Title: High Level Design Software Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionHave you worked on High Level Design (HLD) C++ applications or implemented HLD acceleration systems? Do you love collaborating with internal teams and helping customers with their end products? Is it exciting to work in a diverse team that spans multiple domains and vertical markets? Do you want to make valuable contributions to the team that helps identify market trends, then help influence next generation products and solutions?As a business unit within Intel, we will continue to apply Moore's Law to drive the future of field-programmable gate array (FPGA) technology. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To take advantage of the many opportunities in the future for FPGA's, PSG is looking for an outstanding High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer to join our Customer Experience Group (CEG) team specializing in HLD development using DPC++, oneAPI, FPGA Design, Flows, and Debug.As a High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer in CEG, you will be responsible to support Intel FPGA solutions proactively to enable customers to quickly get their solutions to market. Additionally, you will interface directly with cross functional teams to contribute to the next generation product definition, identify market trends and direction, and quickly resolve complex technical issues to allow customers to meet the market demands.Your specific role includes, but is not limited to:Providing guidance from a customer and systems perspective to cross functional teams to create optimal solutions.Creating demos to showcase the capabilities of Intel PSG solutions.Handling customer escalations to provide solutions to meet customer requirements and working directly with development teams to build improved solutions in the future.Providing product readiness feedback as an early user to cross functional teams and managing efforts to improve the product.Developing reference designs or subcomponents to align with key market strategies, which allows customers to evaluate the technology while offering a starting point for their project.Driving the strategy of new technology training for both internal and external audiences.Authoring documentation and other applicable materials to explain products and solutions.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Attention to detail.Analytical and problem-solving skills.Be self-motivated.Work effectively in a team environment.Communication and interpersonal skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Intermediate to advanced English.3+ months of experience in either of the following:Area within C++, computational, algorithmic, and/or area related to CPU/GPU/FPGA/etc.High Level Design Tools, Vitis, HLS (High Level Synthesis), oneAPI, Mathworks, DSPBuilder, Quartus, Vivado, or related.Preferred QualificationsExperience in an area related to C++.Experience working on customer engagements, applications development.Experience with code optimization using parallelism, pipelining, memory management, concurrency, and multi-threading.Experience with Embedded Systems.Experience with oneAPI, OpenCL, HLS, Quartus, and other FPGA centric design flows and tools.Experience in HDL (Hardware Description Language), verification, and general computational logic design/verification concepts.Experience with Git and development tools.Experience in with computational algorithms theory.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera.
