#Engineering #Testing # Software #Electronics #Computing #MechatronicThe ADAS (Advanced Driving Assistance Systems) Algorithm Test Engineer will be responsible for performing requirements analysis, creating test cases and automate the tests cases as much as possible, in order to efficiently validate the Algorithms developed for ADAS systems and provide useful statistics and information for the development of these algorithms.In ADAS Business Unit, we are developing cutting edge technologies to drive the future of mobility in the world, you will be part of a team that validates these new technologies. With your collaboration you will help Continental to save millions of lives around the world.Main responsibilities:Analyze requirements and design test cases which thoroughly validate these requirements.Responsible to write test scripts (in python) to automate tests and processes as much as possible.Adapt existing test scripts to changes in requirements.Execute manual and automated tests.Provide statistical information and functional status to developers, to improve the algorithms.Report and follow up to defects found in the Algorithms.Support software developer in root cause analysis when needed.

Job DescriptionIntel DEG ( Design Engineering Group) / iVE (Intel Validation Engineering Group) is looking for an experienced Software Developer to join our engineering team and help us develop tools used in a new project utilizing AI/ML (Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning) to improve hardware validation.Software Developer responsibilities include writing and testing code, debugging programs and integrating low-level applications. To be successful in this role, you should have experience writing complex pieces of code, in a CI/CD environment with multiple developers, understanding code written by other people and work well in a team.Responsibilities:Write effective and scalable code with unit tests for the CI/CD environmentImplement back-end software components that combine functionality, performance and re-usabilityRedesign and rewrite existing back-end software components to adapt to newer flowsActively participate in all stages of Software Development LifeCycleDevelop scripts to automate repetitive tasksBehavioral Traits:Work experience being a member in multicultural and multidisciplinary teamsTeam spiritExcellent problem-solving skillsQualificationsRequirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry-relevant job experience, internship experiences and or school work/classes/research.You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Education:Bachelors+ of Science degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field ("Cedula Profesional" may be required)Minimum Qualifications:3+ years of experience in Python development. Specifically, single and multi-threaded programming and packages for file management3+ months of experience with Git version controlExposure to C/C++ and object-oriented OOP programmingWork experience following a Software Development LifeCycleAdvanced English Level (spoken and written)Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of NoSQL databasesKnowledge of HTML REST APIInside this Business GroupThe everyday contributions of the Intel Validation Engineering (iVE) team are essential to retaining/regaining Intel's product leadership. We validate, debug, and tune the newest designs and world-changing technologies that enrich the lives of every person on earth. We play a critical role in completing the PRQs of Intel products and in Intel's ability to deliver the annual technology platforms in our roadmap.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Job DescriptionDo you want to change the way people interact in the world? Care about disruptive and innovative technology? Then come and join us to the Intel Optane Group (IOG).IOG delivers Intel's Optane based memory solutions for the exciting Server business, where you will have the opportunity to work with leading technologies in this fast-growing domain.Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Developing pre-Si validation test plans and test scenarios to prove the correctness of the design.Development of components for a simulation-based environment: bus functional models, trackers, checkers, scoreboards, and testbenches.Performing and debugging digital simulations, and driving to closure of bugs.Development of functional coverage and achieving coverage goals.Working closely with design engineers, micro-architects, and other team members to ensure high quality of test plans, functional coverage, and tests.Deliver high-quality output against deadlines and work effectively in a cross-site team environment.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Problem-solving skillsInitiativeInterpersonal skillsWritten and verbal communication skillsQualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, and/or internship experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).1+ years of experience with digital design, ASIC design flow, or computer architecture.1+ years of experience with programming/scripting languages like C/C++, Perl, Ruby, Python, or Unix (Linux).1+ years of experience with hardware description languages (such as VHDL, Verilog, System Verilog, etc.).1+ years of experience with pre-Si validation (including: logic simulators (Modelsim, Questasim, VCS, AMS), functional coverage concepts and implementation, testbench development, bus functional models, trackers, checkers, test development, execution, debug, etc.).Preferred Qualifications:Experience with DRAM memory.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Center & Artificial Intelligence Group (DCAI) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Intro:Continental is the trusted name for OEM connectivity in commercial vehicles. The world’s toughest machines need field-proven hardware that is up to the challenge. Vibration, shock, dirt and grime don’t stop our cellular devices from keeping customers – and their assets – connected and up-to-date. The heavy-duty vehicles of tomorrow can get the job done today with our cost-effective off-the-shelf and custom networking devices. Go beyond the road and beyond Automotive quality anywhere in the world with the security and affordability of Continental’s Telematics devices for heavy-duty trucks and buses.Job Description :Help expand Continental's array of telematics products by verifying that all new firmware and software are of the highest quality. Using your QA experience and engineering skillset, you will create and execute the test cases required to ensure that new products and features meet customer expectations.Research and create firmware test cases for new products and firmware updates.Execute test cases and cycles with excellent attention to detail detecting all unexpected device behavior during software validation process.Create bug tickets with required documentation, following the agile process when unexpected behavior is seen.Work with hardware engineers and firmware developers to clarify relevant product requirements.Support automating the firmware validation process.

Job DescriptionThis position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.This position aligns to that transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Transition is expected to close in late 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.The System Validation Engineer will be responsible for, but not limited to:Integrating and debugging software across the stack for a specific product, platform, feature, or technology throughout the product lifecycle, including pre-silicon development, power on, and/or post-silicon development.Debugging software across multiple layers of the software stack including firmware, drivers, and operating systems.Developing a software debug plan and associated methodologies.Analyzing issues, managing sightings from various validation streams, determining root cause, and driving or developing improvements. Driving project stress and stability and supports power, performance, and key task forces.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or STEM related field. Documentation related to bachelor's degree completion will be required4+ years of experience in either one of the following areas:Debugging hardware or software issues on Storage, Server, Platform or similar environments.Development and/or debug in Linux or Windows environments.Validation disciplines experience, system/platform level debug, or root cause isolation methodologies.Preferred Qualifications:2+ years of experience in either of the following areas:Low level code development/Debug for OS Drivers, FW, or Kernel.PCIe or NVMe protocol and debug (including debug tools and protocol analyzers).NAND memory validation.Experience with industry specifications such as PCIe NVME, OPAL, eSSC.PC Platform, BIOS, Drivers, or IO technologies.Continuous integration and agile methodologies.Inside this Business GroupEmployees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel.

Job DescriptionThe Memory and I/O Technologies Team (MIO) is excited to announce an opportunity to join our growing team within Intel's Datacenter and AI Group.MIO works to define and validate DRAM memory and I/O technologies for Intel, and we have exciting opportunities to help improve the next generations of DRAM main memory.The qualified candidate would collaborate with engineering teams in Intel and in the DRAM industry to validate DRAM memory in Intel's server platforms. Our team members are passionate about growth, innovation, and collaboration and we are looking for individuals who want to learn and grow so we can best support our customers with the highest quality possible. If you are looking for a growth environment, you could be a great fit for our team. On any given day in our development labs, you would test DRAM memory on Intel's platforms using the latest in memory test equipment, collect data across platforms and memory technologies, assess results and collaborate with engineering teams to drive improvements. It will be necessary to continuously keep up to date on emerging DRAM test improvements and apply new learnings to improve internal test processes.As a memory validation engineer in MIO your responsibilities would include but not limited to:Create memory validation test plans. Use platform-level hardware and software tools to ensure performance to memory specifications.Responsible for execution of DDR memory stress tests in system and debug of failures.Interface with Architecture, Design, and Validation teams to review and address debug results.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry-relevant job experience, internship experiences and or school work/classes/research.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field (Documentation related to bachelor's degree completion will be required).2 years of experience in one or more of the following areas:Python ORPerforming debug or testing of computer systems ORLogic analyzer, oscilloscope, bit error rate tester, memory testers, or other electronics test equipment.Preferred Qualifications:Experience in some of the following areas: C/C++ coding, database, platform validation, or DDR or LPDDR memory testingInside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Be part of the Vehicle Dynamics (VED) Software group at Continental and participate to the creation of our MK1xx and MKCx products: the Brake systems used in conventional, electric and autonomous cars of today and tomorrow.Our ECU is the main Chassis controller and provides functions to control the vehicle dynamics as the car trajectory (ABS, ACC, AYC, HSA, IPB, TCS...) for global car manufacturers in America (USA, Mexico, Brazil).In VED, you will have the opportunity to practice the benchmark tools of our Automotive development and the state-of-the-art methods for Software development environment using IBM Jazz, GIT tools...You will be joining an international team and be guided by experienced engineers into the different phases of SW Integration.You will be collaborating with the worldwide network of VED colleagues.Your main tasks (following ASPICE SWE.5):Be the first contact for SW integration topics: provide information and coordinate activities among the SW project team for internal stakeholders.Plan and perform the SW integration and integration test strategy according to SW milestones.Monitor SW health with the help of the SW Factory.Ensure the changes planned are included, properly validated and meet the quality standards.Evaluate the impact of engineering modifications in the software.Perform basic software testing to detect functional, logic or implementation errors.Create the SW work products by following the defined process (SW executable, calibrations, EEprom and documentation).Detect and communicate any risk that might impact the SW logic or project schedule.Develop and improve on existing SW engineering methods, tools and procedures.

Division Chassis & Safety, Advanced Engineering.The Software Tester Engineer will be responsible for the development, analysis and integration of Software embeded solutions related to Passive Safety Systems, enhanced by vehicle surrounding sensors and their coordination interaction. The scope of work will span much of Continental's safety systems portfolio, up to and including Automated Driving Systems.Core responsibilities:Working on defining/analyzing customer and user requirements for testing, designing innovative solutions, and seeing the product through to customer release.You will be developing software test cases and using established design guidelines and testing guidelines.You will be expected to use a variety of tools that support requirements capture, design documentation, management of code, builds and tests.Will also be expected to align according with estimates for simple tasks based on team experience and manage their own time in accordance with defined project tasks.Developing both unit test strategies and tests for individual components, and developing integration test strategies and tests for collections of components delivering high-level functionality.Critical thinking in managing tasks, architecture, design, and coding will be the measure of a successful candidate.Software Test Project Managing, i.e. being the main interface to the overall Software Test Manager, being responsible for the successful conduct of the SW task assigned in terms of time, efforts and quality might be needed.Maintaining Continuous Integration global environment supporting NA region.

Software Engineer II/JAVAThe companyToshiba is a provider of technology services for retail businesses to create high-quality digital platforms and products that accelerate time to market. Our diverse and adaptable teams provide the right mix of solutions and methodologies to deliver results as we collaborate with our clients' teams to foster innovation through continuous learning.Our peopleAt Toshiba, all team members are empowered to take responsibility and develop innovative solutions to our customers' most challenging problems. To retain and develop top talent, we foster a work environment that celebrates creativity, encourages skill development, and enables multidisciplinary collaboration.What you will bring to the teamToshiba Global Commerce Solutions is seeking a Software Engineer III to join our team in Guadalajara, Mexico. The Software Engineer designs, builds, and supports custom software solutions for some of the world’s largest retailers.What you will be doing:Your typical day as a Toshiba Software Engineer II/JAVA will involve:What you will be doing:Developing new custom function and assisting with defect supportAuthoring functional specifications and/or high-level designs for clientsExtending the automation / continuous integration platform, including testsWorking closely with the QA team to ensure a quality deliverableCreating product documentation for end-usersProviding configuration, installation, and ongoing maintenance supportProviding technical guidance during requirements workshops with our clientsNaturally To be successful in this role, you must have and know ofBachelor’s degreeExceptional English written and verbal communication.5+ years of software development experience4+ years of Java-based developmentExperience with XMLComputer science fundamentals including object-oriented concepts, data structures and related algorithmsFamiliarity with the software engineering lifecycle and methodologiesWindows- and Linux-based operating systems.We offer:Career plan and real growth opportunitiesConstant training, tutoring, online corporate courses, eLearning and morePleasant work environment (game room, nap area, amenities and more).Flexible work hours and dress codeHired directly by Toshiba and 100% under payrollBenefits of the law (IMSS, INFONAVIT, December day voucher, vacation voucher)Major and Minor medical expenses insurance: Life, major medical expenses with dental and visual coverage. (For the employee and direct family members)Savings fund for employees, capped at the limit of the lawGrocery coupons12 days of vacation plus 6 floating daysRelocation bonusWe offer competitive compensation and benefits focused on employees, their economic development and well-being as well as their professional development, taking care of the balance between their personal and work life, join us! and be part of our Toshiber teamEEO:Toshiba Global Commerce Solutions is an equal employment employer and is committed to providing employment opportunities.

Salary Estimate: Sueldo provisto por el empleador:600 k$ - 900 k$
Job Description: Your JobContratando este rol a distancia en cualquier ciudad del país de México.Si eres un ingeniero al que le apasiona crear productos innovadores que obtengan decenas de millones de vistas de páginas al día, Indeed te está buscando.Indeed ofrece a los desarrolladores inteligentes como tú, un complejo ecosistema de desarrollo con ciclos de lanzamiento cortos.Busca cada semana el lanzamiento de varios productos que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de crecimiento de millones de empresas y candidatos en el mundo.Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Mexico.The Jobseeker Profile Platform team is the source of truth for all data on every job seeker on Indeed. Our mission is to help job seekers to effectively represent themselves to employers. Our vision is to provide centralized storage and distributed processing capacity with a pluggable framework for all Indeed client teams that use job seeker data.As part of our team, you will play a key role in designing/document and leading the development of features that are robustly monitored and alarmed in production for the next generation of services that will be used by millions of job seekers every day.We are building a distributed data storage solution for job seeker data. This system will be high throughput, low latency, and must be incredibly reliable as it is a key piece of the Indeed ecosystem. It will provide internal client teams self-service abilities such as read, process, and update for individual job seekers data or groups of job seeker data.Who You AreResponsabilidades:Como ingeniero de software del equipo de crecimiento de SMB, estarás a cargo de desarrollar software que sirva de guía a las empresas para publicar ofertas de empleo de alta calidad que puedan conseguir un buen desempeño en los resultados de las búsquedas de Indeed.Desarrollarás IU y API que guíen a las empresas y les señalen los problemas de sus ofertas de empleo que podrían estar evitando que sean cubiertas.Formarás parte de un equipo de colaboración de ingenieros, diseñadores de experiencias de usuarios y gerentes de producto sumamente talentosos. Con frecuencia indagamos en la información disponible en Indeed para analizar, fundamentar y desarrollar soluciones para los problemas adecuados.Si te gusta revisar la información, analizarla y estudiarla de distintas formas para poder aportar conocimiento interesante, este es tu lugar ideal.Requisitos:Maestría en Ciencias de la informática, Ingeniería computacional, Ingeniería eléctrica, Matemáticas o alguna otra carrera afín del área técnica computacional, con más de 5 años de experiencia en programación con al menos un año en alguno de los siguientes lenguajes: Java, JavaScript o Python.Se requiere dominio de la comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés.Más de 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo de aplicaciones de pila completa con React y Redux.Experiencia en GraphQL deseable.Más de 3 años de experiencia como líder de ingenieros júnior.experiencia significativa en sistemas de alto rendimiento a gran escala.This team is seeking an experienced Java engineer that is familiar with the standard Java technologies and has experience working at scale. We are a deliberate team that drives development based on careful planning and a data-driven approach to new feature request.We are looking for someone who:Feels a sense of ownership in whatever they work on.Has Identified, implemented and delivered service for a specific product opportunity.Embraces continual improvement, and love to learn and develop new skillsThinks about why something needs to be built, not just what needs to be builtHas strong opinions on technical direction without a strong egoRequirements:3+ years of software development experience with programming languages and technologies such as Java.Proficient verbal and written communication in English required2+ years of experience with either NoSQL or SQL technologies.Deep understanding of the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including coding standards, code review, source control, build, test, deploy, and operations.Professional experience working with high-performance systems, large scale systems.Experience with web technologies and full stack development.Experience building solutions for high traffic web sites is a plus.Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field (Master’s is a plus).Ability to work efficiently on a remote/distributed team.Nice to have:Lead and mentored other engineers on the team.Experience with large scale distributed systems.Experience with multiple OO languages.Experience with Mongo, Kafka, AWSExperience with test-driven development.Experience with agile methodology.Who we areSomos una organización de ingeniería de rápido crecimiento y gran capacidad que está construyendo la página web de búsqueda de empleo más conocida del mundo. Con centros de ingeniería en Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokio, Singapur, Hyderabad, Dublín, Aberdeen y Vancouver, estamos mejorando la vida de las personas en todo el mundo con cada búsqueda de empleo.We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help all people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)Como la página de búsqueda de empleo número 1 del mundo*, nuestra misión es “We help all people get jobs”. Nos esforzamos por conseguir un lugar de trabajo inclusivo y accesible en el que todo el mundo se sienta cómodo, y queremos ampliar nuestro equipo con personas que compartan nuestro entusiasmo por la innovación y por ofrecer la mejor experiencia posible a los/as candidatos/as.(*comScore total de visitas, septiembre de 2021)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.El rango salarial base representa el límite inferior y superior del rango salarial de Indeed para este puesto. Los salarios reales variarán dependiendo de factores como, por ejemplo, la ubicación, la experiencia y el desempeño. El rango indicado es solo un componente del paquete de compensación total de Indeed para los empleados. Otras recompensas pueden incluir bonificaciones trimestrales, unidades de acciones restringidas (RSU), una política abierta de días libres remunerados y muchos beneficios específicos de cada región.Salary Range TransparencyMexico City 600,000 - 900,000 MXN per yearEqual Opportunities and Accommodations StatementIndeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Help at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at TAhelp@indeed.com at least one week in advance of your interview.Indeed está seriamente comprometido con la construcción de un lugar de trabajo y una comunidad global donde la inclusión no solo se valora, sino que se prioriza. Estamos orgullosos de ser una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y que busca crear un entorno acogedor y diverso. Todos los candidatos calificados serán considerados para el empleo sin tener en cuenta raza, color, religión, género, identidad o expresión de género, estado familiar, estado civil, orientación sexual, origen nacional, genética, neurodiversidad, discapacidad, edad o condición de veterano ni ningún otro motivo que no se base en el mérito o esté legalmente protegido.Indeed se compromete a proporcionar adaptaciones razonables a las personas calificadas con discapacidades en el proceso de postulación. Para solicitar una adaptación, ponte en contacto con Talent Attraction Help (ayuda de atracción de talento) al teléfono 1-855-567-7767 o poremail a TAhelp@indeed.com al menos una semana antes de tu entrevista.Our Policies and BenefitsView Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobsLearn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/Ver las políticas de privacidad y accesibilidad de los candidatos de Indeed - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobsConoce nuestros beneficios, programas y beneficios internacionales para empleados - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/Reference ID: 35947

Job Title: Software Development Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.2+ years of non-internship professional software development experienceExperience in object-oriented design and programming experience in at least one modern language, such as Java, Kotlin, C++ or C#Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Designing, implementing and launching high-quality software systems to solve complex problems with big impactWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software and automation workflowsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the companyPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solve some of our hardest engineering problemsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical fieldExperience designing and developing distributed systems with emphasis on scalability, performance and reliabilityExperience developing software systems that have been successfully delivered to customersExperience in communicating with users, technical teams and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs and product strategyExperience with the full software development lifecycle and knowledge of professional software engineering practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing and operationsDemonstrated ability to mentor junior software engineers in all aspects of their engineering skillset

Job DescriptionThis position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storagebusiness to SK hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.This is an exciting time to be at Intel - come join our Data Center NAND Division as a Firmware Validation Engineer and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world. As the global leader in the semiconductor industry, Intel possesses many industry-leading SSD technologies including the most capable Quadruple Level Cell (QLC) NAND Flash products. As a Firmware Validation Engineer, you will be part of a world-class team that will transition to lead the SSD business at SK hynix.This position aligns to that transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Transition is expected to close in late 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.Intel is currently seeking Firmware Validation professionals to join a growing team working on validating next generation Solid State Disk (SSD) solutions within our Non-volatile Memory Solutions Group.In this position you will join a fast paced team developing new validation software for Intel Solid State Drives (SSD). You will utilize and grow your experience in validating architecture, external interfaces, and product constraints, along with ability to validate architectures/features that meet these constraints while providing new value for the platform. You will design, develop, and verify validation software and tests in an embedded systems environment and review and maintain the validation ecosystem utilizing Python/Perl/C/C++. You will use and gain experience in storage interface standards such as SATA, SAS, PCIe, and NVMe. The team utilizes the Agile development methodologies, therefore, excellent communication skills and the ability to work closely with team members, both locally and across the organization, is required.As a validation engineer, regular responsibilities include but are not be limited to:Develop, review, document, and maintain source code in Python/C/C++Analyze and develop validation tests for internal and external (customer) specificationsDefine, develop and implement firmware validation test plans and test content with deep comprehension of firmware algorithms and customer specificationsIntegrate tests into an automated test environment, and collaborate with test execution teams to drive validation plans/strategyReview, track and document test results and failuresTriage failures, recommend and/or implement solutionsWork closely with internal teams such as ASIC and firmware development to drive resolution of firmware and system bugsIdentify opportunities for improvements, and drive improved validation methodologies within the teamWork with project stakeholders to turn product requirements into development and validation plansParticipate in and role model an Agile/Kanban development culture which emphasizes product quality, team accountability, and continuous improvementCoordinate priorities and activities with other engineering stakeholders to accomplish committed milestonesA successful candidate will demonstrate:The ability to listen, understand and respond professionally to partner questions and issues while building trustExcellent reporting and presentation skillsA history of self-starting and effective multitasking, with strong influencing and leadership skillsQualificationsCandidates must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Requirements listed below would be obtained through a combination of schoolwork/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.Minimum Requirements:The candidate must have a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, or a related engineering field.Documentation related to bachelor’s degree completion will be required.4+ years of experience in the following areas:Software or firmware development experience in an embedded systems validation environment with programming in Python/C/C++Experience in developing, reviewing, and implementing test plansKnowledge of software validation concepts and coverage analysis toolsDeveloping unit tests for code coverage and quality validationPreferred Requirements:Storage industry (SSDs or enterprise storage)Validation development techniques utilizing hardware and firmware toolsExposure to commercial product development/validation environmentStructured software development and practices, analytical problem solving, innovation and a mindset of continuous improvementEnterprise storage interface protocols (e.g., SATA, SAS, PCIe, and NVMe)SSD or enterprise storage device security protocols and techniques (e.g., Opal, ESSC, and AES)Software/firmware development processes including workflow and continuous integration validationDevOps process strategies, tools and execution, from code check-in through Continuous Integration and Continuous DeliveryProject planning, estimation, and risk managementCustomer requirements definition, clarification, and technical assessmentInside this Business GroupEmployees in Intel's NAND Product Group deliver solutions that are transforming computing across all segments from data centers to Ultrabooks. They invent, develop, bring to market and support customers with leading-edge NAND flash memory and system level solutions such as solid state drives (SSDs). SSDs are accelerating performance for gaming enthusiasts, reducing total cost of ownership for IT managers of data centers and improving security and reliability for businesses. This dynamic group is strategically positioned to become the leading Non-Volatile Memory solution supplier for the compute segment and is a key to expanding markets and continuing the growth for Intel.

Job Title: System Software Engineer - C / C++ / Rust / Kernel - Linux container technology
Job Description: We are hiring a systems-level C programmer to focus performance critical, and security-critical, low level system libraries critical to Linux container capabilities. We are also interested in Rust for system-level programming in Ubuntu and more widely in Canonical.The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.What you will doDesign, implement and document features in low level system container libraries (LXC and LXCFS)Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system testsCollaborate proactively with a distributed teamDiscuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutionsWho you areYou are curious, flexible, articulate and accountableYou value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivatedYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have experience with system programming in C on LinuxYou have knowledge or interest in Linux kernel features like namespaces, cgroups, networking or storageYou have experience with two or more of cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community.Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.#LI-Remote #Stack

Job DescriptionThis position is in Mexico, Guadalajara and will be working with the Fort Collins, CO Xeon CPU Design team. We are looking to hire an Experienced Verification Engineer with strong software development and debug skills.In this role you will:Perform SOC pre-silicon verification tasks across both Simulation and Emulation, which includes validating the design and micro-architectural implementation and assumptionsDefine SoC pre-silicon verification plansDevelop testbench infrastructure (monitors, scoreboards/checkers, BFMs, etc) and validation content (test cases, sequences, etc) to close on pre-silicon verification requirementsCoordinate with other team members to align on deliverable expectations and dependenciesCollaborate with design and architecture teams to ensure alignment on feature scoping, staging, and verification coverageCreate, enhance, or support software tools to improve verification qualityThe ideal candidate should also have:A willingness to multitask and work in dynamic and team-oriented environmentKnowledge of Firmware and Hardware-Firmware interactionStrong written and verbal communication skillsQualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:The candidate must have a Bachelor's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science and 4+ years of experience in the industry (Pre/Post Silicon Design) -OR- a Master's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or Computer Science and 3+ years of experience in the industry (Pre/Post Silicon Design). "Cedula Profesional" may be required.Preferred Qualifications:Object-Oriented Programming expertise (System Verilog preferred) as well as expertise with RTL (Verilog or VHDL) and one or more validation methodologies (OVM or UVM)Scripting skills; preferred languages are Perl and PythonBring expert debug and problem-solving skills relevant to Intel server verification build and run tool flows and willingness to quickly apply prior knowledge to immediate program needsInside this Business GroupThe Design Engineering Group is a worldwide organization focused on the development and integration of SOCs, Cores, and critical IPs that power Intel's leadership products. This business group leverages an incomparable mix of experts with different backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to unleash the most innovative, amazing, and exciting computing experiences.Inside this Business GroupXeon and Networking Engineering (XNE) focuses on the development and integration of XEON and Networking SOC's and critical IP's sustain Intels Xeon and 5G networking roadmap.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Job Title: Software Engineer - Entry User Interfaces Flight Management Systems

The ADAS SW Senior Staff engineer will define the roadmap and quote feasibility and profitability for upcoming business opportunities for Lidar products and systems.ResponsibilitiesExecute quotation for upcoming business opportunities.Obtain, collect and summarize the stakeholder requests (RFQ Data) in Quote documentation and support disciplines to define quotation approach.Support the technical quotation kick-off meeting and present the result of the quote strategy.Perform Short RE engineering as an initial review for all stakeholder documents as well as collect stakeholder needs and constraints to reduce the risk of quotation.Decide System product variant as well as decide roadmap compliance and deviation for the product.Create Customer information concerning technical assumptions.Create Engineering cost estimation concept.Create Bill of Material.Provide realistic timing schedule sample planIdentify technologies with IPD (Intellectual Property Department)Handover of strategy to development team.Support architecture, integration or development activities for running projects when quotations deliverables are completed.

Job Title: System Validation Engineer with CPU experience
Job Description: Job DescriptionBe part of the SoC Platform Validation team within Data Platforms Group.Looking for a Senior Validation Engineer.In this position, you will be working as a member of the DPEA Platform Validation Team responsible for ensuring the datacenter platforms meet our customer quality expectations. You will make recommendations to the business on release readiness.The role requires broad understanding of CPU and system level architecture. The job will demand interaction with Architecture, Design, and Silicon Validation teams to analyze requirements and improve product test content at system level. The focus of the validation in this role implies the verification and integration of server components across various customer HW/FW configurations. Additionally, validation will include simulation of customer environments with application workloads, use cases, platform level stress and system level performance.Key attributes and activities to be perform in this role:Lead debug of platform level issues involving CPU flows and drive them to resolution.Validation pathfinding activities involving CPU core interoperability.Capacity to produce domain coexistent and customer value add type of test cases.Be a voice and enforcer of the health and quality of the products.Drive key defects resolution, leading corresponding taskforces.Constantly improve testing coverage based on success criteria metrics and status.Planning, developing and executing Systems Engineering Best Practices.Participating in Product planning and release meetings providing input and decisions.Engaging with architecture and various cross-team validation organizations to define test plans.Be a role model for the organization and junior engineers.Behavioral traits:Advanced English communications skills.Proven logical solving problem skills,Strong teamwork skillsWilling to participate and create a good working environment.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum qualifications:Candidate will have a minimum of a B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar stream.3+ years of technical and debug knowledge at CPU and system level.3+ years of PC architecture and system level validation.2+ years of CPU hands on sys debug experience.2+ years of operating systems and FW understanding experience.Solid understanding of Intel architecture.Advanced English level.Inside this Business GroupThe Data Platforms Engineering and Architecture (DPEA) Group invents, designs & builds the world's most critical computing platforms which fuel Intel's most important business and solve the world's most fundamental problems. DPEA enables that data center which is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Company DescriptionIf you like challenges and willingness to overcome obstacles, we are looking for you!Bosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch, our operating areas are in four business sectors; mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology and energy and building technology.Discover in Bosch the ideal place for you.Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an Embedded Software Test Engineer (Entry Level) who is willing to work on a project where each team member contributes to the SW Development and Testing success of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) features. Technical curiosity paired with a passion for engineering is a must for this role, we are looking for someone who applies strategic problem solving and enables the team to understand even the most complex technical challenges down to the last bit. Eagerness to own Software testing activities, high-quality oriented processes and innovation initiatives.ObjectiveEmbedded SW Testing Activities for Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) SW Projects.ResponsibilitiesEmbedded Software Test: test execution, automation and documentation for Driver Assistance products.Requirement/implementation/feature testing.Test management, configuration management and documentation.Follow quality process for software development testing according to ISO26262 and ASPICEQualificationsBasic Experience in automation and execution of test specifications/scriptsBasic Experience in usage of Test and Measurement Equipment’sBasic CAN protocolKnowledge of Configuration management toolsBasic Scripting and automation techniques are an advantageVehicle networking is an advantageVery good problem solving skillsVery good communication skills.Proactivity and commitment.Additional InformationDo you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe.Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 17,000 associates.We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.Welcome to Bosch!Vacancy applies to the referral program.

The ADAS Algorithm Development Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, maintainance and optimization of the algorithms used for the Perception segment, working with Radar technologies (and potentially others like Camera in the future) in order to process its outputs to describe the enviroment and its characteristics according to customer requirements (signal processing, object tracking and classification, etc.). She/he will actively work with internal and external engineering teams to bring high-quality products into production.A tipical day involves analyzing issues in our simulation tools, implementing fixes and optimizations in C, and developing new code for our software solution (at application level of Autosar)Main Responsibilities:Perform requirements analysis and translate them into optimal implementationsDevelop embedded sensor algorithms to meet product requirements.Analyze issues, find root causes and fix bugs in a creative way to optimize the performance of our algorithmsUtilize advanced data analysis techniques to provide insight and inspire future development to improve our productPerform quality tasks in our implementations such as code reviews, unit tests and complying with highest code standards

Job Title: Embedded and Linux Software Systems Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionAre you passionate about software development? Would you like to have an opportunity to develop your software design skills with hands on projects, product evaluation, code reviews and training courses?In this position, you will be joining the Customer Experience Group as a software applications Engineer specializing in systems featuring the entire software stack from processor boot loader to device drivers to host application software.You will be part of passionate and highly talented team of applications engineers working on cutting edge next generation technologies.A successful candidate is a talented aspiring software designer who is ready to take the challenge of working hands-on with systems that feature FPGAs, memory, host PCIe (Peripheral Component Interconnect Express), networking (for example: Ethernet MAC (Media Access Controller), etc.), and custom IP.Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:Providing feedback on Intel Programmable Solutions Group's (PSG) software stack offerings with Intel Open FPGA Stack and insights on how to make it easy to understand and to use.Developing technical assets such as user guides, application notes, design examples, demos, and training that will enable users to successfully design with our software.Responding to customer technical questions, debug, reproduce customer issues, and drive issue resolution.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Willingness to create customer ready material (including strong technical writing and communication skills).Driving an issue to resolution by working with a cross-functional group of stakeholders.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, and/or internship experience. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related STEM fields (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Advanced English level.1+ year of experience with software development using C/C++ for systems featuring software and hardware (e.g. IP cores), tools and debugPreferred Qualifications:Experience with bootloader software for embedded processors (e.g. U-boot, UEFI) and BIOS.Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals (I2C, UART, SPI, CAN etc.)Experience with BareMetal and Linux device driver development for embedded peripherals high performance peripherals such as PCIe with Virtualization, DMAExperience with system level debug for issues featuring both processors and FPGA.Experience with host software stacks for infrastructure processing e.g. OvS, DPDK (Data Plane Development Kit), SPDK (Storage Performance Development Kit), Linux based virtualization, and orchestration.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need.

Job DescriptionLeads the creation, implementation, and optimization of software tools in support of various domains including design, manufacturing, validation, silicon production, systems integration, software application products, or ecosystem enabling. Utilizes modern software development methodologies, programming languages, domain knowledge, and secure coding practices to design, develop, debug, and/or validate algorithms, software tools, and systems that enable our internal/external engineering partners to design/manufacture intel silicon, integrate Intel silicon and/or software into impactful products. Examples of tools/systems include debuggers, analyzers, SDKs, IDEs, PDKs, performance monitors, software tools and libraries, flows, and/or methodologies for design, manufacturing, validation, and test.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's OR Master's, in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering, with 3+ years of active experience in large-scale software development. ("Cedula Profesional" may be required).The 3+ years of experience can be a mix of the following:3+ years of actively developing in C, C++ , Python or similar languages.2+ years of Computer Architecture knowledge of computer systems including multicore CPUs or GPUs, memory subsystem, interconnects, IO devices.2+ years of experience with modern computer operating systems (Linux, Chrome or Windows).3+ years of working in software development teams using team collaboration tools for repository storage, testing, issues and project tracking.Preferred QualificationsPh. D. in Computer Science or Computer/Electrical Engineering or relevant engineering field.Inside this Business GroupEnable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software.Other LocationsMexico, Mexico CityWork Model for this RoleThis role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need.

The ADAS Embedded Software team requires an experienced SW engineer with vast experience analyzing requirements, developing and debugging code by many means, understanding hardware architecture, hardware communication protocols, complex software development topics. Our software engineers actively work in teams to create and update software components of Driving Assistance products that are being developed or already are in production or commercial use.Our engineers are part of a multidisciplinary and global community responsible for the design, integration and maintenance of Continental products using the AutoSAR framework with presence in several software components such as diagnostics, error handling, communications, cybersecurity, memory management, power management in electromagnetic radars and/or vehicle control systems.Additional responsibilitiesDevelop embedded sensor software to meet product requirementsPlanning and organizing test commitments and activities for specific projectsMaintain correspondence with multiple engineering teams, both national and foreign.Develop sustainable software and support other teams in charge of its verificationMaintain a thorough understand of customer and product requirementsBe part of the technical development of other engineers by training them or helping them to understand the technical needs of our productsBreakdown technical topics and requirements to provide guidance to younger engineers on how to perform their work effectivelyFollow the Continental development life cycle process, including development and QA activities

Continental Engineering Services (CES) is seeking for an AUTOSAR Software Engineer. As an AUTOSAR software developer for automotive applications you will be integral part of a global and diverse team for the next generation of vehicles. Our engineer will be responsible for software decisions, analyze requirements, configure BSW (Basic Software), integrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules, assist customer in resolving configuration errors, design software architecture, maintenance of different AUTOSAR components and many other specific applications for projects within the Chassis & Safety division such as:Advanced Electronic Brake Systems: our engineers work with Continental’s advances brake unit to maintain, and develop solutions that are benchmark in the industry such as Antilock braking, traction and stability control, regenerative braking to enhance electric and hybrid vehicles cruising range, supporting ADAS functions to brake autonomously the vehicle in emergency situations, etc.Automated Driver Assistance Systems: with the help of our advanced environment sensors, lidars, cameras and radars our software engineer contribute to provide solutions for driver assistance and automated driving functions such as blind spot detection, driver monitoring, emergency break assist, intelligent headlight assist, surround views, etc.Active Damping Control Systems: CES engineers requires to work with state-of-the-art technologies with AUTOSAR architecture to solve the conflicts that exist between optimal riding comfort and agile handling by creating software to adjust damping force on every wheel depending load and driving conditions.Airbag Controllers and other safety solutions: our engineer also focus in occupant protections such airbag controller, adapting platform to customer needs and government regulations, the design of software with impressive quality is required in these products to make sure our software saves lives when accident occur.Our AUTOSAR Software engineers share common goals to drive and contribute to the automotive industry with the goal to protect all people inside and outside the vehicle, to innovate in mobility solutions, and ultimately, achieve Continental’s Vision Zero: zero fatalities, zero injuries, zero accidents.Core Responsibilities:AUTOSAR Software development tasksGather and analyze OEMs Software RequirementsPerform software testing to detect functional, logic or implementation errorsConfigure BSW (Basic Software) according with OEMs requirementsIntegrate 3rd party AUTOSAR or legacy modules with different AutoCore tools (e.g. EB Tressos, Davinci, etc.)Analyze customer bug reports and provide solutionsWork with diverse teamsEstimate work package efforts. Evaluate the impact of engineering modifications in the software.Coach/support team membersAdditional Responsibilities:Flexibility to work in variety of different automotive projectsSoftware Project Technical Lead tasksSupport technical discussions with customerSupport/Test the developed modules in the vehicleSupport requirements engineering and elicitation processesPerform unit testing and software debuggingAssistance with other tasks as needed and determined by ManagementDocumentation of detail software development plan, test plans, test design, analysis, computer modeling, prototype/production test scripts and specification releasesDefine strategies to continuously improve processes and tools.

Job Title: Senior Software Dev Engineer, Concept to Launch
Job Description: Job summaryAmazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers groundbreaking devices used by Amazon and by our customers. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have created new device categories like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?The Concept to Launch (C2L) team’s mission is to make it incredibly simple to create, build and launch innovative, new-to-world devices in record time. We build technology to automate and scale the end-to-end product development process for all Amazon devices, from your favorite Kindle e-reader to the next generation of Alexa-enabled products. As part of our team, you'll design and build software that powers the innovation flywheel for Amazon Devices, transforming new Think Big ideas into the products our customers know and love—at Amazon speed and scale!As a Senior Software Development Engineer on the team, you will be responsible for:Defining the technology strategy and architecture for a greenfield initiativeWorking across a broad range of AWS technologies to build full-stack web applications, distributed systems software, cloud services platforms and automation workflowsDesigning and developing simple software solutions to complex problemsCollaborating with a diverse range of cross-functional roles, including engineering, product, customers and business stakeholders across the company to define our engineering strategy and push projects forwardCoaching and mentoring other engineers to develop their software engineering skillsetPromoting a culture of engineering excellence by establishing best practices and technical standards across the organizationConsulting with engineers from across the organization on architecture and design of new systems to solving some of our hardest engineering problemsDevelopment experience with AWS services such as AWS CloudFormation, EC2, API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDBDesign and development experience with horizontally scaling systemsExcellent track record of shipping software as a software engineer or technical leadA proven ability to learn new domains and demonstrate leadershipExcellent written and verbal communication skills addressing technical and non-technical audiencesMeets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this roleMeets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Specifically, single and multi-threaded programming and packages for file management3+ months of experience with Git version controlExposure to C/C++ and object-oriented OOP programmingWork experience following a Software Development LifeCycleAdvanced English Level (spoken and written)Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of NoSQL databasesKnowledge of HTML REST APIInside this Business GroupThe everyday contributions of the Intel Validation Engineering (iVE) team are essential to retaining/regaining Intel's product leadership. We play a critical role in completing the PRQs of Intel products and in Intel's ability to deliver the annual technology platforms in our roadmap.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

Job Title: High Level Design Software Applications Engineer
Job Description: Job DescriptionHave you worked on High Level Design (HLD) C++ applications or implemented HLD acceleration systems? Do you love collaborating with internal teams and helping customers with their end products? Is it exciting to work in a diverse team that spans multiple domains and vertical markets? Do you want to make valuable contributions to the team that helps identify market trends, then help influence next generation products and solutions?As a business unit within Intel, we will continue to apply Moore's Law to drive the future of field-programmable gate array (FPGA) technology. The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) has been delivering industry-leading custom logic solutions to customers since inventing the world's first reprogrammable logic device in 1984. To take advantage of the many opportunities in the future for FPGA's, PSG is looking for an outstanding High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer to join our Customer Experience Group (CEG) team specializing in HLD development using DPC++, oneAPI, FPGA Design, Flows, and Debug.As a High Level Design (HLD) Software Applications Engineer in CEG, you will be responsible to support Intel FPGA solutions proactively to enable customers to quickly get their solutions to market. Additionally, you will interface directly with cross functional teams to contribute to the next generation product definition, identify market trends and direction, and quickly resolve complex technical issues to allow customers to meet the market demands.Your specific role includes, but is not limited to:Providing guidance from a customer and systems perspective to cross functional teams to create optimal solutions.Creating demos to showcase the capabilities of Intel PSG solutions.Handling customer escalations to provide solutions to meet customer requirements and working directly with development teams to build improved solutions in the future.Providing product readiness feedback as an early user to cross functional teams and managing efforts to improve the product.Developing reference designs or subcomponents to align with key market strategies, which allows customers to evaluate the technology while offering a starting point for their project.Driving the strategy of new technology training for both internal and external audiences.Authoring documentation and other applicable materials to explain products and solutions.The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Attention to detail.Analytical and problem-solving skills.Be self-motivated.Work effectively in a team environment.Communication and interpersonal skills.QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum education requirements and minimum required qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes, project work, internships, and/or military experience. Additional preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Minimum Qualifications:Candidate must possess a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related STEM field (documentation related to Bachelor's degree completion will be required).Intermediate to advanced English.3+ months of experience in either of the following:Area within C++, computational, algorithmic, and/or area related to CPU/GPU/FPGA/etc.High Level Design Tools, Vitis, HLS (High Level Synthesis), oneAPI, Mathworks, DSPBuilder, Quartus, Vivado, or related.Preferred QualificationsExperience in an area related to C++.Experience working on customer engagements, applications development.Experience with code optimization using parallelism, pipelining, memory management, concurrency, and multi-threading.Experience with Embedded Systems.Experience with oneAPI, OpenCL, HLS, Quartus, and other FPGA centric design flows and tools.Experience in HDL (Hardware Description Language), verification, and general computational logic design/verification concepts.Experience with Git and development tools.Experience in with computational algorithms theory.Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.Work Model for this RoleThis role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

#Engineering #Testing # Software #Electronics #Computing #MechatronicThe ADAS (Advanced Driving Assistance Systems) Algorithm Test Engineer will be responsible for performing requirements analysis, creating test cases and automate the tests cases as much as possible, in order to efficiently validate the Algorithms developed for ADAS systems and provide useful statistics and information for the development of these algorithms.In ADAS Business Unit, we are developing cutting edge technologies to drive the future of mobility in the world, you will be part of a team that validates these new technologies. With your collaboration you will help Continental to save millions of lives around the world.Main responsibilities:Analyze requirements and design test cases which thoroughly validate these requirements.Responsible to write test scripts (in python) to automate tests and processes as much as possible.Adapt existing test scripts to changes in requirements.Execute manual and automated tests.Provide statistical information and functional status to developers, to improve the algorithms.Report and follow up to defects found in the Algorithms.Support software developer in root cause analysis when needed.

The Facilitator Release Train Engineer as a part of the agile release train management team drives and foster the Agile methodology and team interaction for a product specific purpose.She/He is ensuring qualitative development by facilitating agreed upon methods conformance and facilitate a continuous improvement of the whole trainResponsibilitiesCoaching and alignment of the Product Manager, Customers and Business Owners to understand agility as well as the development of an agile mindset.Coaches the Product Managers and the associated teams to have a common basic understanding of process, principle and used methods (e.g. integration testing or requirements).Assists stakeholders with economic decision-making by guiding features and capabilities estimation.Brings the Agile Release Train into a self-sustaining state (self-organizing, self-managing teams, and collaborating teams).Facilitates agile ceremonies, e.g., the Product Increment planning event, Inspect and Adapt Workshop, and System Demo.Facilitates Product Increment Planning readiness.Supports proper team setup/organization and knowledge, skill and competency distribution.Develops Agile Teams, which may be distributed over multiple locations and roles like collaboration with architecture team.Identify, own and remove impediments of the agile release train to optimize the flow of value through the teams. Escalate and track impediments to Solution Train Engineers or line management in case an own clarification was not successful.Drives the Agile Release Train efforts in relentless improvement (e.g. via Inspect and Adapt workshops) and challenges the team actively to improve their efficiency, i.e. by increasing automation rate.Assists tracking the execution of features and capabilities by monitoring the overall performance of the ART in order to ensure a continuously improving development flow in assistance to the Product Management.Foster relentless improvement.Acts as interface and guide to the non-agile world to protect the Agile Teams and the Agile Release Train.Summarizes and publish Program Increment objectives for visibility and transparency.Ensure alignment between disciplines.Supports proper Release Train setup/organization.
